materials: RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 2 balls 1946 Persimmon
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Wrap measures 12” wide x 66” long (30.5 x 167.5 cm)
gauge: 1 Flower Motif = 5¾” (14.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Krysia Flower and 
Diamond Wrap
Add a little something extra to a plain outfit 
with this elegant shawl. Crocheted in this 
shaded yarn with a bit of sparkle, you’ll feel 
as good wearing it as you look.
Round 3 for first motif (not joined to any 
neighboring motif): Slip st in next 4 ch of first 
ch-8 space, sc in same ch-8 space, [ch 8, sc 
in 3rd ch from hook (picot made), ch 5, sc in 
next ch-8 space] 7 times, ch 8, sc in 3rd ch 
from hook (picot made), ch 5; join with slip st 
in first sc—8 picots. Fasten off. 
Round 3 for 2-picot join in same neighboring 
motif: Slip st in first 4 ch of first ch-8 space, 
sc in same ch-space, [ch 6, slip st in next 
picot of neighboring motif, ch 1, skip next ch 
of current motif, sc in next ch (picot made), 
ch 5, sc in next ch-8 space] twice, [ch 8, sc in 
3rd ch from hook (picot made), ch 5, sc in next 
ch-8 space] 5 times, ch 8, sc in 3rd ch from 
hook (picot made), ch 5; join with slip st in 
first sc—8 picots. Fasten off. 
Round 3 for 4-picot join in 2 neighboring 
motifs: Slip st in first 4 ch of first ch-8 space, 
sc in same ch-space, *[ch 6, slip st in next 
picot of neighboring motif, ch 1, skip next ch 
of current motif, sc in next ch (picot made), ch 
5, sc in next ch-8 space] twice; repeat from 
* twice in next neighboring motif, [ch 8, sc in
3rd ch from hook (picot made), ch 5, sc in next
ch-8 space] 3 times, ch 8, sc in 3rd ch from
hook (picot made), ch 5; join with slip st in
first sc—8 picots. Fasten off.
Diamond (make 9)
Ch 4; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first 
dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ring, [ch 2, 
3 dc] 3 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—12 dc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Wrap measures 12” wide x 66” long  
(30.5 x 167.5 cm)
WRAP
Notes
1. Wrap is made from 20 flower motifs and 9
diamond motifs.
2. Motifs are joined together using a join-as-
you-go technique while working the last
round.
3. All motifs are worked in joined rounds with
right side facing at all times.
4. First flower motif is made, then additional
flower motifs are joined as the final round
is crocheted. Each additional motif will be
joined to 1 or 2 neighboring motifs through
2 or 4 picots, respectively.
5. After all flower motifs are joined, diamond
motifs are joined to the open spaces
between each group of 4 flower motifs.
Flower (make 20)
Ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join 
with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc as join, [ch 8, 
sc in next sc] 7 times, ch 8; join with slip st in 
first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-8 sps.
Notes
1. Before working Round 3, refer to Assembly
Diagram for placement of motif. Note the
number of picots to which the current motif
should be joined and work the appropriate
Round 3.
2. When joining neighboring motifs, hold
motifs with wrong sides together, stitches
matching, and right side of current motif
facing you.

Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, (2 dc, ch 1, 
slip st around join between first 2 flower 
motifs, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, dc 
in next 3 dc, [(2 dc, ch 1, slip st around join 
between next 2 flower motifs, ch 1, 2 dc) in 
next ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc] twice, (2 dc, 
ch 1, slip st around join between last 2 flower 
motifs, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space; join 
with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—28 dc 
and 4 ch-spaces. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Edging 
With right side and long edge facing, join yarn 
with sc in first picot. 
Round 1: Ch 3, sc in 3rd ch from hook, *ch 6, 
sc in next picot, ch 3, sc in 3rd ch from hook; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in first 
sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Colorama Halo™ Perfect Phasing™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Tin and Tan (76031) 3 balls or 1155 yds/1050 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Tr3tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times in indicated st. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch –Tr3tog made.

Tr6tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next tr. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times. Skip next (ch 1, sc, ch 1). [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next tr. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 7 loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch - Tr6tog made
gauge: 11.5 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 2 pat reps = 6" [15 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• First section of Scarf works with first ball, beg with darker shade indicated and letting colors change as you go.
• Second section of Scarf works with second ball, beg with lighter shade indicated and letting colors change as you go.
• Third section of Scarf works with first ball, beg with darker shade indicated and letting colors change as you go.
• Ch 4 at beg of row counts as tr.
Scallop edge
See diagram on page 3. 
Foundation row:  (RS). Beg with darker shade of first ball, ch 4. Tr3tog in 4th ch from hook. *Ch 4. Tr3tog in top of previous cluster. Rep from * 16 times more. Turn.  18 Tr Clusters. 
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 4. 3 tr in top of last Tr3tog. *Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Tr3tog. Ch 1. (3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in top of next cluster. Rep from * to last Tr3tog. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of next Tr3tog. Ch 1. Skip last Tr3tog. 4 tr in first ch of first Tr3tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in top of first tr. *Ch 5. Tr6tog over next 6 tr. Ch 5. 1 sc in ch-3 sp. Rep from * ending with 1 sc in top of turning ch 4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-5 sp. (3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in top of next tr6tog. Ch 1. Skip next ch-5. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4. Skip next sc. Tr3tog over next 3 tr. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Tr6tog over next 6 tr. Rep from * to last (ch-3, 3 tr, ch 1, sc). Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Tr3tog over next 3 tr. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 4. 3 tr in top of last Tr3tog. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-5 sp. (3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in top of next cluster. Rep from * to last Tr3tog. Skip last Tr3tog. 4 tr in top of turning ch 4. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat, until entire ball is used, ending with lighter color.
Join lighter end of 2nd ball and cont in pat, until entire ball is used, ending with darker color. Join darker end of 3rd ball and cont in pat, until approx 45 yds [42 m] of yarn left for Scallop Edging, ending on a 2nd or 4th row.
Scallop Edging
Next row:  Ch 4. Tr3tog in top of last sc. *Skip next ch-5 sp. Sl st to top of next st. Ch 4. Tr3tog in same sp as sl st. Rep from * to end of row, ending with sl st to last sc. Fasten off. 16 Tr Clusters.

materials: Red Heart® Roll With It Melange™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 389 yds/356 m) Show Time (0752) 4 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates™ Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Puff st = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through 8 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 remaining loops on hook to close stitch
measurements: Approx 23" x 63" [58.5 x 160 cm]
gauge: 15 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. Shawl is reversible, there is no RS or WS. Foundation Strip: Ch 3. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st. 1 dc) in 3rd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in (next Puff st and ch-2 sp). Ch 3. (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st) in same sp as last sl st. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st. 1 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Do not turn.

Working across long side of Foundation Strip, proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 2. (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st) around post of first dc – Cluster made. *3 dc around post of next dc. Rep from * to last row of puffs. Cluster around post of last dc. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Cluster in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last cluster. Cluster in last Cluster. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Cluster in same sp as sl st. Skip next ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. 3 dcbp around next dc. Skip next 2 dc and ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last Cluster. Ch 3. Cluster in last Cluster. Turn.
4th row: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Cluster in same sp as sl st. Skip next ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. 3 dcbp around first st of 3 dcbp group. Skip next 2 sts and ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last Cluster. Ch 3. Cluster in last Cluster. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures approx 64" [162.5 cm]
Next row: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Cluster in same sp as sl st. Skip next ch-3 sp. *3 dcbp around first st of 3 dcbp group. Skip next 2 sts and ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last Cluster. Cluster in last Cluster. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. Puff st to top of first Puff st. Skip next ch-2 sp. Sl st in top of next puff st. *Ch 3. Puff st in same sp as sl st. Skip next 2 dcbp. Sl st to next dcbp. Rep from * to last Cluster. Ch 3. Puff st in same sp as sl st. Skip next Puff st. Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Puff st in same sp as sl st. Sl st in last Puff st. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Big Donut™ O’Go™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 502 yds/459 m) Main Color (MC) Vanilla Glaze (29015) 2 O’Gos
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 69" [179 cm] long.
gauge: 16 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Hdc/Ch-1 Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.

Stripe Pat I
Work 6 rows each color in the following sequence: A, B, C, D, E. These 30 rows form Stripe Pat I.

Stripe Pat II
Work 8 rows with A.
Work 8 rows with B.
Work 4 rows with C. These 20 rows form Stripe Pat II.

Stripe Pat III
Work 8 rows with E.
Work 8 rows with D.
Work 4 rows with C. These 20 rows form Stripe Pat II.

Left Side of Shawl Center Section: With MC, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in 4th ch from hook. Turn. 6 dc. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in first dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. Ch 1. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc.) in next ch-2 sp. PM on ch-2 sp for center. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in last dc. Turn. 7 sts (hdc and ch-1 sp) at each side of center ch-2 sp.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn. 11 sts (hdc and ch-1 sp) at each side of center ch-2 sp.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp.* Rep from * to * to last hdc before ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * to last hdc and turning ch-3. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn. 13 sts (hdc and ch-1 sp) at each side of center ch-2 sp.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp.* Rep from * to * to last hdc before ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * to last hdc and turning ch-3. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn. 17 sts (hdc and ch-1 sps) at each side of center ch-2 sp.

Rep last 2 rows 7 times more, then 4th row once. 61 sts (hdc and ch-1 sp) at each side of center ch-2 sp, ending on a WS row. Join A. Break MC.

Section 1
Proceed in Stripe Pat I as follows:
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last hdc before ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in ch-2 sp. 63 sts (hdc and ch-1 sps). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as st). *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. Rep from * to last turning ch-3. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat I are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat I, rep last 2 rows until all 30 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. 122 sts. Join MC. Break E.

Section 2
1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 2 hdc. Ch 2 (counts ad hdc). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last turning ch-3. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from foundation ch-2 measures approx 29" [73.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Shape sides as follows: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in first hdc, ch-1 sp and next hdc. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 2 hdc. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Rep last row until 2 hdc rem. Fasten off.

Section 3
Following Diagram, with RS facing, skip post of first row at bottom corner of work of Section 1. Join A with sl st to post of next row. Proceed in Stripe Pat II as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Work (1 hdc. Ch 1) 29 times across side edge of Section 1. 1 hdc in corner ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last turning ch-3. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn. 122 sts (hdc and ch-1 sps).
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
3rd row: Sl st in first hdc, ch-1 sp and next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last turning ch-3. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn.
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat II are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat II, rep last 2 rows until all 20 rows of Stripe Pat II are complete. Fasten off.
Right Side of Shawl Work as given for Left Side of Shawl, substituting Stripe Pat III for Stripe Pat II and noting work reverses - RS will become WS and WS will become RS.

FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Flip Right Side of Shawl up-side down and with C, sew both Sides across Section 3.

materials: Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Pool Green (69010) 3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 23" x 60" [58.5 cm x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc throughout.
• Ch 2 sps count as 2 sts throughout.
• When working Filet Chevron Pat, work sts into ch-2 sp not into chains.
SHAWL
Ch 78 (multiple of 18 ch + 6).
See diagram on page 2.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 76 dc.
1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 7 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 6 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 10 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts) twice. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
7th row: As 3rd row.
8th row: As 2nd row.
9th row: As 1st row.
10th row: As 6th row.
11th row: As 5th row.
12th row: As 4th row.
These 12 rows form Filet Zigzag Pat.
Cont in pat until Shawl measures approx 60" [152.5 cm], ending on a 6th or 12th row of pat.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Do not turn. Do not fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around entire edge of Shawl, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Plentiful™ (10.6 oz/300 g; 952 yds/871 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Hdc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice (3 times). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Move marker to every center ch-3 sp.
• Shawl is worked from 2 ends of ball to achieve color-shifting effect; colors are changed at center of Shawl
Approx = Approximately
Beg = Beginning
Ch = Chain(s)
Cont = Continue(ity)
Dc = Double crochet
Hdc = Half double crochet
Hdc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice (3 times). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Inc’d = Increased
PM = Place marker
Rep = Repeat
RS = Right side
Sc = Single crochet
Sl st = Slip stitch
Sp(s) = Space(s)
St(s) = Stitch(es)
WS = Wrong side
Y oh = Yarn over hook

ABBREVIATIONS
MATERIALS
Bernat® Plentiful™ (10.6 oz/300 g; 952 yds/871 m)
Dragon/f_l  y (19009) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

Triangle (see diagram on page 3).
With /f_i rst end as A, ch 4.
1st row: (WS). (3 dc. Ch 2. With 2nd end as B, 4 dc) in 4th ch from hook. Turn. 8 dc and ch-2 sp. Turn.
2nd row:  With second end as B, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 hdc each dc to ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. With A, ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. PM on ch-2 sp for center. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in top of ch 3. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
3rd row: With A, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 hdc in each hdc to center ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. Ch 2. With B, 2 hdc) in center ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
4th row: With B, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 dcbp around each hdc to center ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. With A, ch 2. 2 hdc) in center ch-2 sp. 1 dcbp around each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
5th row: With A, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst st. 1 hdc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. Ch 2. With B, 2 hdc) in center ch-2 sp. 1/uni00A0hdc in each st to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
6th row: With B, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 hdc each hdc to ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. With A, ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
7th row: With A, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 dcfp around each hdc to center ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. With B, ch 2. 2 hdc) in center ch-2 sp. 1 dcfp around each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
8th row: With B, ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 hdc each st to ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. With A, ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each st to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 6 sts inc’d.
Rep 3rd to 8th rows, until work from beg, along center measures approx 28"  [73.5 cm], ending on 7th row.

Shape Right Side of Shawl:
Note: Work with second end as B only.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst st. 1 hdc in each st to last st before center ch-2 sp. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 dcbp around each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
8th row: As 2nd row.
9th row: As 5th row.
**Rep 2nd to 9th rows for pat until longer side from foundation ch measures 33” [84 cm], ending on a WS row.
Keeping cont of pat, dec both sides as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row until 3 sts rem.
Next row: Hdc3tog. Fasten oﬀ .**

Shape Left Side of Shawl:
Note: Work with /f_i rst end as A only.
1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st to center ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 dcbp around each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first dc. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in /f_i rst dc. 1 dcfp around each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
8th row: As 2nd row.
9th row: As 5th row.
Rep from ** to ** as given for Right Side.

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 186 yds/170 m) Vineyard (5628) 3 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size fits most. Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 58" [147.5 cm] long before seaming.
gauge: 15 sts and 8 rows = 4" in Pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 61. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 5. Skip next ch-3 sp, next sc, and next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Pat. Cont in Pat until work from beg measures approx 58" [147.5 cm], ending on RS row. Do not fasten off.
Border:
1st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. *1 sc in each st and ch to end of row. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in corner. Work sc evenly down side of Wrap to next corner. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in corner. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS facing, PM 16" [40.5 cm] from top right corner of Wrap. Fold, matching point A to B and point C to point D as indicated in Schematic. Seam sections tog.
Neckline Edging
Join yarn with sl st to any st along neckline of Wrap.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Bottom Hem
Join yarn with sl st to any st along bottom of Wrap.
Work as given for Neckline Edging. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Colorama Lacy™ (8 oz/227 g; 361 yds/330 m) Aloe (11001) 2 balls or 614 yds/561 m
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Size U.S. 50 [25 mm] Susan Bates® circular knitting needle 29" [73.5 cm] long
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] deep, excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Broomstick Lace Pat.
instructions:
Ch 4. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Do not turn. 3 sc. 
2nd row: Place loop from hook onto knitting needle. Skip first sc. Draw up a long loop in next sc and place on knitting needle. Draw up a long loop in final sc and place on knitting needle. Do not turn. 3 loops on needle. 
3rd row: Insert hook through all 3 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. 3 sc in center of group of 3 loops. Do not turn. 
4th row: Ch 3. Place loop from hook onto knitting needle. Draw up a long loop in each of 2nd and 3rd ch from hook and place on knitting needle. *Draw up a long loop in next sc and place on knitting needle. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 6 loops on needle. 
5th row: Insert hook through first 3 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. 3 sc in center of group of 3 loops. Insert hook through next 3 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook —sc made. 2 sc in center of group of 3 loops. Do not turn. 
6th row: As 4th row. 9 loops on needle. 
7th row: Insert hook through first 3 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. 3 sc in center of group of 3 loops. *Insert hook through next 3 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook —sc made. 2 sc in center of group of 3 loops. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 
8th to 61st rows: Rep 6th and 7th rows 27 times. 30 groups of 3-sc at end of 61st row. 
62nd row: Sl st in each of first 4 sc. Place loop from hook onto knitting needle. *Draw up a long loop in next sc and place on knitting needle. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 87 loops on needle. 
63rd row: As 7th row. 
64th to 119th rows: Rep 62nd and 63rd rows 28 times. 1 group of 3-sc rem at end of 119th row. 
Fasten off. 
Fringe
Cut lengths of yarn 14" [35.5 cm]. Taking 4 strands tog, knot into fringe into sides of 3-loop groups along lower edge of Shawl as shown. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® Cotton Funnel Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 425 yds/389 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 78 x 36" [198 cm x 91.5 cm].
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc throughout.
Ch 4 at beg of rows counts as 1 dc and ch-1 throughout.
Ch 4.
1st row: (WS). 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. 5 dc. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 7 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 4 dc and 3 sps.
4th row: Ch 3. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in each st and sp to end of row. 11 sts. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 19 sts.
**Next row: Ch 3. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in each st and sp to last 6 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Rep 3rd and 4th rows twice more, then 3rd row once.**
Rep from ** to ** until work from beg measures approx 70" [178 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Infinity™: 8 balls 9530 Enchanted
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shrug measures 44 x 36” (112 x 91.5 cm) before folding and seaming.
gauge: 4 shells = 5” (12.5 cm); 6 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
SHRUG
Fsc 102.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, 3 dc in next st, *skip next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st—104 dc (Thirty-four 3-dc groups and a dc at beg and end of row).
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, shell in center dc of each 3-dc group across, dc in top of turning ch—34 shells.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, 3 dc in center dc of each shell across, dc in top of turning ch.
Rows 4–53: Repeat last 2 rows 25 more times.
Row 54: Repeat Row 2.
Row 55: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, *skip next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, skip next st, sc in last st—104 sc.
Fasten off.
SIDE EDGINGS
With right side facing and working in ends of rows across one side edge, join yarn with sc in end of first row, 2 sc in end of each row across to last row, sc in end of last row. Fasten off. Repeat across other side edge.
FINISHING
Fold piece in half, bringing first and last rows together and matching up stitches of side edging. Beginning at corner, sew side edges together for about 9½” (24 cm), leaving about 8½” (21.5 cm) unsewn at top for armhole opening.
Weave in ends.

abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Project measures: 15½ (28½)” [29.5, 72.5cm] in width, 78 (78)” [198 cm] in length. Project shown in shawl size.
gauge: 13 double crochet = 4" (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Chain 66 (108).
Row 1 (RS):  Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Turn- 67 (107) sc.
Row 2:  Stacked dc in first sc, dc in each of next 3 sc, place marker (note: move marker up with each row throughout), dcing in next 18(60) sc, [ch 3, skip 3 sc, dc in next 3 sc] 7 times, dc in last sc. Turn.
Row 3:  Stacked dc in first dc, [fpdc in next 3 dc, ch 3, skip ch-3 space] 7 times, dc in each dc across to marker, fpdc in next 3 dc, dc in last dc. Turn.
Row 4:  Stacked dc in first dc, bpdc in each of next 3 dc, dc in each dc across to ch-space, [ch 3, bpdc in next 3 dc] 7 times, dc in last dc. Turn.
Row 5:  Stacked dc in first dc, fpdc in each of next 3 dc, *ch 3, skip next 3 dc, fptrtr in next 3 dc, ch 3, fptrtr in 3 dc just skipped (note: place stitches in front of fptrtr just made) **, [ch 3, fpdc in next 3 dc] twice, repeat from * to **, ch 3, dc in each dc across to marker, fpdc in next 3 dc, dc in last dc. Turn.
Row 6:  Stacked dc in first dc, bpdc in each of next 3 dc, dc in each dc across to ch-space, *[ch 3, bpdc in next 3trtr] twice**, [ch 3, bpdc in next 3 dc] twice; repeat from * to **, ch 3, bpdc in each of next 3 dc, dc in last dc. Turn.
Row 7:  Repeat row 3.
Row 8:  Repeat row 4.
Row 9:  Stacked dc in first dc, [fpdc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3] 3 times, skip next 3 dc, fptrtr in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, fptrtr in each of 3 dc just skipped (note: place stitches behind fptrtr just made), [ch 3, fpdc in each of next 3 dc] twice, ch 3, dc in each dc across to marker, fpdc in each of next 3 dc, dc in last dc. Turn.
Row 10:  Repeat row 4.
Row 11:  Repeat row 3.
Row 12:  Repeat row 4.
Rows 13-148:  Repeat rows 5-12
Rows 149-155:  Repeat rows 5-11
Row 156:  Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends. Soak project in cool bath, wrap in towels and gently roll out water. Lay project out to schematic size and pin in place to dry.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Bamboo Crochet Thread, Size 10: 4 balls 275 Coral
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 44” (112 cm) wide (measured straight across at widest) and 22” (56 cm) long (from back neck to lower point, not including flowers)
gauge: 20 dc = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Fleur de Lis Shawl
Bordered with a delicate petite floral edging, this crocheted shawl just flows! Enjoy the soft comfort and drape of silky bamboo. It folds up compactly to go wherever you go! 
Row 4: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 7 times, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in top of turning ch, turn—10 dc and 9 ch-3 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, beg-shell in first ch-3 space, *ch 1, V-st in next ch-3 space, ch 1, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, turn—5 shells, 4 V-sts, and 8 ch-1 spaces.
Note: When working the next rows, skip the V-sts of the previous row, work into the ch-1 spaces between V-sts and the ch-2 spaces at the center of the shells only.
Row 6: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), beg-shell in first ch-2 space, *[ch 1, V-st in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1, shell in ch-2 space of next shell; repeat from * across, turn—5 shells, 8 V-sts (2 V-sts in each of 4 sections separated by shells), and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Place a marker in ch-2 space of each of the 5 shells.
Rows 7–40: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, move marker to ch-2 space of beg-shell just made, [*ch 1, V-st in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to next shell (marked), ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space of shell, move marker to ch-2 space of shell just made; repeat from * across, turn—5 shells, 144 V-sts (36 V-sts in each of 4 sections), and 148 ch-1 spaces.
Note: Continue to move markers up to ch-2 spaces of the 5 shells as each row is worked.
Row 41: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *dc in next dc, dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to next shell, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—5 shells, 580 dc (145 dc in each of 4 sections, not including the dc sts of the shells), and 8 ch-1 spaces.
Row 42: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to dc before next shell, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—74 dc and 75 ch-1 spaces in each of 4 sections.
Row 43: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to ch-1 space before next shell, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—76 dc and 77 ch-1 spaces in each of 4 sections.
Row 44: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, Cl in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, Cl in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to next shell, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—39 clusters and 40 ch-1 spaces in each of 4 sections.
Row 45: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, dc in next Cl, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to next shell, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—79 dc and 80 ch-1 spaces in each of 4 sections.
Row 46: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to ch-1 space before next shell, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—81 dc and 82 ch-1 spaces in each of 4 sections.
Row 47: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to next shell, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across, turn—163 dc in each of 4 sections.
Row 48: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, **ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to dc before next shell, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, shell in marked ch-2 space; repeat from ** across—83 dc and 84 ch-1 spaces in each of 4 sections.
Row 49: Ch 2, beg-shell in first ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in next ch-space, *work flower (see Special Stitches), ch 5, skip next ch-space, slip st in next ch-space; repeat from * across to 3rd shell (at center lower point), work flower, ch 5, slip st in ch-2 space of center shell (remove marker), work flower, ch 5, slip st in next ch-1 space, **work flower, ch 5, skip next ch-space, slip st in next ch-space; repeat from ** to last shell, ch 5, shell in last ch-2 space. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Wet block to open up the lace pattern and flatten the flowers.
Special Stitches
V-st (V-stitch) = (Dc, ch 2, dc) in indicated stitch or space.
beg-shell (beginning shell) = (Slip st, ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in indicated space.
shell = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in indicated stitch or space.
Cl (cluster) = [Yarn over, insert hook in indicated space and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 7 times (8 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through all 8 loops on hook.
flower = Ch 9, slip st in 4th ch from hook to form a ring (the remaining 5 ch form the stem), flip ring over to other side, [ch 4, slip st in ring] 4 times.

materials: Bernat® Baby (Fingering) (1.75 oz /50 g; 191 yds/175 m) Baby Blue (35451)  6 balls
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: V-st = (1 dc. Ch-3. 1dc) in next sc.
measurements: Approx 53" [134.5 cm] wide and 36" [91.5 cm] deep at center.
gauge: 3 shells and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 316.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 315 sc. Ch 1. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Miss first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 3. Miss next 2 sc. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next sc - V st made. Ch 3. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Ch 4. Turn.
3rd row: *7 dc in ch 3 sp of next V st - shell made. Ch 3. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next sc. Rep from * ending last rep with 1 sc in last sc. Ch 6. Turn.
4th row: *1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 3. Rep from * ending with 1 dc in first ch of turning ch. Ch 6. Turn. 
5th row: *Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 3. Miss next 2 sc. Miss next ch. V st in next ch. Ch 3. Miss next ch. Rep from * ending with miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 3. Miss next 2 sc. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 6. Turn.
6th row: Sl st in first dc. Ss in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 4. *7 dc in ch 3 sp of next V st. Ch 3. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next sc. Rep from * ending with 7 dc in ch 3 sp of last V st. Ch 3. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 6. Turn.
7th row: *1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 3. Rep from * ending with 1 dc in top of last sc. Ch 6. Turn.
8th row: As 5th row. 
Rep 6th to 8th rows 36 times more, then 6th row once omitting turning ch at end of last row. (One shell remains). 
Fasten off. 
Lower Edging: 1st row: With WS of work facing, join yarn with ss in first ch of starting ch. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each rem loop of starting ch. 315 sc. Ch 1. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: Work as given for main section of blanket omitting turning ch at end of 3rd row. 
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Lattice™ (7.8 oz/220 g; 389 yds/356 m) Blacklight (19034) 5 balls or 1810 yds/1654 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 72" x 20" [183 cm x 51 cm] not including hood.
gauge: 16 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
• Wrap is worked from bottom edge to top edge. 
• Hood is worked along top edge of Wrap.
WRAP
Ch 289.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.  288 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures approx. 20" [51 cm] ending on WS.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
Place markers in 105th st (first marker) and 184th st (second marker) of last row.
HOOD
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at first marker on Wrap.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each sc to 2nd marker. Turn. 80 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Hood measures approx 13" [33 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Join Hood seam: Fold Hood in half (WS tog) and working through both thicknesses, join first 40 sts to last 40 sts, working 1 sl st in each pair of inner loops to end of row. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 3 skeins 400 Grey Heather
5" (12.75 cm)-wide piece of cardboard, sharp scissors, yarn needle
abbreviations: dtr (double treble crochet) = Yarn over 3 times, insert hook into next stitch, yarn over, pull up a loop, [yarn over, pull through two loops] 4 times.
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Shawl measures 63" (160 cm) at widest point x 39" (99 cm) at longest point.
gauge: 14 dtr = 5" (12.75 cm); 9 rows = 5" (12.75 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Make an adjustable ring as follows:
Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.

Row 1: (3 sc, ch 2, 3 sc) in ring; tighten beginning yarn tail to close ring.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to ch-space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in ch-space, sc in each remaining st.
Row 3: Ch 5 (counts as dtr here and throughout), turn, 2 dtr in same st. dtr in each st to ch-space, (3 dtr, ch 2, 3 dtr) in ch-space, dtr in each remaining st to last st, 3 dtr in last st.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to ch-space, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-space, sc in each remaining st to last st, 2 sc in last st.
Rows 5-46: Repeat Rows 2-4 fourteen times.
Row 47: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to ch-space, 3 sc in ch-space, sc in each remaining st.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Tassels (make 3)
Step 1: Wrap yarn around a 5" (12.75 cm)-wide piece of cardboard 30 times.
Step 2: Cut a 24" (61 cm) length of yarn. Tie the length of yarn snugly around the top of the tassel, leaving ends for attaching to shawl.
Step 3: Using sharp scissors, cut the bottom ends of yarn that are wrapped around the cardboard opposite the tied end. Remove the tassel from cardboard.
Step 4: Cut a 25" (63.5 cm) length of yarn. Wrap yarn snugly around tassel 8-10 times, just below the tied end. Tie knot and tuck ends inside tassel.
Step 5: Trim tassel ends evenly.
With yarn needle, attach tassels at each of three shawl points. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread Size 10: 5 balls each of 196 Cardinal A and 494 Victory Red B
abbreviations: [] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 19” wide by 69” long
gauge: Square measures approximately 6¼” x 6¼” with double strand of thread. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SQUARE 1: With one strand each of A and B held together as one, ch 27.
Row 1 (Right Side): Slip st in 9th ch from hook, [ch 4, skip next 2 ch, slip st in next ch] 5 times, ch 4, skip next 2 ch, sc in last ch; turn – 7 spaces.
Row 2: [Ch 4, slip st in next space] 7 times, ch 2, dc in 4th ch of begin ch-8; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in ch-2 space, [ch 4, slip st in ch-4 space] 6 times, ch 4, sc in last space; turn.
Row 4: [Ch 4, slip st in ch-4 space] 7 times, ch 2, dc in last sc; turn.
Rows 5-14: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 five times.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in ch-2 space, [ch 3, sc in ch-4 space] 7 times; DO NOT TURN.
Square Edging
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 6, dc in top of last sc made, 2 dc in same ch-4 space as last sc, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space along side] 5 times, ch 1, 2 dc in last space, (dc, ch 3, dc) all in corner sc, 2 dc in first space at lower edge, [ch 1, 3 dc in next space] 5 times, ch 1, 2 dc in last space, (dc, ch 3, dc) all in same ch as the dc at the end of Row 2, 2 dc over next dc along side, [ch 1, 3 dc over next dc] 5 times, ch 1, 2 dc over next dc, (dc, ch 3, dc) all in corner sc, 2 dc in next ch-3 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 1, 2 dc in last space; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-6; slip st in next ch-3 space; turn.
Round 2: Ch 4, *[3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 6 times **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in corner ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; (3 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in last space; join in 3rd ch of ch-4; slip st in next ch-1 space;
turn.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in ch-1 space, *ch 5, (sc, ch 5, sc) in corner ch-3 space, [ch 5, sc in next ch-1 space] 7 times; repeat from * around, omitting last sc, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
SQUARE (joined on one side): Work same as Square 1 through Round 2.
Round 3 (joining round): Ch 1, sc in ch-1 space, ch 5, sc in corner ch-3 space; ch 2, with wrong side of completed square facing, sc in corner ch-5 space, ch 2, sc in same ch-3 space on square in progress, *[ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space on square in progress] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in corner ch-3 space on square in progress, ch 2, sc in corner ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in same corner ch-3 space on square in progress - one side joined; [ch 5, sc in ch-1 space] 7 times, **ch 5, (sc, ch 5, sc) all in corner ch-3 space, [ch 5, sc in next ch-1 space] 7 times; repeat from ** around, omitting last sc, join with slip st in first. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
SQUARE (joined on two sides): Work same as Square 1 through Round 2.
Round 3 (joining round): Ch 1, sc in ch-1 space, ch 5, sc in corner ch-3 space; ch 2, with wrong side of completed square facing, sc in corner ch-5 space, ch 2, sc in same ch-3 space on square in progress, [ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space on square in progress] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in corner ch-3 space on square in progress, ch 2, sc in sc at junction between joined squares, ch 2, sc in same corner ch-3 space on square in progress, [ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space on square in progress] 7 times, ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in corner ch-3 space on square in progress, ch 2, sc in corner ch-5 space on completed square, ch 2, sc in same corner ch-3 space on square in progress - two sides joined; [ch 5, sc in ch-1 space] 7 times, ch 5, (sc, ch 5, sc) in corner ch-3 space, [ch 5, sc in next ch-1 space] 6 times, ch 5; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Join 33 squares in a rectangle, 3 squares wide by 11 squares long.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, using one strand each of A and B held together as one, join thread in any corner ch-5 space; ch 1, *(sc, ch 5, sc) in corner space, ch 5, [sc in next space, ch 5] across to next corner; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Slip st in next ch-5 space, ch 1, *(sc, ch 3, sc) in corner space, ch 3, [sc in next space, ch 3] across to next corner; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Stellar™: 10 balls 9932 Universe A
RED HEART® Boutique Fur™: 2 balls 9406 Smoke B
abbreviations: A and B = Color A, and Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Ruana measures 36” wide x 60” long [91.5 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 8 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 7½ rows = 4” [10 cm] in (sc, ch 1) pattern worked with A. 5 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 2 rows = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet (dc) worked with B. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
RECTANGLE (make 2)
With A, ch 122.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to last ch, sc in last ch—62 sc and 59 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc—61 sc and 60 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc—62 sc and 59 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 4–33: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 fifteen times
Row 34: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.

COLLAR
With B, ch 4.
Row 1: Work 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc)—3 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in first 2 dc, 2 dc in top of beginning ch—5 dc.
Rows 3–12: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 3 dc, dc in top of beginning ch.
Row 13: Ch 3, turn, dc2tog over next 2 dc, dc2tog over next dc and top of beginning ch—3 dc.
Row 14: Ch 3, turn, dc2tog over next dc and top of beginning ch—2 dc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Lay both rectangles side by side on a flat surface with long edges together at center. Beginning at one short end of rectangles, sew rectangles together for about one-half of the length for back seam.
Fold collar in half to find center point. Sew center point of one long edge of collar to seam between the two rectangles. Sew remainder of same long edge of collar to edges of rectangles (neck edge).
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Lace™ (3 oz/85 g; 498 yds/455 m)
Sizes XS/S M/L XL/2L 3/5XL Vintage (33008) or 4 5 5 6 balls Calypso Coral (33714) or Dove Grey (33044)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 22 sts and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Sleeves and Bodice Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

SLEEVES AND BODICE
Note: Sleeves and Bodice are worked in one piece from cuff to cuff.
**Cuff: Ch 31.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loop only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 6¾ (7-7¼-7½)" [17 (18-18.5-19) cm].** Do not fasten off.
Next row: Ch 1. Working across long edge of ribbing, work 41 (43-47-49) sc evenly across. Turn. Place marker at end of row.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Sleeve and Bodice Pat.
Work 5 more rows in pat.
Shape sides: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc) in first st. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc.
Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next dc. (1 dc. 1 sc) in last sc. Turn.
LACE SECTION
Sew sleeve seams to top of Sleeve markers, leaving Bodice edge free between markers.
Foundation rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at Bodice edge at either end of sleeve seam. Ch 1.
Work 154 (168-182-196) sc across Bodice edge to opposite sleeve. Work 154 (168-182-196) sc across opposite Bodice edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 308 (336-364-392) sc. (See Chart on page 6)
Proceed in pat as follows:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
A: 1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 4. Miss next 4 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 4. Miss next 4 sc.** 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 12 sts, then rep from * to ** once.
1 dc in last sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times in next dc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – cluster made. (Ch 3. Miss next dc. Cluster in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd to 5th rnds for pat once more.
B:1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 1. Cluster in next dc. (Ch 3. Miss next dc. Cluster in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd to 4th rnds once more.
C: 1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. Cluster in next dc. (Ch 3. Miss next dc. Cluster in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd to 4th rnds once more.
D: 1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 2 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. Cluster in next dc. (Ch 3. Miss next dc. Cluster in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd to 4th rnds once more.
E: 1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. Cluster in next dc. (Ch 3. Miss next dc. Cluster in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd to 4th rnds once more.
F: 1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. 7 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 1. Cluster in next dc. (Ch 3. Miss next dc. Cluster in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

materials: Patons® Kroy Socks™(1.75 oz/50 g; 166 yds/152 m) Contrast A Coal (55040) 3 balls
Patons® Kroy Socks FX™(1.75 oz/50 g; 166 yds/152 m) Contrast B Casual Colors (57014) 3 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] deep x 90" [228.5 cm] wide along lower edge (excluding edging).
gauge: 16 dc and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To join colors, work last 2 loops of first color, then draw new color through rem 2 loops and proceed.
With A, ch 68.
(See Diagram 1 on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 5th ch from hook (counts as dc. Ch 1). *1 dc in each of next 10 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch.** Rep from * to ** once more. 1 dc in each of next 18 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. Rep from * to ** twice more. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). 1 dc in first ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 12 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp.** Rep from * to ** once more. 1 dc in each of next 20 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to ** twice more. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). 1 dc in first ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 14 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp.** Rep from * to ** once more. 1 dc in each of next 22 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to ** twice more. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). 1 dc in first ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 16 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp.** Rep from * to ** once more. 1 dc in each of next 24 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to ** twice more. Join A. Turn.
Cont as established, inc 2 more dc between each (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) every row, and working 2 rows each in A and B until there are 68 dc between each side (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) section, and 76 dc in center section, ending with 2 rows of A. 
Fasten off.
Side edging: With RS facing, join B with sl st to first rem loop of foundation ch at left edge. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly along left side edge of Shawl to last row worked. Fasten off. Rep for other side.
Fringe: (See Diagram 2 on page 2). With RS facing, join B with sl st to first dc of last row. Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 9. Yoh and draw up a loop in 4th ch from hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - cluster made. 1 hdc in same ch as cluster. Sl st in each of next 5 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Block piece to measurements.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A and B: Harvest Red/Soft Pink (40019) 2 O’Gos
Contrast C and D: Gold/Orchid (40021) 2 O’Gos
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 10" x 82" [25.5 x 208 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Refer to Materials section for color plan for Contrast A, B, C and D.
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• There is no RS or WS. Scarf is reversible.

SCARF
Section 1:  With A (Color 1), ch 16. Do not break A, cont with B (Color 2) and ch 18.
1st row: With B, 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 14 ch, joining A. With A, 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 32 dc.
2nd row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc, joining B. With B, 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 32 dc.
3rd row: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc, joining A. With A, 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 32 dc.
4th to 9th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 3 times more, joining D at end of last row.
Section 1 is complete.
Section 2: Using D as Color 1 and C as Color 2 work 9 rows as for Section 1, joining A at end of last row.
Section 3: Using A as Color 1 and B as Color 2 work 9 rows as for Section 1, joining C at end of last row.
Section 4: Using C as Color 1 and D as Color 2 work 9 rows as for Section 1, joining A at end of last row.
Rep last 4 Sections 3 times more (16 Sections total). Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut lengths of each shade 14" [35.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe along both ends of Scarf, matching fringe to Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® "Light & Lofty™": 17 Ounces No. 9316 Puff.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Stole measures approximately 18" x 75½".
gauge: In pattern: 8 sts = 5"; 6 rows = 5". CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size crochet hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: Ch 122. Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * ch 5, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch; rep from * across; turn – 30 lps. Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3, dc in first sc, sc in ch-5 lp, * (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next sc, sc in ch-5 lp; rep from * to last sc; 2 dc in last sc, turn. Row 3: Ch 5, skip first 2 dc, sc in next sc, * ch 5, skip next 3 sts, sc in next sc; rep from * to last 2 sts; ch 3, skip next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn. Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next sc, sc in ch-5 lp; rep from * across; turn. Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 5, skip next 3 sts, sc in next sc; rep from * across; turn. Rep Rows 2-5 three more times, then rep Rows 2-4 again; turn to the side and work 1 rnd sc evenly around stole. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Skinny Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 795 yds/727 m) Baked Alaska (18008)  2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Quad tr (quadruple treble) = (Yoh) 5 times and draw up a loop in indicated st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 6 times.
measurements: Approx 26" [65 cm] deep x 65" [165 cm] long.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 1 Fan Shell = 4½" [11.5 cm] wide.
instructions:
Notes:  Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc. Shawl is worked in two parts: first half, then second half.

FIRST HALF
Ch 199 loosely (multiple of 13 ch + 4). See diagram on page 2.
1st row:  (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 197 hdc.
**2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next 5 hdc. [(1 quad tr. Ch 1) 9 times. 1 quad tr] in next hdc – Fan Shell made. Skip next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 14 Fan Shells.
3rd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. (Ch 2. Skip next quad tr. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 2. Skip next quad tr. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 7 (counts as quad tr and ch 1). [(1 quad tr. Ch 1) 4 times. 1 quad tr] in first hdc. *Skip next 4 ch-2 sps. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 4 ch-2 sps and hdc. Fan Shell in next hdc. Rep from *, ending with [(1 quad tr. Ch 1) 5 times. 1 quad tr] in last hdc.
5th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first quad tr. (1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Skip next quad tr) 5 times. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. (Ch 2. Skip next quad tr. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 2. Skip next quad tr. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from *, ending with: 1 hdc in next hdc. (Ch 2. Skip next quad tr. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 2. Skip next quad tr.1 hdc in 7th and 6th ch of turning ch 7. Turn.
6th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Skip next hdc. *1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 4 ch-2 sps and hdc. Fan Shell in next hdc. Skip next 4 ch-2 sps. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from *, ending with 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 13" [33 cm], ending on a 4th or 6th row. Fasten off.**

SECOND HALF
With RS facing, working along rem loops of foundation ch, join yarn with sl st to first ch.
1st row:  (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and each rem ch of foundation ch to end of row. Turn. 197 hdc.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Half.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Ombre™, 2 skeins 3962 True Blue
abbreviations: V-st: (Dc, ch 1, dc) all in same st or space.
Shell: (Hdc, 2 dc, hdc) all in same space.
measurements: Shawl measures 15" [38 cm] x 72" [183 cm].
gauge: One pattern repeat = 3½" [9 cm]; 4 rows = 4" [10 cm] at shell points. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
First Half
Ch 54.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 6th ch from hook (counts as first V-st), *ch 2, skip next 5 ch, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) all in next ch, ch 2, skip next 5 ch, V-st in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2 ( Mark as right side): Ch 4, dc in first ch-1 space (counts as first V-st here and throughout), *skip next ch-2 space, [Shell in next ch-2 space] 3 times, skip next ch-2 space, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st; repeat from * across, working last V-st in ch-4 space; turn.
Row 3: Ch 4, dc in ch-1 space of first V-st, *ch 2, skip next Shell, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) all in first dc of next Shell, ch 2, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st; repeat from * across, working last V-st in ch-4 space; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-3 until piece measures 36" [91.5 cm], end with Row 2. Fasten off.
Second Half
Turn to work across opposite edge of foundation ch.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With wrong side facing, join yarn in first ch with a slip st, ch 4, dc in same ch, *ch 2, skip next 5 ch, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) all in next ch, ch 2, skip next 5 ch, V-st in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-3 as for First Half until piece measures 36" [91.5 cm] from center seam, end with Row 2. Do not fasten off.
Edging Row: With right side facing, turn to work along long edge, ch 1, sc over end of last row, *(sc, ch 2, sc) over end of next row; repeat from * across to opposite end. Fasten off.
With right side facing, join yarn in corner along opposite long side with a slip st, repeat Edging Row.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Abbreviations
ch = chain; cm = centimeters; dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable®: 3 (4, 4, 5, 6) balls 3932 Springtime
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 20 sts = 4” (10 cm); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) in alternating rows of half double crochet and single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Shrug
First Front
Ch 17 (17, 22, 22, 22).
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bumps, 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch do not count as a st), 2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next 12 (12, 17, 17, 17) ch, 2 hdc in last ch, turn—18 (18, 23, 23, 23) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, 2 sc in first 2 sts, sc in each remaining st, turn—20 (20, 25, 25, 25) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), working in back bars only, 2 hdc in first 2 sts, hdc in each st across to last st, 2 hdc in last st, turn—23 (23, 28, 28, 28) sts.
Rows 4–15 (15, 17, 17, 19): Repeat last 2 rows 6 (6, 7, 7, 8) times—53 (53, 63, 63, 68) sts.
Row 16 (16, 18, 18, 20): Repeat Row 2—55 (55, 65, 65, 70) sts.
First Front Shoulder
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across to last st, 2 hdc in last st, turn—56 (56, 66, 66, 71) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 3–8 (12, 14, 16, 18): Repeat last 2 rows 3 (5, 6, 6, 6) times—59 (61, 72, 73, 79) sts.
Row 9 (13, 15, 17, 19): Repeat Row 1—60 (62, 73, 73, 78) sts.
Shape First Armhole
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across to last 15 sts; leave last 15 sts unworked, turn—45 (47, 58, 58, 63) sts.
Row 2: Repeat Row 1 of first front shoulder—46 (48, 59, 60, 66) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across to last 10 sts; leave last 10 sts unworked, turn—36 (38, 49, 50, 56) sts.
Rows 4–7 (7, 7, 7, 9): Repeat last 2 rows 2 (2, 2, 2, 3) times—18 (20, 31, 32, 29) sts.
Row 8 (8, 8, 8, 10): Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 9 (9, 9, 9, 11): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 10 (10, 10, 10, 12): Ch 12, working in back bumps, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch; working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn—28 (30, 41, 42, 39) sts.
Rows 11–14 (11–14, 11–14, 11–14, 13–18): Repeat last 2 rows 2 (2, 2, 2, 3) times—48 (50, 61, 62, 69) sts.
Row 15 (15, 15, 15, 19): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
First Back Shoulder
Row 1 (right side): Ch 17, working in back bumps, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch; working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn—63 (65, 76, 77, 84) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–9 (13, 15, 17, 19): Repeat last 2 rows 3 (5, 6, 7, 8) times.
Back
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across to last 6 sts; leave last 6 sts unworked, turn—57 (59, 70, 71, 78) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–31 (35, 37, 39, 39): Repeat last 2 rows 14 (16, 17, 18, 18) times.
Second Back Shoulder
Row 1 (right side): Ch 8, working in back bumps, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch; working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn—63 (65, 76, 77, 84) sts.
Rows 2–9 (13, 15, 17, 19): Work same as Rows 2–9 (13, 15, 17, 19) of first back shoulder.
Shape Second Armhole
Row 1 (wrong side): Repeat Row 1 of first armhole shaping—48 (50, 61, 62, 69) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across to last 10 sts; leave last 10 sts unworked, turn—38 (40, 51, 52, 59) sts.
Rows 4–7 (7, 7, 7, 9): Repeat last 2 rows 2 (2, 2, 2, 3) times—18 (20, 31, 32, 29) sts.
Row 8 (8, 8, 8, 10): Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 9 (9, 9, 9, 11): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 10 (10, 10, 10, 12): Ch 12, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch; working in back bars only, hdc in each st, turn—28 (30, 41, 42, 39) sts.
Row 11 (11, 11, 11, 13): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—27 (29, 40, 41, 38) sts.
Rows 12–15 (12–15, 12–15, 12–15, 14–19): Repeat last 2 rows 2 (2, 2, 2, 3) times—45 (47, 58, 59, 65) sts.
Second Front Shoulder
Row 1 (right side): Repeat Row 1 of first back shoulder—60 (62, 73, 74, 80) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc2tog, sc in each remaining st, turn—59 (61, 72, 73, 79) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–9 (13, 15, 17, 19): Repeat last 2 rows 3 (5, 6, 7, 8) times—56 (56, 66, 66, 71) sts.
Second Front
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—55 (55, 65, 65, 69) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st to last 4 sts, [hdc2tog] twice, turn—53 (53, 63, 63, 68) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 4 sts, [sc2tog] twice, turn—50 (50, 60, 60, 65) sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across to last 4 sts, [hdc2tog] twice, turn—48 (48, 58, 58, 63) sts.
Rows 5–16 (16, 18, 18, 20): Repeat last 2 rows 6 (6, 7, 7, 8) times—18 (18, 23, 23, 23) sts.
Fasten off.
SLEEVE (make 2)
Ch 31 (31, 31, 35, 35).
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in third ch from hook and in each ch across (beginning ch do not count as a st), turn—29 (29, 29, 33, 33) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, working in back bars only, 2 hdc in first 2 sts, hdc in each remaining st, turn—31 (31, 31, 35, 35) sts.
Rows 4–13 (13, 15, 15, 17): Repeat last 2 rows 5 (6, 6, 6, 7) times—41 (41, 43, 43, 49) sts.
Row 14 (14, 16, 16, 18): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 15 (15, 17, 17, 19): Ch 5, working in back bumps, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 ch, working back bars only, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each remaining st, turn—45 (45, 47, 51, 53) sts.
Rows 16–31 (16–31, 18–33, 18–35, 20–37): Repeat last 2 rows 8 (8, 8, 9, 9) times—77 (77, 79, 87, 89) sts.
Row 32 (32, 34, 36, 38): Repeat Row 2.
Row 33 (33, 35, 37, 39): Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 34 (34, 36, 38, 40): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st to last 4 sts; leave last 4 sts unworked, turn—73 (73, 75, 83, 85) sts.
Row 35 (35, 37, 39, 41): Ch 2, working in back bars only, hdc2tog, hdc in each remaining st, turn—72 (72, 74, 82, 84) sts.
Row 36 (36, 38, 40, 42): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st to last 3 sts; leave last 3 sts unworked, turn—69 (69, 71, 79, 81) sts.
Rows 37–50 (37–50, 39–52, 41–54, 43–58): Repeat last 2 rows 7 (7, 7, 8, 8) times—41 (41, 43, 47, 49) sts.
Row 51 (51, 53, 55, 59): Ch 2, working back bars only, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in each remaining st, turn—39 (39, 41, 45, 47) sts.
Row 52 (52, 54, 56, 60): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 53–60 (53–60, 55–64, 57–66, 61–72): Repeat last 2 rows 4 (4, 5, 5, 6) times—31 (31, 31, 35, 35) sts.
Row 61 (61, 65, 67, 73): Ch 2, working back bars only, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in each remaining st—29 (29, 29, 33, 33) sts.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Sew underarm seams. With right sides held together, pin sleeve in armhole, easing to fit, and sew sleeve and armhole together.
Work edging around jacket and each sleeve.
Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with sc in any row, sc evenly around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends. Block as needed.

materials: RED HEART® With Love™ Metallic: 2 balls 8410 Charcoal
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Wrap measures 17" wide x 72" long (43 x 183 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
WRAP 
Ch 66.
Row 1: Tr in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch count as ch-5 space), *ch 3, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 4 ch, (tr, ch 5, tr) in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—6 sc and 7 ch-5 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first ch-5 space, *ch 3, (tr, ch 5, tr) in next sc, ch 3, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * across, turn—7 sc and 6 ch-5 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 5, tr in first sc, *ch 3, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 3, (tr, ch 5, tr) in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—6 sc and 7 ch-5 spaces.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until shawl measures 72" (183 cm) or desired length. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Sugar Bush® Itty-Bitty™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 153 yds/140 m) - Plum Perfect (5018)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 14" x 60" [35.5 x 152.5 cm] including fringe
gauge: 8 sts = 2" [5 cm] in dc. 6 rows = 2" [5 cm] in dc/sc pattern.
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
The boomerang shawl is worked starting with 3 stitches and increasing one side by two every row and decreasing the opposite side by 1 every row. You continue to work until you reach your desired size. This shawl is worked until you have 110 stitches ending with DC row. The shawl length is an arm span or approximately 60" [152.5 cm]. The shawl will need to be blocked to flatten the edges from curling. Pin to size and spray with water then cover with damp towel to block. The trim is worked separately, blocked then sewn to edge of shawl using a whip stitch.
SHAWL
Row 1: Chain 4. Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across. Ch 2. Turn. (3).
Row 2: Skip 1st st. Dc in next. 3 dc in last st. Ch 1. Turn. (4).
Row 3: 3 sc in first st. Sc in next. Sc tog in last st. Ch 2. Turn. (5).
Rep pattern Rows 2 and 3 until you reach 109 stitches (ending with sc). Complete one final row of dc. Fasten off.
TRIM
Ch 4.
1st row: (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
