materials: RED HEART® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 1 ball each of 5311 Lace A, 5687 VIP B, 5635 Crème de Mint C, 5360 Suede D, 5620 Green Tea E, 5693 Poolside F
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Project measures 59” [150 cm] in wingspan, 29.5” [75 cm] in height.
gauge: 12 dc = 4" (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in stitch pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Begin at the top center and crochet your way out to the points of a shawl that will turn heads. This is the cozy accessory you’ll grab when you want to be ready for anything!

Pattern Notes
Throughout pattern 3 dc in same st count as a dc group.

PATTERN
Make an adjustable loop with A.
Row 1 (WS): Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch-1 space throughout), (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc, ch 1, dc) in loop. Pull loop closed. Fasten off A. Turn. - 2 dc groups.
Row 2: Join B to first dc with slip st, ch 4, 3 dc in first ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space (place marker in ch-1 space to mark center of shawl), 3 dc in tch-space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of tch. Fasten off B. Turn – 4 dc groups.
Row 3: Join C to first dc with slip st, ch 4, 3 dc in first ch-1 sp, 3 dc in space between next dc group, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space (move marker to ch-1 space), 3 dc in space between next dc group, 3 dc in tch-space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of tch. Fasten off C. Turn – 6 dc groups.
Row 4: Join D to first dc with slip st, ch 4, 3 dc in first ch-1 space, 3 dc in space between next dc group across to marker, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in marked ch-1 space (move marker to ch-1 space), 3 dc in space between next dc group across to tch, 3 dc in tch-space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of tch. Fasten off D. Turn – 8 dc groups.
Rows 5-42: Repeat Row 4 changing colors in following order: E, F, A, B, C, D. Fasten off- 84 dc groups.

FINISHING 
Weave in all loose ends

Tassels
Cut 2 pieces of F yarn, 12” (30 cm) each, put aside. Wrap yarn around 6” (15 cm) piece of cardboard 65 times, cut on one side creating 1 bundle of 65 strands. Place bundle evenly between one 12” (30 cm) piece of yarn, tie bundle into place (assure strands are even). Fold bundle so that strands are even, tie second 12” (30 cm) piece of yarn around bundle, 1” (2.5 cm) below knot. Trim bundle ends to make even. Make 2 more tassels in similar manner. Sew tassels to corners of shawl.

materials: Caron® Colorama Lacy™ (8 oz/ 227g; 361 yds/ 330 m) Spectral (11013) 2 balls or 595 yds/544 m
Size U.S J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 22½" x 60" [57 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 11 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc. 
Ch 64.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
1 dc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 62 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 4. Skip next 4 dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 4. Skip next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc.
4th row: Ch 7 (counts as dc, ch 4). Skip next 4 dc. *4 dc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Skip next 4 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 7 (counts as dc, ch 4). Skip next ch-4 sp. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-4 sp. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 4 dc in next ch-4 sp. *Ch 4. Skip next 4 dc. 4 dc in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows until work from beg measures approx 59½" [152 cm], ending on a 5th row.
Next row: Ch 3. *4 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last ch-4 sp. 4 dc in last ch-4 sp. 1 dc in last dc.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky (80 g/2.8 oz; 70 m/77 yds)
Size 10 mm (U.S. N/15) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 54" [137 cm] wide x 19" [48 cm] deep at center back.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 83 loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 3. 
2 dc in 3rd ch from hook – cluster made. *Miss 
next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Cluster. Rep from * 
to last 3 ch. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn.  
27 clusters.
2nd row: Sl st in first sc. Sl st in each of next 
2 dc of first cluster. Sl st in top of ch 3. Ch 1. 1 sc in same 
sp as last sl st. *Cluster. 1 sc in top of next cluster. Rep 
from * across, ending with 1 sc in top of last cluster. 
Turn.
Rep last row until 11 clusters remain. Fasten off.
Note: Each row will dec 1 cluster.

materials: Crochet Hook: Steel crochet hook Size 2.35 mm [US 1].
Red and blue thread for markers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 69” across long edge and 36” deep at center back, excluding border and fringe.
gauge: Each motif = 2¾” square. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
First Strip
First Motif
Ch 5; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), 15 tr in ring – 16 tr.
Round 2: Slip st in space between ch-4 and next tr, ch 7, 
sc between next 2 tr, *ch 3, tr between next 2 tr, ch 3, sc 
between next 2 tr; repeat from * 6 times, ch 3; join with slip 
st in 4th ch of beginning ch-7 – 8 tr; 8 sc; 16 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 11 for 
corner, sc in next tr; repeat from * twice, ch 7, sc in next tr, 
ch 11; join with a slip st in first sc – 4 ch-7 loops; 4 ch-11 
loops. Fasten off.

This breathtaking crochet lacy shawl was first featured in the 1979 book titled Year Round 
Fashions. Just as fashionable today, it can be worn with everything from a formal gown to a little 
black dress or tank top and jeans.

Second Motif
Work same as First Motif through Round 2. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 7, sc in 
8th ch of a ch-11 corner loop on previous motif and mark 
the ch-7 just made with red thread, ch 3, sc in next tr on 
Second Motif, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of next ch-7 loop on previ-
ous motif, ch 3, sc in next tr on Second Motif, ch 3, sc in 
4th ch of next ch-11 corner loop on previous motif, ch 7, sc 
in next tr on Second Motif, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 11, sc in 
next tr, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 11; join with slip st in first sc, 
mark last loop with blue thread. Fasten off. Loop marked 
with red will be used later.

Third Motif
Work same as Second Motif, making first joining on 
Round 3 in the 8th ch of corner loop marked with blue on 
previous motif. Remove blue marker on previous motif.
Make 22 more motifs; joining each motif to previous motif 
same as Third Motif was joined to Second Motif, omitting 
blue marker on last motif (25 motifs).

Second Strip 
First Motif 
Work same as First Motif of First Strip through Round 2. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 7, skip 
next 3 ch on red marked corner loop on Second Motif of 
previous strip, then sc in next ch, ch 3, sc in next tr on cur-
rent motif, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of next ch-7 loop on Second 
Motif of previous strip, ch 3, sc in next tr on current motif, 
ch 3, sc in 4th ch on next corner loop on Second Motif of 
previous strip, ch 7, sc in next tr on current motif, ch 7, sc 
in next tr, ch 11, sc in next tr, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 11; join 
with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Second Motif 
Work same as First Motif of First Strip through Round 2.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 7, sc in 
8th ch of loop marked with blue on previous motif, mark 
the ch-7 just made with red, ch 3, sc in next tr on current 
motif, ch 3, sc in 4th ch on next ch-7 loop on previous 
motif, ch 3, sc in next tr on current motif, ch 3, sc in 4th ch 
of next corner loop on previous motif, ch 3, skip next 3 ch 
on corner loop on next motif of previous strip, sc in next 
ch, ch 3, sc in next tr on current motif, ch 3, sc in 4th ch of 
next ch-7 loop of previous motif, ch 3, sc in next tr on cur-
rent motif, ch 3, skip next 3 ch on corner loop of previous 
motif, sc in next ch, ch 7, sc in next tr on current motif, ch 
7, sc in next tr, ch 11; join with a slip st in first sc. Mark last 
loop worked with blue. Fasten off. Remove blue marker on 
previous motif.

Make 21 more motifs; joining each to previous motifs same 
as last motif, omitting red marker on all remaining motifs 
and blue marker on last motif only – 23 motifs.

Remaining Strips 
Work 11 more strips same as Second Strip, with each 
successive strip having 1 less motif at each end of strip as 
established until 1 motif remains. Do not press.

Border and Fringe 
With right side facing; join yarn to 8th ch of corner loop on 
first motif of long edge.
Round 1: Ch 3, 3 dc in same loop, 5 dc in next loop on 
same motif, *4 dc in next loop, 4 dc in next loop on next 
motif, 5 dc in next loop*; repeat from * to * across to within 
last loop of last motif, work (4 dc, ch 3, sc) in last loop of 
last motif; working along side edge, ch 7, sc in next loop, 
ch 7, work (sc, ch 7, sc) in next loop, (ch 7, sc) in next 2 
loops, ch 3, skip next ch-3 loop, ** (sc, ch 7) in each of 
next 2 loops, work (sc, ch 7, sc) in next loop, (sc, ch 7) in 
each of next 2 loops, ch 3, skip next ch-3 loop**; repeat 
from ** to ** to motif at point, (sc, ch 7) in each of next 2 
loops, work (sc, ch 7, sc) in next loop, ch 7, sc in next loop, 
ch 7, work (sc, ch 7, sc) in next loop, (ch 7, sc) in each of 
next 2 loops, ch 3, skip next ch-3 loop; repeat from ** to ** 
across side to corner of long edge, ending last repeat with 
ch 3; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3.

Round 2: Ch 3, dc in each dc across to next corner, ch 3, 
sc in next ch-3 loop, (ch 7, sc) in each of next 5 loops, ch 
3, skip next ch-3 loop, *sc in next loop, (ch 7, sc) in each of 
next 4 loops, ch 3, skip next ch-3 loop*; repeat from * to * 
across to within the 8 ch-7 loops at point, (sc, ch 7) in each 
of next 7 loops, sc in next loop, ch 3, skip next ch-3 loop; 
repeat from * to * to corner at long edge, ending last repeat 
with (ch 7, sc) in each of next 4 loops, ch 7, sc in next ch-3 
loop, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.

Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each dc across to 
next corner, 2 sc in next ch-3 loop, ch 100 (for fringe), 
sc around stem of last sc made, sc in same loop, 2 sc in 
next loop, [ch 100, sc around stem of last sc made, 2 sc in 
same loop] twice in same loop (double fringe group made), 
make a double fringe group in each of next 3 loops, 2 sc

materials: Caron® Anniversary Cakes™ (35.3 oz /1000 g; 1061 yds/970 m) Grape Gala (20003) 1 ball
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 55" [139.5 cm] wide x 33" [84 cm] deep.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Each sc is always base for SK.
With MC, ch 2.
Foundation rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (SK) 4 times. Join with sc to first sc. Turn.
1st row: (RS). *(SK) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr). Skip first SK. 1 sc in next sc. (SK) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. (SK) twice. 1 sc in next sc. (SK) 3 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 tr). Skip first SK. 1 sc in next sc. (SK) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. *(SK) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. (SK) 3 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 3rd row until work across last row measures approx 55" [141.5 cm].
Final row: (SK) twice. Skip first SK. 1 sc in next sc. *SK. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. (SK) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Baker’s Cotton: 6 balls 700 Pink
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Triangle Shawl measures 47” wide x 22” deep (119 cm x 56 cm)
gauge: 20 dc = 4” (10 cm) with thread held double. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With thread held double, ch 8. Slip st in 6th ch from hook, ch 5, slip st in next ch, ch 3, dc in last ch. Turn. Row 1: Ch 5, slip st in same ch-space, ch 5, slip st in next ch-space, ch 5 slip st in same ch-space (mark this ch-space), ch 5, slip st in last ch-space, ch 3, dc in same ch-space. Turn. Rows 2-35: Ch 5, slip st in same ch-space, work (ch 5, slip st in next ch-space) to marked ch-space, ch 5, slip st in same ch-space (mark this ch-space), work (ch 5, slip st in next ch-space) to last ch-space, ch 5, slip st in last ch-space, ch 3, dc in same ch-space. Turn. Edging Row 1: *Ch 1, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-5 space; repeat from *, ending with sc in last ch-5 space. Turn. Row 2: Slip st in first ch-5 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-5-space, *skip next ch-1 space, 5 dc in next ch-5 space; repeat from *, ending with sc in beginning ch-1 of last row. Turn. Row 3: *Ch 3, slip st in next dc, (skip next dc, ch 3, slip st in next dc) twice; repeat from * to end. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Block to measurements.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (3 oz/85 g; 252 yds/230 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit bust measurement: Extra-Small/Small: 28-34" [71-86.5 cm], Medium/Large: 36-38" [91.5-96.5 cm], Extra-Large: 40-42" [101.5-106.5 cm], 2/3 Extra-Large: 44-46" [112-117 cm], 4/5 Extra-Large: 48-54" [122-137 cm]. Width from cuff to cuff: Approx 22 (24½-27-29½-32)" [56 (62-68.5-75-81.5) cm]. Length from top to hem: Approx 14 (16-18-20-22)" [35.5 (40.5-45.5-51-56) cm].
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: Shrug is worked in one piece beg at bottom and working upward. Short seams are sewn for sleeves. Edging is crocheted around sleeve openings.
(See Chart on page 2).
Ch 74 (82-90-98-106). 
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
Proceed in Ruled Lattice Pat (multiple of 4 + 1) as follows:
1st row: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 7. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 3. Miss next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp. Rep from * to last turning ch 6. 1 sc in 3rd ch of ch 6. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
These 1st to 3rd rows form Ruled Lattice Pat.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures 14 (16-18-20-22)" [35.5 (40.5-45.5-51-56) cm], ending on 3rd row of pat. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Place stitch markers 3" [7.5 cm] from each side for sleeve seams. Sew sleeve seams.
Join yarn with sl st at sleeve seam at sleeve opening. Ch 1. Work in sc around sleeve opening. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Rep for other sleeve.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Treasure™: 5 balls 1913 Spectrum
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 54” (137 cm) long and 18” (45.5 cm) wide.
gauge: One motif measures 6” (15 cm) across at widest. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
ROW 1 (consists of 3 motifs)
Motif #1
Ch 10; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 23 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining, [ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc] 11 times, skip last dc; join with dc in first sc (joining dc counts as last ch-3 space)—12 sc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in first ch-3 space (by working around the post of the joining dc), [ch 5, 2 dc in next ch-3 space] 11 times; ch 1, join with dc in top of beginning ch (last ch-1, and joining dc count as last ch-5 space)—Twelve 2-dc groups and 12 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first ch-5 space (by working around post of the joining dc), [ch 3, 3 sc in next ch-5 space] 11 times, ch 3, sc in first ch-5 space again; join with slip st in first sc—Twelve 3-sc groups and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, [ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in center sc of next 3-sc group] 11 times, ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—24 dc, 12 sc, 24 ch-3 spaces, and 12 ch-5 spaces. Fasten off.
Motif #2
Work same as motif #1 through Round 4—Twelve 3-sc groups and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Notes: Motif #2 is joined to motif #1 as Round 5 is worked. Work all stitches into stitches of Round 4 of motif #2 except when instructed to slip stitch into a ch-5 space of motif #1. Hold motifs #1 and #2 with wrong sides together and stitches matching. 
Round 5 (joining to one neighboring motif): 
Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, [ch 3, dc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-5 space of motif #1, ch 2, dc in same ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in center sc of next 3-sc group] twice, [ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in center sc of next 3-sc group] 9 times, ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Motif #3
Work same as motif #2, joining motif #3 to motif #2.
ROW 2 (consists of 3 motifs)
Motif #4
Work same as motif #2, joining to next side of motif #1 of to begin next row of motifs.
Motif #5
Work same as motif #1 through Round 4—Twelve 3-sc groups and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Notes: Motif #5 is joined to motif #4 and motif #2 as Round 5 is worked. Work all stitches into stitches of Round 4 of motif #5 except when instructed to slip stitch into a ch-5 space of motif #4 or motif #2. Take care to leave a ch-5 space un-joined between the joinings with motif #14 and motif #2. This leaves an opening surrounded by 4 un-joined ch-5 spaces in the middle of each set of 4 joined motifs. 
Hold motifs #5 and #4 with wrong sides together and stitches matching. Round 5 (joining to two neighboring motifs): 
Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining; [ch 3, dc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-5 space of motif #1, ch 2, dc in same ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in center sc of next 3-sc group] twice; ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space; hold motif #5 and motif #2 with wrong sides together and stiches matching, [ch 3, dc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-5 space of motif #2, ch 2, dc in same ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in center sc of next 3-sc group] twice; [ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in center sc of next 3-sc group] 6 times, ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Motif #6
Work same as motif #5, joining to motif #6 to motif #5 and motif #3.
ROWS 3–9 (each consists of 3 motifs)
Work same as Row 2, joining to previous row of motifs.
INNER FILLER MOTIF (make and join 16)
Work one inner filler motif in each opening between groups of 4 joined motifs. The filler motifs are joined to the un-joined ch-5 spaces around the opening.
Ch 10; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), work 5 dc in ring, [ch 3, slip st in next ch-5 space of opening, ch 3, 6 dc in ring] 3 times, ch 3, slip st in next ch-5 space of opening, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
OUTER FILLER MOTIF (make and join 16)
Work one outer filler motif in each opening between groups of 2 joined motifs across each long edge of shawl. The filler motifs are joined to the un-joined ch-3 spaces and ch-5 spaces on each side of the join between motifs.
Ch 10; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 23 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, ch 1, slip st in the ch-5 space before the ch-5 spaces of the join between motifs, [ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-3 space of opening] twice, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-5 space (first ch-5 space of join between motifs), ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-5 space (second ch-5 space of join between motifs), [ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-3 space of opening] twice, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-5 space of opening, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc] 3 times, ch 3, skip last dc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block lightly, if desired.

materials: Sugar Bush® Shiver™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 120 yds/110 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Tr2tog = [(Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 16 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Notes:
• Wrap is worked from side-to-side. Sleeves are done separately then sewed into Wrap.
• Ch 4 counts as tr at beg of row.
• Every row changes color. Fasten off yarn at end of every row. Turn. Join next color with sl st to first st, then proceed.

BODY
Stripe Pat (worked over odd number of sts).
Note: Ch 4 at beg of rows counts as tr.
1st row: (RS). With MC. 1 sc in the 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: With A, ch 4. 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each tr to end of row. Turn.
6th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: With MC, ch 4. 1 tr in next sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each tr to end of row. Turn.
9th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: With B, ch 4. 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each tr to end of row. Turn.
12th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: With C, ch 4. 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
14th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each tr to end of row. Work 1 sc in turning ch. Turn.
15th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
16th to 18th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
19th row: With C, as 16th row.
20th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
21st row: With C, ch 4. 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
22nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
23rd row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
24th row: With B, ch 4. 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
25th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each tr to end of row. Turn.
26th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
27th row: With MC, ch 4. 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn.
28th to 40th rows: With corresponding colors, rep 2nd to 14th rows.
41st and 42nd rows: With A, as 14th row.
43rd to 49th rows: With corresponding colors, rep 21st to 27th rows.
These 49 rows form Stripe Pat.

Body Right Front
Beg at right front edge, with MC, ch 129 (131-133-135-137).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 128 (130-132-134-136) sc.
Beg with 2nd row of pat, proceed in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 12 (13-15-16-17.5)" [30.5 (33-35.5-38-44.5) cm] ending on any WS row preceding an sc-row.

Right Armhole
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of the next 28 sts. Ch 30 (32-34-36-38). Skip next 30 (32-34-36-38) sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.

Back
Cont in Stripe Pat, until work from Right Armhole measures approx 13 (14-15-16-17)" [33 (35.5-38-40.5-43) cm] ending on any RS row preceding an sc-row.

Left Armhole
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of the next 70 sts. Ch 30 (32-34-36-38). Skip next 30 (32-34-36-38) sts. 1 sc in st to end of row. Turn.

Left Front
Cont in Stripe Pat, until work from left armhole measures approx 12 (13-15-16-17.5)" [30.5 (33-35.5-38-44.5) cm] ending on RS. Fasten off.

Sleeves
With MC, ch 15.
Ribbing: 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 14 sts.
Rep last row 31 (33-35-37-41) times more. Do not fasten off.
Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 32 (34-36-38-42) sc evenly across long edge to end of row. Turn. Beg with 2nd row, work 5 rows in Stripe Pat.

Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows:
Next row: (RS - tr row). Ch 4. 1 tr in first st. 1 tr in each st to last st. 2 tr in last st. Turn.
OR Next row: (RS – sc row). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
Pat 3 rows even.
Rep last 4 rows until there are 48 (52-56-58-62) sts.
Cont even in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures 19 (19-19.5-19.5 -20)" [ 48 (48- 49.5 -49.5 -51)  cm], ending on a WS row. PM at each end of last row.

Shape cap: 1st row: (RS – sc-row). Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 46 (50-54-58-62) sts.
Or 1st row: Ch 4. Tr2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. Tr2tog. Turn.
Keeping cont of pat, rep 1st row until there are 26 (28-30-32-34) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Pat to last 4 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
Or Next row: Ch 4. (Tr2tog) twice. Pat to last 4 sts. (Tr2tog) twice. Turn.
Rep last row once more. 18 (20-22-24-26) sts.

FINISHING
Pin garment pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.
Sew sleeve seams to markers. Sew in sleeves.

Fringe: Cut strands of yarn 10" [25.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across right front edge. Trim fringe evenly.

Buttons
Sew small button on WS above right front armhole. Sew large wooden button above left front shoulder. Use first and last row of treble stitches as buttonholes.

materials: Bernat® Wavelength™ (5 oz/140 g; 223 yds/204 m) Orange Sodalite (07015) 5 balls or 1153 yds/1050 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 22 x 70" [56 x 175 cm].
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Shawl is worked in 2 Halves, then sewn tog.
FIRST HALF
See diagram on page 2.
First Side: Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp – block made. Turn.
3rd row: Beg block. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until side edge measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row (even number of blocks). Fasten off.
Second Side: Work as given for First Side. Do not fasten off.
Join sides: 1st row: (RS). Work across Second Side as follows: Beg block. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to last block. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp of last block. Skip first 3 dc of first block of First Side. Sl st to next ch-3 sp of first block of First Side. Ch 3. Place marker in last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last block. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Turn.
2nd row: Beg block. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to marker on ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next marked ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Place marker to last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last block. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 35" [89 cm], ending on a WS row.
Proceed as follows:
Next row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to marker on ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next marked ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3. Ch 3. Place marker to last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last 2 blocks. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Turn.
Next row: Sl st in first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to marker on ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next marked ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3. Ch 3. Place marker to last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last 2 blocks. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Turn.
Rep last row until 2 blocks rem.
Next row: Sl st in first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Fasten off.
SECOND HALF
Work as given for First Half. Following diagram, sew both Halves tog.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “Bamboo Ewe™”: 6 balls 5410 Mercury.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Shawl measures 77” wide (across top edge) x 34” long (not including fringe).
gauge: 1 pattern repeat = 9½”; 6 rows = 4”.
instructions:
Ch 30.
Row 1: Shell in 5th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), ch 2, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch, [ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch] 5 times, ch 2, skip next 3 ch, Shell in next ch, ch 1, skip next ch, dc in last ch, turn—2 Shells, 5 ch-3 spaces, and 2 ch-2 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 4, Increase-shell in ch-2 space of first shell, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, ch 2, Increase-shell in ch-2 space of last shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4, Shell in first ch-2 space of Increase-shell, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, Shell in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in first ch-2 space of next Increase-shell, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, Shell in last ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 4: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, ch 1, 9 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 1, 9 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 2, sc in first dc of next 9-dc group, [ch 3, sc in next dc] 8 times, ch 2, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * to *; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 6: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 7 times, ch 3, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * to *; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 7: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 6 times, ch 3, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* ch 1, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * to *; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 8: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 3, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* Shell in next ch-1 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * to *; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 9: Ch 4, Increase-shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, ch 3,* [Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 1] twice, Shell in next ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * to *; Increase-shell in ch-2 space of last Shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 10: Ch 4, Shell in first ch-2 space of Increase-shell, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, Shell in next ch-2 space, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 3,* [Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 2] twice, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * to *; Shell in ch-2 space of next Increase-shell, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, Shell in last ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 11: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, ch 1, 9 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, *ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice, ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 1, 9 dc in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * across; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 12: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 2, sc in first dc of next 9-dc group, [ch 3, sc in next dc] 8 times, ch 2, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * across; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 13: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 7 times, ch 3, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * across; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 14: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 6 times, ch 3, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,* ch 1, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, repeat from * across; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 15: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 3, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell,** Shell in next ch-1 space, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * across, end at **; ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 16: Ch 4, Increase-shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, ch 3,** [Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 1] twice,  Shell in next ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * across, end at **; Increase-shell in ch-2 space of last Shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Row 17: Ch 4, Shell in first ch-2 space of Increase-shell, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, Shell in next ch-2 space, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 3,** [Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell, ch 2] twice, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell; repeat from * across, end at **; Shell in ch-2 space of next Increase-shell, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, Shell in last ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn.
Rows 18–45: Repeat Rows 11–17 four more times.
Rows 46–50: Repeat Rows 11–15.
Top Edging Row: Ch 4, Shell in ch-2 space of first Shell, *ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, Shell in next ch-3 space, [ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, Shell in next ch-3 space] twice, ** [ch 2, Shell in ch-2 space of next Shell] 3 times; repeat from * across, end at **; ch 2, Shell in ch-2 space of last Shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Fringe
Cut 30” lengths of yarn. *Hold 3 strands together and fold in half. Insert hook in ch-4 space or dc-space at the end of any row. Insert hook into fold and draw loop through. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull gently to tighten; repeat from * to attach a fringe to the end of every row of side edges and across lower edge (inserting hook into ch-spaces across lower edge).

materials: Patons® Lace Sequin™ (2.4 oz/70 g; 344 yds/314 m) 37303 (Amethyst) 6 balls
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 48” [122 cm] wide x 40” [101.5 cm] long
gauge: 17 sc and 23 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Ch 200. See Diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
*Ch 3. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in 
same ch as last sc. (Yoh and draw through 
2 loops on hook) twice. Miss next 5 ch. (Yoh) 
twice and draw up a loop in next ch. (Yoh 
and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. 
Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 
Cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp as last
st. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 33
clusters.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). (Yoh) twice 
and draw up a loop in top of next cluster. 
(Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 
twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on 
hook – Beg cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in
same sp as last st. *Cluster over same sp
as last cluster and top of next cluster. Rep
from *, ending with: Ch 3. (Yoh) twice and 
draw up a loop in same sp as last cluster. 
(Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 
twice. 1 tr in last sc. Yoh and draw through 
all loops on hook – ending cluster made.
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Cluster over
same sp as last st and top of next cluster.
Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp as last st. Ch 3. (Yoh) 
twice and draw up a loop in same sp as last 
sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 
twice. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh 
and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 
4 times in next sc. (Yoh) twice and draw up 
a loop in top of next cluster. (Yoh and 
draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and 
draw through all loops on hook – Bobble 
Cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp as last 
st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: As 2nd row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Bobble 
Cluster over same sp as last st and top of 
next cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp as last 
st. Cluster over same sp as last st and top 
of next cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp as 
last st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work 
from beg measures approx 17” [43 cm], 
ending on a 2nd row of pat. 
Divide for front opening:  Next row: 
(RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Bobble Cluster 
over same sp as last st and top of next 
cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp as last st. 
Cluster over same sp as last st and top 
of next cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in same sp 
as last st) 7 times. Turn. Leave rem sts 
unworked. 
Cont on these 14 clusters in pat for 
approx 25” [63.5 cm] more, ending on a 
2nd row of pat. 
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 5. 
1 sc in top of next cluster. Rep from * to 
end of row. Fasten off. 
With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st 
in same sp as last st worked before turn. 
(Ch 5. 1 sc in top of next cluster) 5 times. 
*Bobble Cluster over same sp as last st 
and top of next cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in same 
sp as last st. Cluster over same sp as last st 
and top of next cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in same 
sp as last st. Rep from * to end of row. 
Turn.
Cont on these 14 clusters in pat for 
approx 25” [63.5 cm] more, ending on a 
2nd row of pat. 
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 5. 
1 sc in top of next cluster. Rep from * to 
end of row. Do not break yarn. 
Edging: 1st rnd: Working down left side 
of Wrap, ch 1. 1 sc in side of last sc. *Ch 2. 
1 sc in side of next tr. Ch 2. 1 sc in side 
of next sc.* Rep from * to next corner. 
Working across foundation ch, **Ch 2. 
1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 sc in rem loop 
of ch where next sc was made. Rep from 
** to next corner. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 6 (counts as dtr and ch 1).  
(1 dtr. Ch 1) 6 times in same sp as sl st.  
*(1 dtr. Ch 1) 7 times in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to 5th ch of ch 6. 
Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m) Clay (62044) 8 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge

Note

2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next

2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each 
of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp.

6th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 
2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next 
2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 
2 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in 
next dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 
1 tr in each of last 2 tr. Turn.
7th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each of 
next 5 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 
1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in 
next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in each of 
last 2 tr. Turn.
8th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
*1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 
Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * 
once more. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. 
Ch 3. 1 tr in each of last 2 tr. Turn.
9th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
*2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next 
dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. Rep from * once more. 
2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next 
dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 
each of last 2 tr. Turn.
10th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
*2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each of 
next 5 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. Rep from * to end of 
row, ending with ch 3. 1 tr in each 
of last 2 tr. Turn.
11th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
*1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 
Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to 
last ch-3 sp. 1 dc in ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 
1 tr in each of last 2 tr. Turn.
12th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next 
dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. *Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc 
in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 
Ch 3. Rep from * to last 2 tr. 1 tr in 
each of last 2 tr. Turn.
13th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
*2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each of 
next 5 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. Rep from * to end of 
row, ending with ch 3. 1 tr in each 
of last 2 tr. Turn.
14th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
*1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 
Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 
Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 dc in 
last ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in each of last 
2 tr. Turn.
15th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. 
2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next 
dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc 
in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep 
from * to last 2 tr. Ch 3. 1 tr in each 
of last 2 tr. Turn.
Rep 10th to 15th rows for Diamond 
Block pat until top edge measures 
approx 60” [152.5 cm] wide, ending 
on RS row. Do not fasten off.
Edging: Turn work to beg working
along left side edge.
1st rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in sp created 
by side of tr. 1 hdc in top of next tr. 
Rep from * to corner. Work 3 hdc 
in corner. Rep from * once more. 
Working along top edge, work 
1 hdc in each dc and 3 hdc in each 
ch-3 sp to end of rnd. Join with sl st 
to top of ch 2.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc in 
horizontal bar created below st in 
previous rnd on WS of work (bar 
is below loops normally worked 
on WS – see diagram). Rep from * 
around, working 3 hdc in center 
hdc of each corner. Join with sl st 
to first hdc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 972 Pink Camo CA, and 365 Coffee CB.
measurements: Wrap measures 16” x 48”
gauge: Rounds 1-4 measures 4” x 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: NOTE: Make 48 motifs; join together 4 strips of 12 motifs. WRAP Motif With CA, chain 5; join with a slip st to form a ring. Round 1: Chain 3, 15 dc in ring; join with slip st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. Round 2: Join CB in any st, chain 1, sc in same st, chain 2, * skip next st, sc in next st, chain 2; repeat from * around; join with a slip st to beg sc. Fasten off. Round 3: Join CA in any chain-2 space, chain 3, 2 dc in same space, chain 2, * 3 dc in next sp, chain 2; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Round 4: Join CB in any chain-2 space, (chain 3, 2 dc, chain 3, 3 dc) all in same space, * chain 3, sc in next chain-2 space, chain 3,** (3 dc, chain 3, 3 dc) all in next chain-2 space; repeat from * around ending at **; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Joining on 1 Side: Work Rounds 1-3 as given. Joining Round 4: Work Round 4 to **, 3 dc in next chain-2 space, chain 1, sc in corner chain-3 of completed motif, chain 1, 3 dc in corner of motif in progress, chain 1, sc in next chain-3 space on completed motif, chain 1, sc in next chain-2 space on motif in progress, chain1, sc in chain-3 sp on completed motif, chain 1, 3 dc in next chain-2 space on motif in progress, chain 1, sc in corner chain-3 of completed motif, chain 1, 3 dc in corner of motif in progress; complete round. Join on 2 Sides: Work as for Joining Round 4, EXCEPT join the 2nd and 3rd corners by working the sc into the sc of previous joining; complete round. Edging: Join CB in any chain-3 corner space, chain 1, (sc, chain 3, sc) all in same space, chain 3, * sc in next ch-3 space, chain 3; rep from * around working (sc, chain 3, sc) in each corner sp; join with slip st to beg sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Smokey Green (32025) 5 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4½" [11.5 cm] wide piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 10 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Ridge Pat.
instructions:
Note:
Throw is worked lengthwise.
Ch 155.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal “bump” at back of each ch, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 2 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 154 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 hdcfp around next st. Rep from * across ending with 1 sc in top of turning ch-2. Turn.
Rep last row for Ridge Pat until work from beg measures 24" [61 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
Loopy Tassels (make 4): Wind yarn around a piece of cardboard 4½" [11.5 cm] wide 30 times. Tie through loops securely at 1 end. Wrap yarn 3 times around Tassel 1" [2.5 cm] down from tied end. Fasten securely. Do not cut loops at bottom of tassel. Sew 1 Tassel at each corner.

materials: RED HEART® Heart & Sole®: 3 balls 3932 Denimy
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 58” (147 cm) across and 26” (66 cm) in length at center
gauge: Rows 1-10 = 13 x 8½” (33 x 21.5 cm) CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 4, and slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Row 1 (RS): Ch 1, 5 sc in ring, turn.
Row 2: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and 3 ch), dc in first sc, * ch 3, skip next sc, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next dc; repeat from * once more, turn.
Row 3: Slip st in first dc and in first ch-3 space, beg shell, * ch 3, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * once more, turn.
Row 4: Slip st in each of first 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, beg shell, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (dc, ch 3) 5 times in next ch-3 space, skip next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * once more, turn.
Row 5: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and 3 ch), shell in first ch-2 space, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 5) in each of next 3 ch-3 spaces, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space *, (shell, ch 3, shell) in next ch-2 space, repeat from * to * once more, ch 3, dc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Row 6: Slip st in first dc and in first ch-3 space, beg shell, ch 2, shell in next ch-2 space, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 5) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, * (shell, ch 2) in each of next 2 spaces, shell in next ch-2 space, repeat from * to * once more, shell in next ch-2 space, ch 2, shell in last space, turn.
First, last, and center spaces. Move markers up to corresponding spaces after each row.
Row 7: Slip st to first space, beg shell, * ch 3, skip next space, (dc, ch 3) 5 times in next ch-2 space, ch 3, [skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 3] to last space before marked space *, skip next space, shell in center space, repeat from * to * once more, skip next space, shell in last space, turn.
Row 8: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and 3 ch), shell in first ch-2 space, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 5) in each of next 3 ch-3 spaces, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [shell in next ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 5) in each of next 3 ch-3 spaces, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] to marked space *, (shell, ch 3, shell) in center space, repeat from * to * once more, (shell, ch 3, dc) in last ch-2 space, turn.
Row 9: Slip st in first dc and in first space, ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and 3 ch), dc in first space, * ch 3, shell in next ch-2 space, ch 3, [skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 5) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, shell in next ch-2 space, ch 3] to marked space *, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center space, repeat from * to * once more, (dc, ch 3, dc) in last space, turn.
Repeat Rows 7-9 only 11 more times.
Final row: Slip st in first dc and first space, ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and 3 ch), 5 dc in first space, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-2 space, [ch 5, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 5) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, skip next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-2 space] repeat [ ] to last space before marked space *, ch 3, skip next space, (5 dc, ch 3, 5 dc) in center space, repeat from * to * to last 2 spaces, ch 3, skip next space, (5 dc, ch 3, dc) in last space.
Fasten off.
Remove markers.
FINISHING
Block Shawl to finished measurements.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Patons® Lace™ (3 oz/85 g; 498 yds/455 m) Arctic Plum (33317) 3 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
One size U.S. 35 (19 mm) knitting needle.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook twice). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 20” [51 cm] wide x 80” [203 cm] long.
gauge: 23 sc and 25 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 81. (See diagram on page 2)
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Do not turn. 80 sc.
2nd row: Place loop from hook onto knitting needle. Working from left to right, *Draw up a long loop in next sc and place on knitting needle. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 80 loops on needle.
3rd row: Insert hook through next 5 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 5 loops on hook. 5 sc in top of group of 5 loops. *Insert hook through next 5 loops on needle. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook (5 loops from needle, 1 loop already on hook). 5 sc in top of group of 5 loops. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. 80 sc.
Rep 2nd to 4th rows for Broomstick Lace pat until work from beg measures approx 78” [198 cm], ending on a 4th row. Fasten off.
Border: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 466 sc evenly up Right side edge. Work 3 sc in top corner. Work 1 sc in each sc to top left corner. Work 3 sc in top left corner. Work 466 sc evenly down Left side edge. Work 3 sc in bottom Left corner. Work 80 sc evenly across bottom edge. Work 3 sc in bottom right corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 1104 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Yoh and draw a loop in same sc as last sl st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - beg cluster made. (Ch 3. Cluster) in same sc as beg cluster. *Skip next 3 sc. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next sc. Skip next 3 sc.** (Cluster. Ch 3. Cluster) in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster.
3rd rnd: Sl st to first ch-3 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Wavelength™ (5 oz/140 g; 223 yds/204 m)
Contrast A Ruby (07007) 2 balls or 440 yds/400 m
Contrast B Violet Turquoise (07018) 1 ball or 223 yds/204 m
Contrast C Citron Marble (07006) 1 ball or 223 yds/204 m
Contrast D Blue Sapphire (07013) 1 ball or 223 yds/204 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches (sc and ch-1 sp). Yoh and draw through all 3(4) loops on hook
measurements: Approx 22" [56 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep last row until one of shorter sides measures 22" [56 cm] wide, ending on a RS row. 
Work straight as follows: 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 27 sts. 
Rep last 2 rows until approx 4 yds [3.2 m] of A will be left, ending on a 2nd row. 
With B, rep last 2 rows until approx 4 yds [3.2 m] of B will be left, ending on a 2nd row. 
With C, rep last 2 rows until approx 4 yds [3.2 m] of C will be left, ending on a 2nd row. 
With D, rep last 2 rows until approx 4 yds [3.2 m] of D will be left, ending on a 2nd row. 
With A, rep last 2 rows until side edge measures 70" [178 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 33 sts. 
Rep last row until there are 5 sts. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. 
Fasten off. 
Tassels: (make 4). Wrap 1 strand each B, C, D and 2 strands of A around a 5" [12.5 cm] piece of cardboard 3 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across another end. Wrap A 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach Tassels at each end of Shawl.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece Finer™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 385 yds/352 m) Gray Blue (76039) 3 balls
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
V-st = (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in indicated space.
measurements: Approx 24" x 90" [61 x 228.5 cm] before sewing.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 4 V-sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
POCKETS  (make 2)
Ch 29.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 28 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Pocket measures 7" [18 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
SHAWL  (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 76. 
1st row: (RS). V-st in 5th ch from hook (counts as dc, ch-1 and V-st). *Skip next 2 ch. V-st in next ch. Rep from * to last 5 ch. Skip next 2 ch. V-st in next ch. Skip next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 24 V-sts. 
2nd row: Ch 3. *V-st in next V-st. Rep from * to turning ch 3. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm], ending on a WS row.
Place Pocket Lining: Next row: (RS). Ch 3. (V-st in next V-st) 7 times. Work across sts of Pocket Lining: (V-st in next sc. Skip next 2 sc) 9 times. V-st in last sc. Skip next 10 V-sts of Shawl. (V-st in next V-st) 7 times. 1 dc in top of turning ch 3. Turn. 24 V-sts.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures 45" [114.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Step 1- Join Shawl Pieces:  With WS facing each other, align final rows of Shawl Pieces (center back neck seam). Working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sl st to first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *1 sc in next V-st. Ch 2. Rep from * to last V-st and dc. 1 sc in next V-st. Ch 1. 1 sc in last dc. Fasten off.
Following diagrams on page 3, sew Shawl into Cardigan as follows:
Step 2 – Fold Shawl in half and sew bottom back seam 7" [18 cm] up from bottom. 
Step 3  – Re-fold Shawl, aligning center back neck seam with bottom back seam. 
Step 4 – Sew sides of Shawl tog, leaving 9" [23 cm] openings for arms (See Diagram).
Sew sides of Pocket Lining to WS of Shawl. 
Pocket Ribbing
Ch 5. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work when slightly stretched measures length across pocket opening. Sew in place as you work. Sew side edges of Pocket Ribbing in position.

materials: Caron® Varied Stripes Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Elderberry Tea (42015)  2 cakes
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 98" [249 cm] long from point-to-point excluding tassels.
gauge: 18 sts and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] in sc-ch 1 pat.
instructions:
Note: Gauge is important for this project. Amount of sts worked across sides of triangles based on suggested gauge. If you have more or less sts over 4" [10 cm], you need to adjust amount of sts worked across sides of triangles.
First Triangle: Ch 2.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row until shorter side measures 17" [43 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Second Triangle: Turn work clockwise and work across short side.
5th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in side of first sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next sp) 38 times across shorter side of First Triangle to foundation ch. Turn. 77 sts (sc and ch-1).
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first st and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sctog over next ch-1 sp and last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until 2 sts rem. Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Third Triangle: Turn work clockwise and work across short side.
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in side of first sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in next sp) 38 times across shorter side of First Triangle to foundation ch. Turn. 77 sts (sc and ch-1).
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first st and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog over next ch-1 sp and last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until 2 sts rem. Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Rep Second and Third Triangles twice more. Fasten off.
Tassels: (make 2). Wrap yarn around 7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard 30 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach tassels at each point of Scarf.

materials: RED HEART® “Heart & Sole™ with Aloe”: 8 Balls 3965 Razzle Dazzle.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Shawl measures 16” x 56”.
gauge: 3 repeats = 5½” across with 2 strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Holding 2 strands together as one throughout, ch 222.
Row 1: 2 Dc in 5th ch from hook, ch 3, skip 5 ch, * [2 dc in next ch] twice, ch 3, skip 5 ch; repeat from * to last 2 ch; 2 dc in next ch, dc in last ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), * (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last st; dc in top of turning ch; turn.
Row 3: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2), 4 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last st; ch 2, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 4: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1), 4 dc in ch-2 space, * (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last space; 4 dc in ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, 2 dc in ch-1 space, ch 3, * 4 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3; repeat from * to last space; 2 dc in ch-1 space; dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 for pattern until 16” from beginning, end by working Row 2.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in dc, ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space, * ch 5, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last space; ch 3, sc in top of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable®: 2 balls of 3965 Candied
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures: 69” (175 cm) wide x 18” (45.5 cm) deep
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows in pattern = 5” (12.5 cm)
instructions:
Row 50: Ch 2, dc in next ch-1 space (counts as dc2tog), (ch 1, Cl) in each ch-1 space across, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 51: Ch 3, dc in next dc, (ch 1, Cl) in each ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc2tog over last ch-1 space and last dc, turn, leaving ch-2 unworked.
Row 52: Ch 2, dc in next ch-1 space, (ch 1, Cl) in each ch-1 space across, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 53-96: Repeat Rows 51-52 (22 times).
Row 97: Ch 2, dc3tog over next dc, ch-1 space and last dc, turn, leaving ch-2 unworked. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

WRAP
Ch 4.
Row 1: (Dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in 4th ch from hook, turn.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first dc, ch 1, Cl in next ch-1 space, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, ch 1, Cl in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first dc, ch 1, Cl in next ch-1 space, ch 1, Cl in next ch-1 space, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next dc, (ch 1, Cl) in each ch-1 space across, ch 1, 2 dc in last dc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in first dc, (ch 1, Cl) in each ch-1 space across, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 7-48: Repeat Rows 5-6 (21 times) – 24 Cl at end of last row.
Row 49: Ch 3, dc in next dc, (ch 1, Cl) in each ch-1 space across, ch 1, dc2tog over last 2 dc, turn.

materials: Caron® Big Donut™ O’Go™ (9.9 oz/280g; 502 yds/459 m)
Version 1: Main Color (MC) Vanilla Glaze (29015) 1 O’Go
Version 4: Main Color (MC) Chocolate Dip (29014) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 64" [162.5 cm] wide x 32" [81.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 14 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove 
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D, and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D, and E.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Stripe Pat
With A as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows. 
With MC as Color 1 and A as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With A as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and A as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With A as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and A as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With B as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and B as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With B as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and B as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With C as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and C as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With D as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and D as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With E as Color 1 and MC as Color 2, work 3 rows.
With MC as Color 1 and E as Color 2, work 3 rows.
These 48 rows complete Stripe Pat.
SHAWL
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st row: With Color 1, ch 3. 2 dc in ring. Ch 1. Join Color 2. Ch 1. 3 dc in ring. Turn.
2nd row: With Color 2, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. Join Color 1. With Color 1, ch 1. 3 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn.
3rd row:  With Color 1, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to center ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. Join Color 2. With Color 2, ch 1. 3 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to beg ch. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn.
4th row: With Color 2, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to center ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. Join Color 1. With Color 1, ch 1. 3 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to beg ch. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn.
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until all 48 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 1 ball of 1901 Mosaic
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: One size fits most. Neck warmer measures 6¼ wide x 29” long (16 x 73.5 cm)
gauge: 15 sts and 8 rows in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
STITCH PATTERN
Ch a multiple of 7 + 3.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, ch 2, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, *ch 3, skip next ch, sc in next ch, ch 4, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last 5 ch, ch 3, skip next ch, sc in next ch, ch 2, skip next 2 ch, sc in last ch, turn.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, *4 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2; rep from * across, ending with 2 dc in last ch-2 space, dc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space, *ch 4, sc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across, ending with ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sc in top of ch-3 turning ch, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-3 for pattern.
NECK WARMER
Ch 24.
Work in stitch pattern until piece measures 29” (73.5) from beginning, ending with Row 2 of pattern. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew 3 buttons evenly spaced along foundation-chain end of scarf. Fold scarf so that foundation chain end lies alongside last 6” (15.2 cm) of scarf (see photo). Button, using ch-2 spaces along edge of scarf as buttonholes.

pattern_name: Grays on a Bias Crochet Shawl
materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Heathers (5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] deep x 62" [157.5 cm] long.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat 1 
With A, work 2 rows. 
With B, work 4 rows. 
These 6 rows form Stripe Pat 1. 
Stripe Pat 2 
With A, work 4 rows. 
With B, work 2 rows. 
These 6 rows form Stripe Pat 2. 
Shawl
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
With A, ch 3. 
1st row: (RS). 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 2 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Turn. 4 hdc. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 2 hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 5 sts. 
4th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdcfp around each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 5 sts. 
5th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 6 sts. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around each of next 4 sts. 2 hdc in last hdc. 7 sts. 
7th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdcfp around each st to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdcfp around each st to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
10th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdcfp around each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
11th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdcfp around each st to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
Rep last 6 rows until longer side measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Cont as established and proceed in Stripe Pat 1 until longer side measures approx 32" [81.5 cm], ending on 6th row of Stripe Pat 1. 
Cont as established and proceed in Stripe Pat 2 until longer side measures approx 44" [112 cm], ending on 6th row of Stripe Pat 2. 
Break A. 
With B only, cont as established until longer side measures 62" [157.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet Thread, Size 3: 1 ball 775 Warm Rose
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Wrap Measures 6” (15 cm) high x 8” (20.5 cm) wide.
gauge: 19 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows hdc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WRAP
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 30, hdc in third ch from hook (beginning ch-2 counts as hdc) and each ch across; turn—29 hdc.
Rows 2-28: Ch 2, hdc in second hdc and each hdc across; turn—29 hdc.
LACE EDGE
Row 29: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch-1), skip next hdc, sc in next hdc, *skip 2 hdc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next hdc, skip 2 hdc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next hdc; rep from * twice, skip 2 hdc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next hdc, skip 2 hdc, sc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, hdc in top of ch-2; turn.
Row 30: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in next ch-1 space, *(sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space; rep from * twice, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in last ch-3 space. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Arrange Wrap around a bouquet to determine button placement. Sew buttons opposite holes created by Lace Edge. Weave in ends.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.0 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 17" (43 cm) wide x 77" (195.5 cm) long after blocking.
gauge: In pattern, (shell, V-st, shell) = 5" (12.5 cm), 6 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FIRST HALF
Ch 192.
Row 1 (Right Side): 3 dc in 4th ch from hook (begin-ning shell made), *skip 3 ch, V-st in next ch, skip 3 ch, shell in next ch; repeat from * across to last 4 ch; ch 1, skip 3 ch, 4 dc in last ch (end shell made); turn—23 V-sts, 23 shells, 2 half shells.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 here and throughout), dc in next dc (beginning V-st made), skip 2 dc, shell in next ch-1 space, skip 3 dc, V-st in next dc, skip 4 dc, *shell in next ch-1 space, skip 4 dc, V-st in next dc; skip 4 dc; repeat from * across to last V-st and 4 dc; shell in next ch-1 space, skip 3 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, dc in top of ch-3 (end V-st made); turn—25 V-sts, 24 shells.
Row 3: Ch 4, dc in ch-1 space, *skip 2 dc, dc in next 5 dc, skip 2 dc, V-st in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last shell and V-st; skip 2 dc, dc in next 5 dc, skip last 2 dc, dc in ch-4 turning ch space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn—25 V-sts, 120 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 3 dc in ch-1 space, *skip 3 dc, V-st in next dc, skip 3 dc, shell in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 5 dc and V-st; skip 3 dc, V-st in next dc, skip 3 dc, 3 dc in ch-4 turning ch space, dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn—24 V-sts, 23 shells, 2 half shells.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *skip 2 dc, V-st in next ch-1 space, skip 2 dc, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * across to last V-st and 4 dc; skip 2 dc, V-st in next ch-1 space, skip 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn—24 V-sts, 121 dc.
Row 6: Ch 4, dc in next dc, skip 2 dc, *shell in next ch-1 space, skip 3 dc, V-st in next dc; skip 3 dc; repeat from * across to last V-st and 4 dc; shell in next ch-1 space, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, dc in top of ch-3; turn—25 V-sts, 24 shells.
Rows 7-10: Repeat Rows 3-6.
Rows 11-12: Repeat Rows 3-4. Fasten off.
SECOND HALF
The Second Half is worked into the sts on the opposite side of the foundation ch (see Notes). With Right Side facing, join yarn with a slip st in first ch.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, 3 dc in same ch as join, *skip 3 ch, V-st in next ch, skip 3 ch, shell in next ch; repeat from * across to last 4 ch; ch 1, skip 3 ch, 4 dc in last ch; turn—23 V-sts, 23 shells, 2 half shells.
Rows 2-12: Work same as Rows 2-12 for First Half.

END BORDERS
First End
With Right Side facing, join yarn with slip st in corner st of short End.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, work 53 sc evenly spaced over sides of sts across End; turn—53 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next sc, shell in next sc, *skip 3 sc, V-st in next sc, skip 3 sc, shell in next sc; repeat from * across to last 2 sc; skip next sc, sc in last sc—7 shells, 6 V-sts, 2 sc. Fasten off.
Second End
With Right Side facing, join yarn with a slip st in corner st on the opposite short End.
Rows 1-2: Work same as Rows 1-2 for First End; do not fasten off; turn.

EDGING
First Short Edge
With Right Side facing, ch 1, picot in first sc, skip next dc, *[picot in next dc, skip next dc] twice, picot in next dc, skip 2 dc, picot in next ch-1 space, skip 2 dc; repeat from * across to last shell; [picot in next dc, skip next dc] twice, picot in next dc, skip next dc, picot in last sc; ch 1 (corner made); do not fasten off (see Notes).
First Long Edge
Sc in next dc, skip next dc, picot in next dc, skip next dc, *picot in next ch-1 space, skip 2 dc, [picot in next dc, skip next dc] twice, picot in next dc, skip 2 dc; repeat from * across to last V-st and 3 dc; picot in next ch-1 space, skip next dc, picot in next dc, skip next dc, sc in last dc; ch 1 (corner made); do not fasten off.
Second Short Edge
Repeat First Short Edge; do not fasten off.
Second Long Edge
Repeat First Long Edge; join with slip st in first sc; fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends and block.

abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures about 72" [183 cm] wide and 23" [58.5 cm] long.
gauge: 6 pattern repeats = 4½" [11.5 cm] in back pattern; 12 pattern repeats = 5" [12.5 cm]; 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in wing pattern.
instructions:
BACK
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 2 dc in ring, [ch 2, 2 dc in ring] 4 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first dc—Five 2-dc groups and 5 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in next dc, slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space (first corner made), [ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space] 4 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first dc—Ten 2-dc groups, 5 ch-2 corner spaces, and 5 ch-1 spaces (Two 2-dc groups along each of 5 sides between corner ch-2 spaces).
Round 3: Slip st in next dc, slip st in first corner ch-2 space, ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [ch 1, 2 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next corner ch-2 space] 4 times, ch 1, 2 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1; join with slip st in first dc—Fifteen 2-dc groups, 5 ch-2 corner spaces, and 10 ch-1 spaces (Three 2-dc groups along each of 5 sides between corner ch-2 spaces).
Rounds 4–21: Slip st in next dc, slip st in first corner ch-2 space, ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [*ch 1, 2 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to next corner ch-2 space, ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next corner ch-2 space] 4 times, **ch 1, 2 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from ** around, ch 1; join with slip st in first dc—One hundred and five 2-dc groups, 5 ch-2 corner spaces, and 100 ch-1 spaces (Twenty-one 2-dc groups along each of 5 sides between corner ch-2 spaces). Fasten off.
WINGS (make 2)
Ch 136.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as dc, ch 1), *skip next ch, dc in next ch, ch 1; repeat from * across to last 2 ch, skip next ch, dc in last ch—68 dc and 67 ch-1 spaces (67 pattern repeats and one additional dc).
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc, ch 1), turn, *skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, ch 1; repeat from * to last 3 ch-spaces, skip next ch-1 space, dc3tog-over-ch-spaces—66 dc (65 dc + 1 dc3tog) and 65 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Turn, beg-dc3tog-over-ch-spaces, *ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * to turning ch-space, ch 1, dc in 2nd ch of turning ch—64 dc and 63 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 4–29: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 thirteen times—12 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
ASSEMBLY
Arrange back and wings as shown in assembly diagram. Use locking stitch markers to pin corners of wings and back together. With wrong sides of one wing and back facing and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc in one marked corner, sc evenly spaced along edge to join wing to back. Fasten off. Repeat to join second wing to opposite edge of back.
FINISHING
Border
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join yarn with sc in corner at beginning of top edge of back, sc in each dc and ch across top edge of back; work 136 sc evenly spaced along opposite side of wing foundation ch; work 136 sc evenly spaced along diagonal edge of wing; sc in each dc and ch along next two sides of back; work 136 sc evenly spaced along diagonal edge of second wing; work 136 sc evenly spaced along opposite side of wing foundation ch; join with slip st in first sc.
Note: Make sure you have an even number of sc in Round 1 before proceeding to Round 2.
Round 2 (right side): Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in same sc as join, *skip next sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next sc; repeat from * to last sc, skip last sc; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Super Value Big Stripes™ (5 oz/142 g; 252 yds/230 m) Warm Patina (54016) 4 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
