Rep 5th and 6th rows until Shawl along center line measures approx 33" [84 cm], ending on 5th row. 
Edging: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. 1 sc in each st and ch to center ch-4 sp. 7 sc in center ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each st and ch to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row: (Picot row). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Picot. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from *, ending with Picot. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m) Elderberry Rose (70023) 3 cakes
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 23½" x 63½" [59.5 x 161.5 cm]
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Shawl is worked lengthwise.
• To maintain consistent color changes, join new cake to match last color change of previous cake. This will help to ensure stripe repeat will match as closely as possible.
• Ch-1 sp counts as st.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
SHAWL
Ch 224 (multiple of 2 ch + 4).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 223 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th and 7th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows.
8th to 12th rows: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
13th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 13th rows 4 times more. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 10 balls 9273 Very Pink
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
{ } = work directions in braces the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 24½" wide x 70" long (62 x 178 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project
instructions:
SHAWL
Cable Panel
Ch 29.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—28 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across, turn—28 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, working last sc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, Fptr around next 2 sts 2 rows below, [dc in next st, work base cable, dc in next st, Fptr around next 2 sts 2 rows below] across to last st, dc in last st, turn—3 base cables, 8 tr, and 8 dc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc in each st across to ch-1 space of next base cable, bobble in ch-1 space] 3 times, sc in each remaining st across, working last sc in top beginning ch, turn—28 sc and 3 bobbles.
Row 6: Ch 3, Fptr around next 2 sts 2 rows below, [dc in next st, work center cable, dc in next st, Fptr around next 2 sts 2 rows below] across to last st, dc in last st, turn—3 center cables, 8 tr, and 8 dc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skipping slip sts, sc in each dc and tr across, working last sc in top beginning ch, turn—28 sc.
Row 8: Ch 3, Fptr around next 2 sts 2 rows below, [dc in next st, work top cable, dc in next st, Fptr around next 2 sts] across to last st, dc in last st, turn—20 tr and 8 dc.
Rows 9–200: Repeat Rows 3–8 thirty-two times.
Rows 201 and 202: Repeat Rows 3 and 4.
Row 203: Ch 1, skipping all ch-1 spaces, sc in each dc and tr across. Do not turn or fasten off.
First Side Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows of first long side, 2 sc in Row 203, 2 sc in each even-numbered dc row to Row 2, 3 sc in Row 2, 2 sc in Row 1, turn—207 sc.
First Heart Panel
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 22 sts, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—198 sc and 9 bobbles.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc and bobble across, turn—207 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 9 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 3 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 18 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 3 sts, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—191 sc and 16 bobbles.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 7 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 14 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 7 sts, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—189 sc and 18 bobbles.
Row 7: Repeat Row 3.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 11 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 10 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 11 sts, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn.
Row 9: Repeat Row 3.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 15 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 6 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 15 sts, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—189 sc and 18 bobbles.
Row 11: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 12–15: Repeat Rows 10 and 11 twice.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 7 sts, bobble in next st] twice, {sc in next 6 sts, [bobble in next st, sc in next 7 sts] twice, bobble in next st} 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—180 sc and 27 bobbles.
Row 17: Repeat Row 3.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 4 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 3 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 4 sts, bobble in next st, [sc in next 8 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 4 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 3 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next 4 sts, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—171 sc and 36 bobbles.
Row 19: Repeat Row 3.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next st, bobble in next st, sc in next 7 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next st, bobble in next st, [sc in next 10 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next st, bobble in next st, sc in next 7 sts, bobble in next st, sc in next st, bobble in next st] 8 times, sc in each remaining st across, turn—171 sc and 36 bobbles.
Row 21: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off.
2nd Side Edging
Row 1: With wrong side of Cable Panel facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with sc in first row, sc in same row, 2 sc in each even-numbered dc row to Row 202, 3 sc in Row 202, 2 sc in last row—207 sc. Fasten off.
2nd Heart Panel
Ch 208.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—207 sc.
Rows 2–21: Repeat Rows 2–21 of First Heart Panel.
Referring to photo as guide for positioning, sew last row of 2nd Heart Panel to 2nd Side Edging.
Border Round: With right side facing, join yarn with sc in first st of last row of First Heart Panel, 2 sc in same st, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; working in ends of rows and in opposite side of foundation ch of first short edge, sc evenly spaced across; working in opposite side of foundation ch of 2nd Heart Panel, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows and in sts of 2nd short edge, sc evenly spaced across; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Pooling®: 8 skeins 8751 Berry A
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 776 Dark Orchid B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Wrap measures 36 x 72" (91.5 x 183 cm) including edging, and not including fringe.
gauge: 3 full sc sts per each length of one color in Moss st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
WRAP
With A, ch for at least 40" (101.5 cm), with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts as a st), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 4 full color sequences has been completed. Note: If at this point you are NOT getting 3 sc per color, then redo the row with a different hook size. Getting 3 sc per color with this yarn is essential to making this technique work.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until 8 full color repeats have been completed lengthwise, ending on a Row 4 (wrong side row).
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the wrap. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.
Edging
With right side facing, join B with slip st in foundation ch st under last sc of Row 1, being ready to work across foundation edge.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc once more in same foundation ch, * ch 1, sc in next space between scs of Row 1; repeat from * to ch-3 corner space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Wrap to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, rotate Wrap to work along top edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space to corner ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Wrap to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, ch 1, join with slip st in beginning ch-2.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in beginning ch-2.
Fasten off.
Triple Knotted Fringe
Attach a fringe at each ch-1 space across short edges of Wrap as follows:
Cut 2 strands of yarn, 32" (81 cm) each. Fold strands at center. Use hook to pull center of strands through edge space, then pull ends of strands through the resulting loop and pull tight.
Take 2 strands (half the strands) from each of 2 neighboring fringe groups, and tie together in a square knot about 5" (12.5 cm) below first knot. Repeat this process across both short edges of Wrap to create the second row of knots.
Take 2 strands (half the strands) from each of 2 neighboring newly-formed fringe groups just made, and tie together in a square knot about 5" (12.5 cm) below second row of knots.
Trim fringe evenly to about 15" (38 cm) long.
Weave in all loose ends.

abbreviations: Fsc (foundation single crochet) = Ch 2, insert hook in 2nd chain from hook and draw up a loop (ch stitch made) * yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (sc made), insert hook in ch stitch and draw up a loop; repeat from * for as many fsc as called for in pattern.
First St: Ch 2, insert hook under top 2 strands of first ch, yo, draw up a loop, yo, draw through 1 loop, yo, draw through both loops (first fsc complete).
Remaining sts: Insert hook under both loops of previous st, yo, draw up a loop, yo, draw through 1 loop, yo, draw through both loops.
ch = chain; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = triple or treble crochet; yo = yarn over; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 18” [45.5cm] wide x 52” [132cm] long
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Row 1 (Right Side): Work 155 Fsc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *ch 7, skip next 4 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 6 sts, ch 7, skip next 4 sc, sc next 2 sc – 22 Arches.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *7 sc in next ch-7 space, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last ch-7 space, 7 sc in last ch-7 space, sc in next 2 sc.
Row 4: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3), skip next 4 sc, sc in next 3 sc, *ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 4 sc, ch 3, skip next 3 sc, tr in last sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in tr, 3 sc in ch-3 space, sc in next 3 sc, *7 sc in ch-7 space, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last ch-3 space, 3 sc in ch-3 space, sc in 4th ch of ch-7.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sc, *ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 9 sc, ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in last 2 sc.
Repeat Rows 3-6 for 8 times, then Rows 3-5 once.
Edging Row 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *ch 4, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 3 sc sts; repeat from * across to last 9 sc, ch 4, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 2 sc.
Edging Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *4 sc in next ch-4 space, sc in next 3; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Pop™ (5 oz/140 g; 280 yds/256 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Wrap: Approx 44" [112 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] long from shoulder. Attached Scarf: Approx 11½" [29 cm] wide x 78" [198 cm] long (excluding fringe)
gauge: 13 sts and 9.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Texture Pat.
instructions: Notes: • To change colors, work to last loops on hook of first color then draw new color through rem loops. • Carry color when not in use loosely up side of work. • Work 2 rows from A, then work 2 rows from B throughout noting that when joining a new ball of A or B, take care to match the color change stripe in ball to keep the pattern consistent. Take extra care to match color changes on Right and Left Fronts. • Leftover yarn can be used for Scarf fringe. • Wrap is worked in one piece from lower edge of Back to lower edge of Fronts. • Turning ch 2 does not count as st. MATERIALS Bernat® Pop™ (5 oz/140 g; 280 yds/256 m) Contrast A Blue Chambray (84017)  6 balls Contrast B Foggy Notion (84012)  6 balls Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Stitch markers. 1" [2.5 cm] button. Wrap Beg at lower back edge, with A, ch 146. See diagram on page 4. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 144 sts. 2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in first dc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped ch from foundation row (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Join B. Turn. 3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn. 5th and 6th rows: With A, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join B at end of 6th row. Rep 3rd to 6th rows for Texture Pat until work from beg measures approx 30" [76 cm], ending on a 5th row of pat. Set up row for back neck: (WS). With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. [Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2)] 14 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. [1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in each of next 2 dc] 6 times. [1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc] 15 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join B. Turn. Place markers at each end of last row for shoulders. Right Front: 1st row: (RS). With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. [1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc] 14 times. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Cont in Texture Pat on these 60 sts as follows: 2nd to 4th rows: Work even in Texture Pat. 5th row: (RS). With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn. 7th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. Place marker on first of these 2 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped hdc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join B. Turn. 63 sts. With RS facing and separate length of yarn (in shade to match A), join with sl st to marked hdc of 8th row for neck edge. Ch 9. Fasten off. 9th row: (RS). With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch) twice. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn. 72 sts. 10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. [Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped ch 2 rows below (working around ch 2)] twice. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn. 11th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped sts 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped sts 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Cont even in Texture Pat until work from shoulder marker measures approx same length as Back, ending on a RS row. Final row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Fasten off. Left Front: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 24 sts at center back. Join B with sl st to next st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in next dc. Turn. Cont in Texture Pat on these 60 sts as follows: 2nd to 4th rows: Work even in Texture Pat. 5th row: (RS). With B, ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 4 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn. 7th row:  With A, ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped hdc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join B. Turn. 64 sts. 9th row: With B, ch 11. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. (1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 72 sts. 10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 11 sts. [Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped ch 2 rows below (working around ch 2)] twice. Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn. 11th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped sts 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped sts 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Cont even in Texture Pat until work from shoulder marker measures approx same length as Back, ending on a RS row. Final row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Fasten off. SCARF With A, ch 42. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 40 sts. 2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in first dc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped ch from foundation row (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Join B. Turn. 3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join A. Turn. 5th and 6th rows: With A, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join B at end of 6th row. Rep 3rd to 6th rows for Texture Pat until Scarf measures approx 78" [198 cm], ending on a 5th row of pat. Final row: (WS). With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Fasten off. Fringe: Cut 4 lengths of yarn for each fringe (each 16" [40.5 cm] long) in matching shades from A and B. Knot into fringe across ends of Scarf, alternating 1 fringe of any A shade with 1 fringe of any B shade across. Trim fringe evenly. FINISHING Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st in corner of Left Front neck edge and work 1 row of sc around outer edges of Wrap (excluding neck edge), working 3 sc in each corner. Do not turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. Place marker on Right Front neck edge 4" [10 cm] from corner. Fold Scarf in half and place marker at half-way point of Scarf. Match marker on Scarf to center back of neck edge and pin side of Scarf to neck edge, beg at Right Front marker and ending at corner of Left Front. Sew Scarf in position. Sew button to corner of Left Front neck edge noting a gap between sts will create a corresponding buttonhole on Right Front.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Brushed™ (5 oz/142 g; 253 yds/231 m) Misty Blue (5080) 4 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
5" [12.5 cm] wide piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
measurements: Approx 63" [160 cm] wide x 39" [99 cm] deep, excluding tassels.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st row:  (RS). (3 sc. Ch 2. 3 sc) all in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 5 (counts as dtr here and throughout). 2 dtr in first st. 1 dtr in each st to ch-2 sp. (3 dtr. Ch 2. 3 dtr) in ch-2 sp. 1 dtr in each st to last st. 3 dtr in last st. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
5th to 46th rows: Rep 2nd to 4th rows 14 times more
47th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to ch-2 sp. 3 sc in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 3)
Wind yarn around around a piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide 30 times. Tie through loops securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around Tassel 1" [2.5 cm] down from tied end. Fasten securely. With yarn needle, sew one Tassel to each point of Shawl.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1303 Aran A, 1505 Peacock B, and 1803 Blue Hawaii C (7 oz each)
Yarn needle, locking stitch markers, four 1¼” (32 mm) buttons, sewing needle and thread to match to A
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 15” wide x 52” long (38 x 132 cm) including border.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 11 rows = 4” (10 cm) in alternating pattern of single crochet and double crochet rows. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
With A, ch 42. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—41 sc. At the end of each row, drop and place loop on a stitch marker so that it doesn’t unravel as you work the next row. 
Row 2: Join B with dc in first sc, dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, do not turn—28 dc and 13 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Place A loop back on hook, ch 3 (does not count as a st here and throughout), sc in first 2 dc, *working behind next ch-1 space, dc in next skipped st 2 rows below, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across, do not turn—28 sc and 13 dc.
Row 4: Join C with dc in first sc, dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 5: Place A loop back on hook, ch 3, sc in first 2 dc, *Fpdc around skipped dc 2 rows below, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across, do not turn.
Row 6: Place B loop back on hook, ch 3, slip st into first sc, ch 3 (counts here as first dc), dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next Fpdc, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 7: Place A loop back on hook, ch 3, sc in first 2 dc, *Bpdc around Fpdc 2 rows below, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across working last sc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 8: Place C loop back on hook, ch 3, slip st into first sc, ch 3 (counts here as first dc), dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next Bpdc, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, do not turn.
Row 9: Place A loop back on hook, ch 3, sc in first 2 dc, *Fpdc around Bpdc 2 rows below, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across working last sc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 10: Repeat Row 6, do not turn.
Row 11: Repeat Row 7, do not turn.
Row 12: Repeat Row 8, turn.
Row 13: Repeat Row 9, do not turn.
Row 14: Repeat Row 6.
Row 15: Repeat Row 7.
Rows 16–127: Repeat Rows 8–15 fourteen times.
Rows 128–131: Repeat Rows 8–11. Fasten off A, B, and C. 
Border
Notes Hold beginning chains to wrong side of row-end stitches as border is made. To cover beginning chains as you work in ends of rows, insert your hook into the outermost loops of row-end stitches and in ch-space of beginning chains. For row ends without beginning chains, work into outermost loops of stitch. Two B- and C-colored stitches should be visible at the end of each row.
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join A with sc in first ch, 2 sc in same ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; *working across ends of rows, skip first row, 2 sc in each dc (even-numbered) row and sc in each sc (odd-numbered) row to last row, skip last row*; working across top row, 3 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; repeat from * to * down 2nd side; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each st around working 3 dc in center st of each 3-sc group; join with slip st to top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends. Steam block if needed.
With right side of right edge facing, sew buttons to lower edge of Rows 8, 16, 24, and 32 between Rounds 1 and 2 of border. Use space between border and corresponding rows of opposite end of border as buttonholes. If desired, after shawl is buttoned, fold over the upper edge at neck to form a collar.

materials: Caron® Cotton Angel Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Motifs (make 12 – see diagram on page 3).
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 15 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next ch - 1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 48 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 5. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting final sc in last rep. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 3. 5 dc) in same sp. *1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp.1 sc in next ch-2 sp.** (5 dc. Ch 3. 5 dc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
6th rnd: Join yarn with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in same sp. *Ch 5. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 5.** (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch -3 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. *6 dc in next ch-5 sp. (4 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 6 dc in next ch-5 sp.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in each corner ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc and (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in each corner ch-2 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 9th rnd until work measures 7 ( 8½-10½)" [ 18 ( 21.5-26.5) cm] square. Fasten off.
Half Motifs (make 2 – worked back and forth in rows)
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st row: (RS) Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Turn. 10 dc.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and 1 ch). *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch-4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in top of ch-3. 28 dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 4. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. Sl st in 5th ch from hook. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 5 dc in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 5 dc in next ch -3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. (5 dc. Ch 3. 5 dc) in ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 6 dc in next ch-4 sp. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 5. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 5. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch -3 sp. Ch 5. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 5. 1 sc in top of ch-3. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 7 dc in next ch-5 sp. 4 dc in each of next 2 ch-3 sps. 6 dc in next ch-5 sp. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. 6 dc in next ch-5 sp. 4 dc in each of next 2 ch-3 sps. 7 dc in next ch-5 sp. 2 dc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 2 dc. 1 sc in each dc to ch-2 sp. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each dc to last 2 sts. 2 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to ch-2 sp. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. 2 sc in each of last 2 sts. Rep 9th row until 2 shorter edges of Motif measure 7 (8½-10½)" [18 (21.5-26.5) cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew 6 Full Motifs tog for Back as shown in Diagram.
Sew 3 Full Motifs and 1 Half Motif tog for Left and Right Fronts as shown in Diagrams.
Sew shoulder seams tog as shown in diagram. Fold as indicated. Sew a side seam 2 ( 3-5)" [5 ( 7.5-12.5) cm] from bottom of Bolero.
Cuffs: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to top of section just sewn. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around unsewn section of side seam. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep on opposite side.
Front and neck edging: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to lower edge of Right Front. Work 1 row of sc evenly along front and neck edge, working 2 sc at transition from Half to Full Motifs at neck edge. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer™: 2 Balls 1931 Purple Haze.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Shrug measures 8½” long.
gauge: 15 ch = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Right Armhole Ch 60, slip st in first ch to join. Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Upper Back Row 1: Ch 8 (counts as dc and ch 5 here and throughout), turn, skip 4 dc, dc in next dc, *ch 5, skip 4 dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * 4 times, leave remaining sts unworked – 7 dc and 6 ch-5 spaces. Rows 2-15: Ch 8, turn, dc in next dc, *ch 5, dc in next dc; repeat from * 4 times, ch 5, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch. Fasten off. Left Armhole Work as for Right Armhole and Upper Back, do not fasten off. Joining Upper Backs: With right sides together, holding Upper Backs with sts aligned, working through both layers, sc in each dc and work 4 sc in each ch-5 space across to join Upper Backs. Fasten off. Right Front Bodice With right side facing, join yarn in next unworked dc at Armhole edge, ch 145. Row 1: Sc into 41st ch from hook, *ch 20, skip 20 ch, sc into next ch; repeat from * 3 times, ch 20, sc in next 3 dc of Armhole. Rows 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 and 18: *Ch 20, turn, sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 times, ch 40. Rows 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 17 and 19: Turn, sc in same sc, *ch 20, sc in next sc; repeat from * 3 times, ch 20, sc in next 3 dc. Fasten off. Left Front Bodice Make same as Right Front Bodice. FINISHING Shoulders Place markers 3½” on either side of center back seam for Back Neck. With right sides together and lining up sts, join yarn at Armhole edge, working through both layers, slip st Shoulders together to marked Back Neck, leave remaining sts unworked. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: cl = cluster: [yo, insert hook in indicated st or space, pull up loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
shell: (cl, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, cl) in indicated st or space.
inc-shell = increase shell: (shell, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, cl) in indicated st or space.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same stitch or space
measurements: Shawl measures 17” long x 48” wide.
gauge: 3 shells = 5”; 2 rows = 3” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 53; shell in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), *[skip next 3 ch, shell in next ch] 2 times, skip next 3 ch, inc-shell in next ch, [skip next 3 ch, shell in next ch] 2 times, skip next 3 ch*, (shell, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, shell) in next ch (2 increases made); repeat from * to *, shell in next ch, dc in last ch, turn—30 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 3 ch-6 spaces, (shell, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, shell) in next ch-6 space, shell in next 3 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch, turn—42 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, inc-shell in next ch-6 sp, shell in next 5 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 11 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 5 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch, turn—54 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, [inc-shell in next ch-6 sp, shell in next 6 ch-6 spaces] 2 times, (shell, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, shell) in next ch-6 sp, [shell in next 6 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space] 2 times, dc in top of turning ch, turn—64 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in each ch-6 space across to last ch-6 space, inc-shell in last ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch, turn—72 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 7 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 8 ch-6 spaces, (shell, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, shell) in next ch-6 space, shell in next 8 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 7 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch, turn—82 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 7: Ch 3, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 9 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 21 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 9 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch, turn—96 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 8: Ch 3, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 11 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 11 ch-6 spaces, (shell, ch 6, dc in 6th ch from hook, shell) in next ch-6 space, shell in next 11 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 11 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch—110 clusters and 2 dc.
Row 9: Ch 3, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, shell in next 13 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 27 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next 2 ch-6 spaces, shell in next 13 ch-6 spaces, inc-shell in next ch-6 space, dc in top of turning ch, turn—124 clusters and 2 dc. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows across side edge, work 2 sc in end of each row; working in free loops across bottom of foundation ch, sc in each ch across; working in ends of rows across other side edge, work 2 sc in end of each row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

abbreviations: V-St: (Tr, ch 1, tr) in indicated st or space.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 60" [152 cm] long.
gauge: 5 V-sts = 4" [10 cm]; 5½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in V-st.
instructions:
SHAWL
Ch 65.
Row 1: Skip 5 ch (counts as tr and ch 1), V-st in next ch, *skip 2 ch, V-st in next ch; repeat from * to last 2 ch, skip next ch, tr in last ch – 20 V-sts and 2 trs. 
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr here and throughout), turn, V-st in ch-1 space of each V-ch across, tr in last tr.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 60" [152 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHNG
Weave in ends.

measurements: Approximately 60 inches long and 20 inches wide.
gauge: 4 dc = 4 inches.
instructions:
1. Ch 200.
2. Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 5 ch, *ch 2, skip 2 ch, dc in next 6 ch; repeat from * until 2 ch remain, ch 1, dc in last 2 ch. Turn.
3. Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first dc, *ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next 6 dc; repeat from * across, ch 1, dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
4. Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 55 inches.
5. Finish: Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 72" wide across top edge x 33½" long (182.8 x 85.09 cm), excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sts = 4" (10 cm); 7 rows = 4" (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc here and throughout), turn—3 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first dc, dc in next dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—7 dc.
Row 3: Ch 4, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each dc across to beginning ch, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—12 dc.
Row 4: Ch 4, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, ch 5, skip next 5 dc, sc in next dc, ch 5, skip next 5 dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—6 dc, 1 sc, and 2 ch-5 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 3, 2 dc in first dc, dc in next dc, 3 dc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—15 dc and 2 ch-3 spaces.
Row 6: Ch 4, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 6 dc, 3 dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next 5 dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—23 dc and 1 ch-1 space.
Row 7: Ch 4, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, *ch 5, skip next 5 dc, sc in next dc, ch 5*, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to *, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—9 dc, 2 sc, and 4 ch-5 spaces.
Row 8: Ch 3, 2 dc in first dc, dc in next dc, *3 dc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * across, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—23 dc and 4 ch-3 spaces.
Row 9: Ch 4, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 6 dc, *3 dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * across, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—34 dc and 2 ch-1 spaces.
Row 10: Ch 4, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, *ch 5, skip next 5 dc, sc in next dc, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 12 dc, skip next 5 dc, sc in next dc, ch 5, skip last 5 dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—12 dc, 3 sc, and 6 ch-5 spaces.
Rows 11–55: Repeat Rows 8–10 fifteen times—57 dc, 18 sc, and 21 ch-5 spaces.
Rows 56 and 57: Repeat Rows 8 and 9—210 dc and 18 ch-1 spaces. At end of last row, do not turn or fasten off.
Border
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, *working in ends of rows, evenly space 132 sc across long edge*; sc in opposite side of foundation ch (corner st); repeat from * to * once, ch 1, [picot in next dc, skip next dc] 6 times, **sc in next ch-1 space, [picot in next dc, skip next dc] 5 times, picot in next dc; repeat from ** across, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—265 sc, 114 picots, and 2 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join; working down first long edge, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc*; repeat from * to * to last st before corner st, ch 1, skip last st, picot in corner st; repeat from * to * up other long edge; join with slip st in next ch-1 space; leave remaining sts unworked—132 sc, 132 ch-1 spaces and 1 picot. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends and block to finished measurements.
Fringe
For each fringe, cut 2 strands, each 18" (45.5 cm) long. Fold strands in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from right side through any corner. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in other corners and in every ch-1 space across both long side edges of shawl. Knot again, about 1" (2.5 cm) below top knot, using 2 strands from each of 2 adjacent tassels. For 2 top tassel ends, use all strands of end tassel plus half of strands of next tassel. Trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Heart & Sole®: 3 balls 3941 Riverstone
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same stitch
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 18” [45.5 cm] wide and 58” [147.5 cm] long.
gauge: 2 pattern repeats = 3½” [9 cm]; 4 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pattern. Note: One pattern repeat consists of one fan and the following treble crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
First Half
Beginning at center of shawl, ch 64 loosely.
Row 1 (right side): (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in 7th ch from hook (first fan made), skip next 2 ch, tr in next ch, *skip next 2 ch, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next ch (fan made), skip next 2 ch, tr in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—10 fans.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), *(2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next ch-1 space, skip next 2 tr, tr in next tr (between fans); repeat from * across working last tr in top of turning ch, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 29” [73.5 cm] from beginning, slightly stretched. Fasten off.
Second Half
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing and working across opposite side of foundation ch, draw up a loop in ch at base of first tr, ch 4 (counts as first tr), *skip next 2 ch, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next ch (at base of fan in first half), skip next 2 ch, tr in next ch (at base of tr); repeat from * across, turn—10 fans.
Row 2: Work same as Row 2 of first half.
Repeat Row 2 until second half measures about the same as first half, slightly stretched. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends and wet block to finished measurements.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds) CC Victorian Rose (9721) 1
Simply Soft Paints (113 g/4. oz;190 m/208 yds) MC Rose Garden (0002) 4
measurements: Approximately 24"/61 cm wide by 65"/165 cm long
gauge: In single crochet, using US size J-10 (6mm) hook, 10 sts and 12 rows = 4"/10 cm
instructions:
HELPFUL
1) Chain loosely or use a larger hook (US size K-10.5 (10.5 mm)) to work the foundation chain.
2) To make a narrower wrap, chain 62 to begin. This will create a wrap about 20"/51cm wide.

WRAP
With MC, ch 74. Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and next 3 ch, ch 7, skip next 5 ch, *sc in next 7 ch, ch 7, skip next 5 ch; repeat from * to last 4 ch, sc in last 4 ch, turn—6 ch-7 sp.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch (center ch of ch-7 sp), ch 5, skip next 3 ch, skip next sc, *sc in next 5 sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 3 ch, skip next sc; repeat from * across to last 3 sc, sc in last 3 sc, turn—12 ch-5 sp.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, *sc in next 3 sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next 3 sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, *sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next 3 sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 7 (counts as tr, ch 3), skip first sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next 5 sc, sc in next ch, *ch 7, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next 5 sc, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch sp, ch 3, skip last 4 ch, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first tr, ch 5, skip first ch-3 sp, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc, ch 5, skip next sc, *skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch (center ch of ch-7 sp), ch 5, skip next 3 ch, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc, ch 5, skip next sc; repeat from * across to last ch-sp, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, sc in next 3 sc, ch 5, skip next sc, *skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, sc in next 3 sc, ch 5, skip next sc; repeat from * across to last ch-sp, skip last 4 ch, sc in next ch, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, *sc in next 3 sc, sc in next ch, ch 5, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc in next ch, ch 7, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, *sc in next 5 sc, sc in next ch, ch 7, skip next 4 ch, skip next sc, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 sc, sc in last 3 sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2–9 until piece measures 65"/165 cm, or desired length, end by working a Row 5. Do not fasten off.

FINISHING
Rnd 1: Pivot to work in ends of rows along long side, work 2 sc around each tr or ch-3 sp and 1 sc around each sc along side; pivot to work in the free loops on the opposite side of the foundation chain, sc in the base of each sc, 6 sc in each ch-5 sp across foundation ch; pivot to work in ends of rows along the opposite long side of piece, work 2 sc around each tr or ch-3 sp and 1 sc around each sc along side; pivot to work in the sts of the last row of wrap, 3 sc in first and last ch-3 sp, sc in each sc, 6 sc in each ch-7 sp across row; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Rnd 2 (picot rnd): Join CC anywhere in edge, *(sc, ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, sc) in next sc, skip next sc; repeat from * around edge; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in all ends. Lay piece flat and wet block as desired.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ Bamboo™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 180 yds/165 m) Life's Beginning (03035) 5 braids
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 2 Fan Sts and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® 
x Pantone™ Bamboo™ multi-
shade yarn braid, separate 
each color link and wind into 5 
separate balls.
• Each color link will be 
referenced by its Pantone # 
(see ball band)
• Designate each different 
shade of the 5 separate yarn 
balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and 
E as noted in Materials section 
(or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn 
in each shade, pattern gauge 
must be matched to ensure 
successful results.
• When joining colors, work to 
last 2 loops on hook of first 
color. Draw new color through 
last 2 loops and proceed.

Stripe Pat
With A, work 28 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
With A, work 2 rows.
**With B, work 2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows.**
Rep from ** to ** 3 times more.
With D, work 2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows.
***With D, work 2 rows.
With E, work 2 rows.***
Rep from *** to *** twice more.
These 64 rows form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 5.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 5th ch from 
hook (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc). 
Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc here 
and throughout). 9 dc in ch-1 sp  – 
Fan St made. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1 
here and throughout). 1 dc in first 
dc. Ch 5. Skip each of next 9 dc.  
(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last st. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 3. 1 Fan St in next  
ch-1 sp.  Working around ch-5 to 
enclose it, 1 sc in 5th dc of Fan 
St 2 rows below. 1 Fan St in next  
ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 4. 1 dc in first dc. Ch 5. 
Skip each of next 9 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 
1 dc) in next sc. Ch 5. Skip each of 
next 9 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last 
st. Turn.
6th row:  Ch 3. 1 Fan St in next  
ch-1 sp. *Working around ch-5 
to enclose it, 1 sc in 5th dc of Fan 
St 2 rows below. 1 Fan St in next  
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc 
in last st.
7th row:  Ch 4. 1 dc in first dc.  
*Ch 5. Skip each of next 9 dc.  
(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Rep 
from * to last Fan St. Ch 5. Skip 
each fo next 9 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) 
in last st. Turn.
8th row:  Ch 3. 1 Fan St in next 
ch-1 sp. *Working around ch-5 
to enclose it, 1 sc in 5th dc of Fan 
St 2 rows below. 1 Fan St in next  
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in 
last st. Turn.
First 8 rows of Stripe Pat are  
complete. 
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 
7th and 8th rows 28 times more.  
32 Fan Sts.
Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 m/136 yds) 62044 (Clay) 8 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension
measurements: Approx 54" [137 cm] wide x 25" [63.5 cm] deep at center back.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SHAWL
Ch 2.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 2. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in /f_irst sc. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * across; ending last rep with 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 2. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 2. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 7th to 10th rows 22 times more. Do not fasten oﬀ.
EDGING
1st row: Ch 1. Work 98 sc evenly down side edge, 3 sc in corner, and 98 sc evenly up other side edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 99 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 99 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 100 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 100 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. 1 HSK. 1 SK. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 SK. Miss next 5 sc. 1 sc in next sc.* Rep from * to * 15 times more. **Miss next 2 sc. 2 SK. 1 sc next sc.** Rep from ** to ** once more. Rep from * to * 16 times more. 1 SK. Miss next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst st. *2 SK. Miss 1 SK and next sc. 1 sc in top of next SK. Rep from * 34 times more. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. 2 HSK. 1 SK. 1 sc in top of /f_irst SK. *2 SK. Miss 1 SK. 1 sc in top of next SK. Rep from * 33 times more. 1 SK. 1 dtr in last sc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: As 5th and 6th rows.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in /f_irst sc. *1 SK. [Ch 5. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 5. Sl st] in top of last SK. 1 SK. Miss 1 SK and next sc. 1 sc in top of next SK. Rep from * 34 times more. Fasten oﬀ.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable®: 3 balls 3950 Petunia.
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 67” (170 cm) wide x 31” (79 cm) long.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Row 1: Ch 6 (count as dc, ch 3), (dc, ch 1, dc, ch 3, dc) in the ring; turn.
Row 2: Ch 4 (count as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), dc in first st, 4 dc in next ch-3-space, dc in next dc, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, 4 dc in next ch-3-space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in 3rd ch; turn.
Row 3: Ch 4, dc in first st, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 1, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3-space, ch 1, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, (dc, ch 1, dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch; turn.
Row 4: Ch 4, dc in next ch-1 space, [dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space] 6 times, dc in next dc, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3-space, [dc in next dc, dc in ch-1 space] 7 times, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch; turn.
Row 5: Ch 4, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] across to next ch-3 space, ch 1, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3-space, ch 1, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] across to last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch; turn.
Rows 6: Ch 4, dc in next ch-1 space, [dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space] across to last dc before ch-3-space, dc in next dc, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3-space, [dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space] across to last dc before ch-1 space, dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch; turn.
Rows 7-48: Repeat Rows 5-6 (21 times).
Row 49: Repeat Row 5.
Row 50: Ch 3, 4-dc cluster in first ch-1 space, *ch 3, picot, ch 3, skip next ch-space, 5-dc cluster in next ch-space; repeat from * across to last ch-1 space. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block shawl to size.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet size 3: 8 balls 805 Blue Hawaii
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 34” long x 60” at widest point (86.5 x 152.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, working across ends of rows, sc in first dc, *ch 3, sc in dc in next row; repeat from * to first ch of beginning ch-6 of Row 1, sc in first ch (place marker); repeat from * across 2nd side to last row, ch 3, sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5, turn—135 sc and 134 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in first ch-3 space, beg V-st in same space, *ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, V-st in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to marked st, V-st in marked st, move marker to ch-2 space of V-st just made, V-st in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across 2nd side, turn—69 V-sts (34 on each side and 1 at center lower point).
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in ch-2 space of first V-st, (ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 3 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in first V-st, *ch 2, V-st in next V-st, ch 2, lg scallop in next V-st; repeat from * across to last V-st before marked V-st, ch 2, 2 dc in next V-st, (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in marked V-st, move marker to ch-2 space just made, 2 dc in next V-st, ch 2, lg scallop in next V-st, **ch 2, V-st in next V-st, ch 2, lg scallop in next V-st; repeat from ** across, turn—32 V-sts, 35 lg scallops (17 on each side and 1 at center lower point), and 4 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, slip st in first 3 dc, ch 3, dc in next dc, sm scallop in next ch-2 space, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 3, V-st in next V-st, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, sm scallop in next ch-2 space, dc in next 2 dc *; repeat from * to * 15 more times, ch 3, skip next 4 dc, dc in each st to next ch-2 space (at center point), sm scallop in next ch-2 space, dc in each st to last 2 dc before next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip next 4 dc, dc in next 2 dc, sm scallop in next ch-2 sp, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * to * to across, leaving last 2 dc unworked, turn—32 V-sts, 35 sm scallops (17 on each side and 1 at center point). Move marker to ch-2 space at center point.
Rows 5–7: Repeat Row 4 three times. Remove marker after Row 7.
Row 8: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), [dc in next dc, ch 1] 3 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times, *sc in ch-2 space of next V-st, *ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times; repeat from * across to last ch-3 space before the point, ch 1, sc in last ch-3 space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 6 times, [dc, ch 1] 3 times in next ch-2 space (at center point), [dc in next dc, ch 1] 6 times, sc in next ch-3 space, **ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times, sc in ch-2 space of next V-st; repeat from ** across to last scalllop, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch-2 space, [ch 1, dc in next dc] 4 times, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, *sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space] 8 times, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2; repeat from * 16 more times, sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space] 13 times, **ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space] 8 times; repeat from ** across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends. Block, if necessary.

materials: Red Heart® Fashion Soft™ (5 oz/141 g; 381 yds/348 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Fan = (Dc, [ch 1, dc] twice) all in same indicated st or space
Stacked dc (stacked double crochet) = Sc in indicated st, insert hook behind leftmost vertical bar of sc just made and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook.
V-st (V-stitch) = 2 dc in indicated st or space
measurements: Approx 94" [239 cm] across and 35" [89 cm] deep at center after blocking.
instructions:
SHAWL
See Diagrams on pages 4 and 5.
Using A, ch 4.
1st row (right side):  Tr in 4th ch from hook and mark this ch, turn.
2nd row: Stacked dc in tr, 9 dc in ch-4 space, dc in unused loops of marked ch, remove marker, turn – 11 dc.
Mark center dc, and move marker up to new center st as each row is completed. 
3rd row: Stacked dc in first dc, 2 dc in same dc, dc in each dc to last dc before marked st, 2 dc in next dc, 3 dc in marked st, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each dc to last dc, 3 dc in last dc, turn – 19 dc. 
4th row: Stacked dc in first dc, dc in same dc, ch 1, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 1, dc in next dc, ch 1, fan in next dc, [ch 1, dc in next dc] twice, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 1, 2 dc in last dc, turn – 17 dc and 14 ch-1 spaces.
5th row: Stacked dc in first dc, 2 dc in same dc, * dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to center marker, 3 dc in marked st, dc in next ch-1 space, repeat from * to * to last 2 dc, dc in next dc, 3 dc in last dc, turn – 37 dc, 18 dc on either side of center marker.
6th row:  Repeat 3rd row – 45 dc, 22 dc on either side of center marker.
7th row: Stacked dc in first dc, dc in same dc, ch 1, * dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * to last dc before marked dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, fan in marked dc, ch 1, repeat from * to * to last 2 dc, d..  continue with the remaining rows as provided in the full pattern, ensuring to follow the steps specified for rows 8 through Edging.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 Ball each 4422 Tangerine A, 9779 Berry B, 9528 Lilac C, 9520 Seafoam D and 4420 Guacamole E.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Finished Bust/Waist: 25 (28, 30)”. Finished Length: 50”. Stitch of Circle Wrap has a good amount of ease and measurements will change when worn.
gauge: 13 hdc = 4”; 16 ch = 4”; 4 rows = 4” using. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Note: Circle Wrap is worked in rounds from center out. CIRCLE WRAP With A, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 7 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 8 dc. Round 2: [Ch 4, slip st in next 2 dc] around, slip st in first ch of beginning ch. Round 3: [Slip st in ch-4 space, ch 6] around, slip st in first ch of beginning ch to join. Round 4: Ch 3, [work 5 dc in ch-6 space, dc in slip st] around to last ch-6 space, work 5 dc in ch-6 space, slip st in top of beginning ch – 24 dc. Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same space, [2 dc in each dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 dc. Fasten off. Round 6: Join B in any st, ch 11 (counts as dc and ch 8), [skip next 5 dc, dc in next dc, ch 8] around to last 5 dc, skip next 5 dc, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch. Round 7: Ch 3, dc in same space, [ch 8, 2 dc in next dc], around, ch 8, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next dc, [work 8 dc in ch-8 space, dc in next 2 dc, ch 8, dc in next 2 dc] around to last 2 ch-8 spaces, work 8 dc in ch-8 space, dc in next 2 dc, ch 8, slip st in beginning ch. Round 9: Ch 3, dc in next 11 dc, [10 dc in next ch-8 space, dc in next 12 dc] around to last ch-8 space, 10 dc in next ch-8 space, slip st in beginning ch – 88 sts. Fasten off. Round 10: Join C in any st, ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2), [dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next dc] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch. Round 11: Ch 15 (counts as dc and ch-12 here and throughout), [skip next 4 ch-2 spaces, dc in next dc, ch 12] around, skip last 4 ch-2 spaces, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch – 11 ch-12 spaces. Round 12: Ch 15, [dc in next dc, ch 12] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch. Round 13: Ch 13 (counts as dc and ch-10), [dc in ch-12 space, ch 10, dc in next dc, ch 10] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch – 22 ch-10 spaces. Round 14: (Ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space for First Corner, [ch 10, dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 10, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next dc for Second Corner, [ch 10, dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 10, slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Round 15: Join D in ch-2-space of First Corner, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, [ch 12, dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 12, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space for Second Corner, [ch 12, dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 12, slip st in top of beginning ch. Rounds 16-19: Slip st to ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [ch 12 (14, 16), dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 12 (14, 16), (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, [ch 12 (14, 16), dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 12 (14, 16), slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Round 20: Join E in ch-2-space of First Corner, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, [ch 14 (16, 18), dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 14 (16, 18), (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space for Second Corner, [ch 14 (16, 18), dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 14 (16, 18), slip st in top of beginning ch. Rounds 21: Slip st to ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [ch 14 (16, 18), dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 14 (16, 18), (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, [ch 14 (16, 18), dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 14 (16, 18), slip st in top of beginning ch. Rounds 22-23: Slip st to ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [ch 16 (18, 20), dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 16 (18, 20), (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, [ch 16 (18, 20), dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 16 (18, 20), slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 24: Slip st to ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [ch 18 (20, 22), dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 18 (20, 22), (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, [ch 18 (20, 22), dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 18 (20, 22), slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Round 25: Join D in ch-2-space of First Corner, (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, [ch 9 (10, 11), dc in ch-18 (20, 22) space, ch 9 (10, 11), dc in next dc] 4 times, ch 9 (10, 11), dc in ch-18 (20, 22) space, ch 9 (10, 11), (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space for Second Corner, [ch 9 (10, 11), dc in ch-18 (20, 22) space, ch 9 (10, 11), dc in next dc] 16 times, ch 9 (10, 11), dc in ch-18 (20, 22) space, ch 9 (10, 11), slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Round 26: With C, repeat Round 25. Fasten off. Round 27: With B, repeat Round 25. Fasten off. FINISHING Tie With A, ch 150 for Tie, slip st in ch-2 space of First Corner, slip st in each st across to ch-2 space of Second Corner, ch 150 for Tie. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Cotton Ripple Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 491 yds/449 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Corner Dec = (worked over 5 sts). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through two loops on hook) in each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through two loops on hook) in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook – 4 sts decreased
Corner Inc = (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next st – 4 sts increased
measurements: Approx 22 x 59" [56 x 150 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 17 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: • Shawl is worked in one piece from longest edge up, using increases and decreases to change direction of work. • Carry color not in use loosely up side of work. • Ch-1 sp counts as stitch throughout. • Move markers up every row on corner decreases.
With A, ch 494, placing marker every 50th ch for easier counting.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-st counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 36 ch. Corner dec, PM on this st. 1 dc in each of next 38 ch. Corner inc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 38 ch. Corner dec, PM on this st. *1 dc in each of next 76 ch. Corner dec, PM on this st. 1 dc in each of next 38 ch. Corner inc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 38 ch. Corner dec, PM on this st. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). Skip first 2 dc. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) twice. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. *(Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) twice. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. Rep from * once more. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to end of row. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. (1 dc in each st to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc) twice. 1 dc in each st to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. *1 dc in each st to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. (1 dc in each st to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc) twice. 1 dc in each st to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: With B, ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). Skip first 2 dc. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked stitch. Corner dec, PM on this st. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. *(Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. Rep from * once more. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to end of row. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, as 3rd row.
6th row: With A, as 4th row.
7th to 18th rows: Rep 3rd to 6th rows - 3 times more.
19th row: (RS). With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Corner dec, PM on this st. (1 dc in each st to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc) twice. 1 dc in each st to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. *1 dc in each dc to 2 sts before marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. (1 dc in each st to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc) twice. 1 dc in each st to 2 sts before next marked st. Corner dec, PM on this st. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
20th row: With B, ch 3. Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through two loops on hook. Skip next st. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through two loops on hook) in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – 4 sts decreased. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. *(Corner dec) twice, removing markers. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to next corner ch-1 sp. Corner inc in next corner ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc) to 2 sts before next marked st. Rep from * once more. Corner dec. Fasten off.
Finishing: Sew 5 seams as indicated in Diagram on page 3, matching colors and using a flat seam.
Border: 1st rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st to any corner of Shawl. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as sl st. Work dc evenly across edge to next corner. *Corner inc. Work dc evenly across edge to next corner. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch -3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *Corner inc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to next corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of A and B 24" [61 cm] long. Taking 2 strands of same shade tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across short ends of Shawl, alternating shades. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Adjustable Hairpin Lace Loom, set to 3”
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Stole measures approximately 22” x 67”
gauge: 16 sc = 4 inches at center of strip
instructions: Stole: 5 strips of hairpin lace with 240 lps on each side of strips. Finish Strips: When 240 lps are made and before taking loops from loom, ch 10. Now slide all loops from loom and work as follows: Insert hook through first 5 lps and work 1 sc, *ch 6, 1 sc in next group of 5 lps, repeat from * to end of strip, ch 10, 1 sc in center of hairpin lace strip, ch 10, and work up other side of strip the same as the first side, ch 10, and sl st in center of strip. Fasten off. Repeat for rem 4 strips. Join Strips: Row 1: Join yarn in first group of first strip, ch 6, 1 sc in first ch-6 sp, * ch 6, 1 sc in next ch-6 sp, repeat from * across, ending ch 6, 1 sc in sc of last group, ch 6, turn. Row 2: 1 sc in first ch-6 sp, * ch 6, 1 sc in next ch-6 sp, repeat from * across row ending with ch 6, turn. Row 3: 1 sc in first group of 2nd strip, ch 3, 1 sc in first ch-6 sp of first strip, ch 3, 1 sc in next ch-6 sp of 2nd strip, * ch 3, 1 sc in next ch-6 sp of first strip, ch 3, 1 sc in next ch-6 sp of 2nd strip, repeat from * across row, ending ch 3, sl st in last group. Fasten off. Join rem strips in the same way. Outside Edge: Join yarn to first group of 5 lps, **ch 6, sc in same group, * ch 6, sc in next ch-6 sp, repeat from * across row ending ch 6, sc in last group. Ch 6, sc in same group. Working across end, * ch 6, sc in next space. Rep from * across, ending with sc in first group of other side. Repeat from ** once. Join with a sl st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/ 288 m) Autumn Red (39730) 4 balls
Sizes U.S. K/10½ [6.5 cm] crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 sts and 7 rows = 5" [12.5 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 73.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 71 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout). Skip next dc. 3 dc in next dc. (Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc) 3 times. *Ch 11. Skip next 5 dc. 3 dc in next dc. (Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc) 5 times. Rep from * once more. Ch 11. Skip next 5 dc. 3 dc in next dc. (Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc) 3 times. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 20 3-dc groups, and 3 ch-11 sps.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 3 times. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-11 sp. *Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 5 times. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-11 sp . Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 3 times. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 3 dc in sp before first 3-dc group. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 4 times. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 3 dc in sp following last 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next 3 sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next 3 sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 3 dc in sp before first 3-dc group. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next 5 sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next 5 sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. 3 dc in sp following last 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next 7 sc. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3. 3 dc in sp before first 3-dc group. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 7 sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next 2 ch-6 sps. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 7 sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. 3 dc in sp following last 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 3 dc in sp between 3-dc groups. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 5 sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 5 sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 3. 3 dc in sp before first 3-dc group. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. 3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups. 3 dc in sp following last 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. (3 dc in sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp.
