(3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 3 times. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 6. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 3. 3 dc in sp before first 3-dc group. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 11. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 4 times. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 11. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. (3 dc in next sp between 3 dc groups) twice. 3 dc in sp following last 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 12th rows 10 times more, then 3rd to 11th rows once.
Next row: Ch 3. 3 dc in sp before first 3-dc group. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. *Ch 5. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) 4 times. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 5. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. (3 dc in next sp between 3-dc groups) twice. 3 dc in sp following last 3-dc group. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (does not count as dc). 1 dc in next 12 dc. (4 dc in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in next 18 dc) twice, 4 dc in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in next 12 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 73 dc. Do not fasten off.
Border
1st rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in first dc. 1 hdc in each dc to last dc. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in last dc (corner made). Do not work in top of turning ch. Work 243 hdc evenly spaced across side edge to corner. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in corner. Work 71 hdc evenly spaced across opposite side of foundation ch to corner. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in corner. Work 243 hdc evenly spaced across opposite side edge to corner. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in corner. Join with sl st in top of beg ch. 644 hdc and 4 ch-1 sps. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sc in corner ch-1 sp to work across long side edge. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 hdc. (1 sc in next hdc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 hdc) across to next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 3. Skip next 3 hdc. (1 sc in next hdc. Ch 3. Skip next hdc) across to next corner. Join with sl st in first sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in each ch-3 sp around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Bamboo Crochet Thread, 100% Viscose from Bamboo Size 10: 6 balls of 226 Natural
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 64” (162.5cm) long; 19” (48.5 cm) deep
gauge: Rose through Round 5 = 1¼” (3.2 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com

RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 5
Wild Rose Shawl 
Delicate and lacy, this beautiful crocheted shawl is perfect for the bride or wedding guest looking for a feminine wrap. For less formal occasions, it’s ideal for a relaxed boho approach to dressing.
edging. After Panels are joined, an edging is worked across top edge of shawl. 
Work in your ends as you go or you will have a major job at the end.
There are 81 roses required for this shawl. All can be crocheted beforehand or as needed for each panel. 
Wild Rose 
Ch 5; join with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 3, skip next sc, *sc in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-3 loops.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, (sc, 5 dc, sc) in each ch-3 space around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 petals. 
Round 4: Ch 1, working behind petals in Round 3, sc around the post of first sc in Round 2, ch 4, *sc around the post of next sc in Round 2, ch 4; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-4 loops.
Round 5: Slip st in first ch-4 space, ch 1, (sc, 7 dc, sc) in each ch-4 space around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 petals. Fasten off.
Note: Each panel begins at the top. 
Panel 1
Make 1 Wild Rose.
Panel Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join thread in center dc of any petal in Round 5, ch 1, sc in same dc, work picot loop, *sc in center dc of next petal, work picot loop; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 picot loops). 
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 4), dc in same sc, ch 5, (tr, ch 5, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (tr, ch 5, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 5; join with a slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6 —16 ch-spaces. 
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 7 sc in next ch-6 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space; join with a slip st in first sc, turn—92 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. 
Round 4: With wrong side facing, join thread with a slip st in 3rd sc of previous round, ch 2, 2-dc cluster in same st, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 5 times, [ch 2, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] twice, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 32 times,[ch 2, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] twice, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 4 times, ch 1; join with a slip st in first cluster, turn—46 clusters.
Round 5: With right side facing, ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, [2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, sc in next cluster] twice, 2 sc in each of next 6 ch-1 spaces, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in each of next 6 ch-1 spaces, [sc in next cluster, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces] twice, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc—106 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first st, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 9 times, ch 7, skip next sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 9 times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] twice, ch 4, skip next 3 sc; join with a slip st in first sc—27 ch-spaces. 
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 5 sc in each of next 2 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 4, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (2 sc, ch 3, 3 sc, triple picot, 2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-7 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 9 ch-4 spaces, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, 5 sc in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc —136 sc and 36 ch-spaces (not including the spaces in the triple picot). Fasten off. Weave in ends. 
Panel 2
Make 2 Wild Roses.
Panel Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join thread in center dc of any petal in Round 5 of either rose, ch 1, sc in same dc, work picot loop, sc in center dc of next petal, *work picot loop, sc in center dc of next petal*; repeat from * to * once more, sc in center dc of any petal on 2nd rose; working around 2nd rose; repeat from * to * 6 times, working last sc in center dc of first petal already holding 1 sc; working around first rose, repeat from * to * 3 times, omitting last sc; join with a slip st in first sc—12 picot loops.
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 4), dc in same sc, ch 5, (tr, ch 5, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop ch 6, dtr2tog over next 2 picot loops, (one picot loop is on current rose and the other is on next rose), ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (tr, ch 4, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 5, (dtr, ch 5, dtr) in next sc, ch 5, (tr, ch 4, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, dtr2tog over next 2 picot loops, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (tr, ch 5, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 5; join with a slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6—22 ch-spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 8 sc in next ch-6 space, sc in space between 2 legs of next dtr2tog, 8 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 8 sc in next ch-6 space, sc in space between 2 legs of next dtr2tog, 8 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, 7 sc in next ch-6 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space; join with a slip st in first sc, turn—132 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. 
Round 4: With wrong side facing, join thread with a slip st in 3rd sc of previous round, ch 2, 2-dc cluster in same st, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 5 times, [ch 2, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] twice, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 52 times,[ch 2, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] twice, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 4 times, ch 1; join with a slip st in first cluster, turn—66 clusters.
Round 5: With right side facing, ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, sc in next cluster, 2 sc in each of next 4 ch-1 spaces, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next cluster, sc in next ch-1 space, 2 sc in each of next 4 ch-1 spaces, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc—146 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first st, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 14 times, ch 7, skip next sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 14 times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] twice, ch 4, skip next 3 sc; join with a slip st in first sc—37 ch-spaces. 
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 5 sc in each of next 2 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in each of next 9 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 4, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (2 sc, ch 3, 3 sc, triple picot, 2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-7 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 9 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-4 space on previous Panel, ch 2, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (3 sc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 3 sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, 5 sc in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Panels 3 through 9
Note: Directions are given for Panel 3. Changes for Panels 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9 are in parentheses.
Make 3 (4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9) Wild Roses. 
Panel Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join thread in center dc of any petal in Round 5 of either rose, ch 1, sc in same dc, work picot loop, sc in center dc of next petal, *work picot loop, sc in center dc of next petal*; repeat from * to * once more, [sc in center dc of any petal on next rose; working around next rose; repeat from * to * 3 times] 1 (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7) times, sc in center dc of any petal on last rose; repeat from * to * 6 times, working last sc in center dc of first petal already holding 1 sc; [working around next rose; repeat from * to * 3 times, working last sc in center dc of first petal already holding 1 sc] 1 (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7) times, repeat from * to * 3 times, omitting last sc; join with a slip st in first sc—18 (24, 30, 36, 42, 48, 54) picot loops.
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 4), dc in same sc, ch 5, (tr, ch 5, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop, [ch 6, dtr2tog over next 2 picot loops, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop] 2 (3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8) times, ch 6, (tr, ch 4, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 5, (dtr, ch 5, dtr) in next sc, ch 5, (tr, ch 4, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop, [ch 6, dtr2tog over next 2 picot loops, ch 6, (dc, ch 3, dc) in center of next picot loop] 2 (3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8) times, ch 6, (tr, ch 5, tr) in center of next picot loop, ch 5; join with a slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6—28 (34, 40, 46, 52, 58, 64) ch-spaces. 
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, [8 sc in next ch-6 space, sc in space between 2 legs of next dtr2tog, 8 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space] 2 (3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8) times, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, [8 sc in next ch-6 space, sc in space between 2 legs of next dtr2tog, 8 sc in next ch-6 space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space] 2 (3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8) times, 7 sc in next ch-6 space, 7 sc in next ch-5 space, 6 sc in next ch-5 space; join with a slip st in first sc, turn—172 (212, 252, 292, 332, 372, 412) sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. 
Round 4: With wrong side facing, join thread with a slip st in 3rd sc of previous round, ch 2, 2-dc cluster in same st, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 5 times, [ch 2, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] twice, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 72 (92, 112, 132, 152, 172, 192) times,[ch 2, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] twice, [ch 1, skip next sc, 3-dc cluster in next sc] 4 times,ch 1; join with a slip st in first cluster, turn—86 (106, 126, 146, 166, 186, 206) clusters.
Round 5: With right side facing, ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, sc in next cluster, [2 sc in each of next 4 ch-1 spaces, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next cluster, sc in next ch-1 space, 2 sc in each of next 4 ch-1 spaces, sc in next cluster] 2 (3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8) times, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, sc in next cluster, 2 sc in each of next 6 ch-1 spaces, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in each of next 6 ch-1 spaces, sc in next cluster, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next cluster, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc—186 (226, 266, 306, 346, 386, 426) sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first st, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 19 (24, 29, 34, 39, 44, 49) times, ch 7, skip next sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 19 (24, 29, 34, 39, 44, 49) times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] twice, ch 4, skip next 3 sc; join with a slip st in first sc—47 (57, 67, 77, 87, 97, 107) ch-spaces.
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 5 sc in each of next 2 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in each of next 14 (19, 24, 29, 34, 39, 39) ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 4, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 4 (4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 9) ch-4 spaces, (2 sc, ch 3, 3 sc, triple picot, 2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-7 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 9 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-4 space on previous Panel, ch 2, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (3 sc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 3 sc) in each of next 9 (14, 19, 24, 29, 34, 39) ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, 5 sc in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Panels 10 through 16
Changes for Panels 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, and 16 are in parentheses.
Make 8 (7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2) Wild Roses.
Work same as Panel 8 (7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2) through Panel Edging Round 6.
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 5 sc in each of next 2 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in each of next 34 (29, 24, 19, 14, 9, 4) ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 4, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 9 ch-4 spaces, (2 sc, ch 3, 3 sc, triple picot, slip st around base of triple picot, 2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-7 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-4 space on previous Panel, ch 2, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (3 sc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 3 sc) in each of next 39 (34, 29, 24, 19, 14, 9) ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, 5 sc in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Panel 17 
Make 1 Wild Rose. 
Work same as Panel 1 through Panel Edging Round 6.
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, 5 sc in each of next 2 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, (3 sc, ch 3, 3 sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 4, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (2 sc, ch 3, 3 sc, triple picot, 2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-7 space, (sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (3 sc, ch 2, slip st in corresponding ch-4 space on previous Panel, ch 2, 3 sc) in next ch-4 space, (3 sc, ch 1, slip st in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 3 sc) in each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, (4 sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space on previous Panel, ch 1, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space, 5 sc in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Top Edging 
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join thread in the 2nd sc from the ch-3 space in corner ch-7 space of Panel 17, working across top of shawl, ch 2, 3-dc cluster in same sc, [ch 3, skip next 4 sc, 4-dc cluster in next sc] 7 times, *ch 3, 4-tr cluster worked under panel joining, ch 3, skip next sc, 4-dc cluster in next sc, [ch 3, skip next 4 sc, 4-dc cluster in next sc] 7 times; repeat from * across, turn—152 clusters.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first cluster, (sc, hdc, dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-3 space across, sc in last cluster—151 shells. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Weave in ends. Block shawl.

materials: Bernat™ Satin Sparkle™ (2.8 oz/80 g; 160 yds/146 m) Olive Oil (53562) 4 balls
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 60” [152.5 cm] wide x 18” [45.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 dc and 7 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Center Section
(See Diagram 1 on page 2.)
Beg at bottom center, ch 4.
1st row: (WS). 6 dc in  4th ch from hook.  
7 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as  
2 dc throughout). (1 dc in next dc. 3 dc in 
next dc) twice. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in last 
dc. 13 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 tr in fi rst d c ( counts a s 
2 tr throughout). 1 tr in each of next 3 dc. 
3 dc in next dc.  1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 
3 dc in next dc. 1 tr in each of next 3 dc. 
2 tr in last dc. 19 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each of 
next 5 tr. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of 
next 5 dc. 3 dc in next dc. 1 tr in each of 
next 5 dc. 2 tr in last tr. 25 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each of 
next 7 tr. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of 
next 7 dc. 3 dc in next dc. 1 tr in each of 
next 7 tr. 2 tr in last tr. 31 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each of 
next 9 tr. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of 
next 9 dc. 3 dc in next dc. 1 tr in each of 
next 9 tr. 2 tr in last tr. 37 sts. Turn.
Cont as established inc 6 sts per row until 
21 rows total have been wo rked. 127 sts. 
Do not fasten off.
Right Side (See Diagram 2 on page 2)
1st row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first tr (counts as  
2 tr). 1 tr in each of next 35 sts. 1 dc in each 
of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts.  
1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sl st in next st. 
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd and alt rows: Sl st in each of next  
3 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc 
in each of next 3 dcs. 1 dc in each of next 3 
tr. 1 tr in each tr to last tr. 2 tr in last tr. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each 
tr to last 12 sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 tr.  
1 hdc in each of next 3 dc.  1 sc in each of 
next 3 hdc. Sl st in next sc. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Rep last 2 rows 5 times more. 
Fasten off.
Left Side
Join yarn with sl st to opposite corner tr 
of Center Section. Work as given for Right 
Side. 
Do not fasten off.
Edging (See Diagram 2 on page 2)
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 187 sc evenly across 
top (straight) edge of Shawl. 3 sc in 
corner. 190 across bottom (curved) edge 
of Shawl. 2 sc in last corner sp. Join with  
sl st to first sc.  Turn.

materials: Red Heart® Roll With It Sparkle™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 561 yds/513 m) Magic (9275) 2 ball(s)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 25" [63.5 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long.
gauge: 14 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 88 (multiple of 7 ch + 11). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 5th ch from hook. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 1) 4 times in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row, ending last rep with 1 sc in 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1). Skip first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch-1 sps. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1) twice in first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 1) 4 times in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc) twice in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in 3rd ch of beg ch-4. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1). 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch-1 sps. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 3. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch-1 sps. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in top of beg ch-3. Turn.
Rep 2nd-5th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 70" [178 cm], ending on a 5th row.
Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc3 (4)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 (4) times. Yoh and draw through all 4 (5) loops on hook

Motif-join (join to neighboring motif) = Remove loop from hook (take care not to unravel this loop), insert hook into the corresponding sp of the neighboring motif, return the dropped loop to hook and draw it through, then continue with next part of the instruction.
measurements: Approx 45" [114.5 cm] wide across longer side x 25" [63.5 cm] deep (between longer side and bottom point)
gauge: Motif = 3½" [9 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes
• Shawl is made from 45 Motifs and 8 Triangles arranged following layout diagram.
• Motifs are worked in joined rnds. Triangles are worked back and forth in rows.
• Squares and Triangles are joined tog as they are made using a join-as-you-go technique. The technique replaces some of the sts of 4th rnd with similar sts that also join the motif you are currently making to neighboring motifs. Motifs are joined to neighboring motifs at corners and at the center of side edges.
• The join-as-you-go technique is easy to do once you get the idea. Work 4th rnd as usual EXCEPT, when you reach a corner that needs to be joined to a previous motif, work a motif-join as you work the (dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) at the corner. When you reach the center of a side edge that needs to be joined to a previous motif, work a tr into the center of the side edge of the neighboring motif. Carefully read the description of motif-join in Abbreviations.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
MOTIF 1
See Diagram on page 4.
With A, make an adjustable ring: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work sts of first rnd in the ring. After the first rnd of sts is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 15 dc in ring. Join. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (Ch 7. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts) 3 times. Ch 7. Join. Four 4-dc groups and 4 corner ch-7 sps.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. Dc3tog (counts as beg dc4tog). *Ch 5. (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) in 4th ch of next ch-7 sp. Ch 5. Dc4tog. Rep from * twice more. Ch 5. (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) in 4th ch of last ch-7 sp. Ch 5. Join. 4 dctog, 12 ch-5 sps and 8 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. * 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
MOTIF 2
See Diagram on page 4.
With B, make an adjustable ring. 1st to 3rd rnds: As 1st to 3rd rnds of Motif 1.
Note: 4th rnd is worked the same as 4th rnd of Square 1 EXCEPT, this motif is joined to Square 1 at the corners and side edges, as-you-go. Refer to the layout diagram to see which corners and side edges need to be joined.
4th rnd: (joining rnd). Ch 1. *5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * once more. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. Motif-join. Ch 1. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next st. 1 tr in center of side edge of neighboring motif. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. Motif-join. Ch 1. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next st. Join. Fasten off.
MOTIFS 3 to 45
Work same as Motif 2. Refer to layout diagram for yarn color and placement, taking special care to notice which neighboring motifs this current motif needs to be joined to. As you work Rnd 4, use the join-as-you-go technique at corners and side edges to join to neighboring motif(s).
TRIANGLE 1
See Diagram on page 4.
With A, make an adjustable ring as given for Motif 1.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 7 dc in ring. Turn. 8 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 7. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn. 8 dc and 1 ch-7 sp.
3rd row: Ch 3. Dc3tog (counts as beg dc4tog). Ch 5. (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) in 4th ch of next ch-7 sp. Ch 5. Dc4tog. Turn.
Cont in rnd as follows: 1st rnd: (joining round). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 tr in center of side edge of neighboring motif. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. motif-join. Ch 1. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. 5 sc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in last st. 1 tr in center of side edge of neighboring motif. Cont around triangle: Ch 3. 1 dc in top of last sc made. Ch 3. 1 dc in top of last dc made. Motif-join (to join this triangle to top corner of neighboring triangle). Ch 9. 10 sl sts evenly spaced along lower edge of triangle. Ch 9. Motif-join (to join this triangle to top corner of next neighboring triangle). Ch 4. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Ch 3. 1 dc in top of last dc made. Join. Fasten off.
TRIANGLES 2-8
Work same as Triangle 1. Refer to layout diagram for placement, taking special care to notice which neighboring motifs this current motif needs to be joined to. As you work joining rnd, use the join-as-you-go technique at corners and side edges to join to neighboring motifs.
FINISHING
Top Edging
With RS facing, join A with sl st at beg of first triangle along top edge. Ch 1. 9 sc in each ch-9 sp and sc in each sl st all the way across the top edge. Fasten off.
Weave in any rem ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®” Jumbo: 1 skein 313 Aran.
abbreviations: Vst = (dc, ch 1, dc) all in same st or space.
Shell = (hdc, 2 dc, hdc) all in same space.
measurements: Shawl measures 15” x 55”
gauge: Rows 1 and 2 = 14” wide x 2” at shell points. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
First Half
Ch 54.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 6th ch from hook (counts as first Vst), * ch 2, skip next 5 ch, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) all in next ch, ch 2, skip next 5 ch, Vst in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1), dc in first ch-1 space, * skip next ch-2 space, [shell in next ch-2 space] 3 times, skip next ch-2 space, Vst in next ch-1 space of next Vst; repeat from * across working last Vst in ch-4 space; turn.
Row 3: Ch 4, dc in ch-1 space of first Vst, * ch 2, skip next shell, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) all in first dc of next shell, ch 2, Vst in ch-1 space of next Vst; repeat from * across working last Vst in ch-4 space; turn.
Rows 4-36: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 sixteen more times, then Row 2 again. Fasten off.
Second Half
Turn to work across remaining loops of beginning ch.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With wrong side facing, join yarn in first ch; ch 4, dc in same ch, * ch 2, skip next 5 ch, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) all in next ch, ch 2, skip next 5 ch, Vst in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Rows 2-36: Repeat Rows 2-36 same as for First Half but do NOT fasten off at end of Row 36.
Edging
With right side still facing, ch 1, sc over end of last row, * (sc, ch 2, sc) all over end of next row; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
With right side facing, attach yarn on opposite side and repeat Edging. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 62" [157.5 cm] long x 30" [76 cm] at deepest point.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See chart on page 3.
1st row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). (5 tr. Ch 2. 6 tr) in ring. Turn. 12 tr.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each of next 5 tr. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) in ch-2 sp. 1 tr in each of next 5 tr. 3 tr in last tr. Turn. 20 tr.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in first tr. *(Ch 1. Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next tr. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next tr. 3 tr in last tr. Turn. 28 sts.
4th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each tr and ch-1 sp to ch-2 sp. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) in ch-2 sp. 1 tr in each tr and ch-1 sp to last tr. 3 tr in last tr. Turn. 36 tr.
5th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in first tr. 1 tr in each tr to ch-2 sp. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) in ch-2 sp. 1 tr in each tr to last tr. 3 tr in last tr. Turn. 44 tr.
6th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in first tr. *Ch 1. Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr. Rep from * to ch-2 sp. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr to last tr. 3 tr in last tr. Turn. 52 sts.
7th to 14th rows: Rep 4th to 6th rows twice more, then 4th and 5th rows once. 116 tr.
Break A and join B at end of last row.
With B, proceed as follows:
15th and 16th rows: Rep 6th row once, then 4th row once. 132 tr.
Break B and join C at end of last row.
With C, proceed as follows:
17th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first tr. 1 dc in each tr to ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each tr to last tr. 3 dc in last tr. Turn. 140 dc.
18th row: Ch 5 (counts as dc. Ch 2). *1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Cluster in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. [(Cluster. Ch 1) twice. Cluster] in center ch-2 sp. **Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Cluster in next dc. Rep from ** 4 times more. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
19th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in first dc. *Ch 2. Skip next ch 2. 1 dc in sp between each of next 6 dc. Ch 2. Skip next ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next cluster. Rep from * 5 times more. Ch 2. Skip next ch 1. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in top of next cluster. **Ch 2. Skip next ch 1. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next cluster. Ch 2. Skip next ch 2. 1 dc in sp between each of next 6 dc. Rep from ** 5 times more. Ch 2. Skip next ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster. 1 dc) in last dc. Turn.
20th row: Ch 6 (counts as dc. Ch 3). (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in first ch-2 sp. *Ch 3. Skip next ch 2. 1 dc in sp between each of next 5 dc. Ch 3. Skip next ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 5 times more. Ch 3. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in center ch-2 sp. **Ch 3. Skip next ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in sp between each of next 5 dc. Rep from ** 5 times more. Ch 3. Skip next ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
21st row: Ch 7 (counts as dc. Ch 4). (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in first ch-2 sp. *Ch 4. Skip next ch 3. 1 dc in sp between each of next 4 dc. Ch 4. Skip next ch 3. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 5 times more. Ch 4. Skip next ch 3. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in center ch-2 sp. **Ch 4. Skip next ch 3. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 4. Skip next ch 3. 1 dc in sp between each of next 4 dc. Rep from ** 5 times more. Ch 4. Skip next ch 3. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 4. 1 dc in 3rd ch of beg ch-6. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. 1 dc in sp between each of next 3 dc. Rep from * 5 times more. Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3] 3 times. Skip next ch 4. **1 dc in sp between each of next 3 dc. Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. Rep from ** 5 times more. 2 dc in 3rd ch of beg ch-7. Turn.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Baker’s Cotton: 4 balls each of 565 Purple A, 529 Turquoise B, and 621 Green C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.25mm [US D-3] and 4.0mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Wrap measures 17” wide x 65” long (43 x 165 cm), including fringe
gauge: 23 sts = 4” (10 cm); 27 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Warm Weather 
Wrap
Baker’s Cotton may have started as string 
to tie your bakery box, but this design takes 
it to a whole new level. You’ll love how 
comfortable the crocheted cotton feels on 
your skin—and the colorful stripings will put 
you in a happy place!
Borders
Bottom Border: With smaller hook and C, ch 
25; change to larger hook, working across 
opposite side of foundation ch, slip st in first 
sc, slip st in next ch-1 space, *skip next sc, 
2 hdc in next ch-1 space, skip next sc, slip 
st in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 
sc, skip next sc, slip st in last sc; change to 
smaller hook, ch 25—158 hdc and 82 slip sts. 
Fasten off tightly. Pull beginning tail tightly to 
form a knot.
Top Border: Hold piece with end of last row 
facing; with smaller hook and B, ch 25; 
change to larger hook, slip st in first sc, slip 
st in next ch-1 space, *skip next sc, 2 hdc in 
next ch-1 space, skip next sc, slip st in next 
ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, skip 
next sc, slip st in last sc; change to smaller 
hook, ch 25—158 hdc and 82 slip sts. Fasten 
off tightly. Pull beginning tail tightly to form a 
knot.
FINISHING
Trim beginning and end tails to ¼” (6.35).
ABBREVIATIONS
A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.; ch 
= chain; hdc = half double crochet; sc = 
single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); [ ] = work 
directions in brackets the number of times 
specified; * = repeat whatever follows the *  
as indicated.
See alternate photo on next page.
Wrap measures 17” wide x 65” long  
(43 x 165 cm), including fringe.
Notes
1. Each row begins and ends with a fringe of
25 chains. There are no ends to weave in.
2. Turn piece to opposite side before beginning
each row.
WRAP
With smaller hook and A, ch 25, place marker 
on loop on hook, ch 320, place marker on loop 
on hook, ch 25—370 ch. Fasten off tightly. Pull 
beginning tail tightly to form a knot.
Row 1: With smaller hook, ch 25; change to 
larger hook, sc in first marked ch, remove 
marker, sc in next ch, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc 
in next ch; repeat from * across ending in next 
marked ch, remove marker; change to smaller 
hook, ch 25—161 sc and 159 ch-1 spaces. 
Fasten off tightly. Pull beginning tail tightly to 
form a knot. Turn piece to opposite side.
Row 2: With smaller hook and B, ch 25; 
change to larger hook, sc into first sc, sc in 
next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in 
next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, 
ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc; change to 
smaller hook, ch 25. Fasten off tightly. Pull 
beginning tail tightly to form a knot. Turn piece 
to opposite side.
Repeat Row 2 one hundred seven times 
and change color as in the following color 
sequence. Work 1 row with C, [1 row with A, 
1 row with B, 1 row with C] 3 times, [2 rows 
with A, 2 rows with B, 2 rows with C] 4 times, 
[3 rows with A, 3 rows with B, 3 rows with C] 
4 times, [2 rows with A, 2 rows with B, 2 rows 
with C] 4 times, [1 row with A, 1 row with B, 1 
row with C] 4 times, 1 row with A.
Designed by Jessie Rayot

[US G-6]
Yarn needle, 2 locking stitch 
markers
GAUGE: 23 sts = 4” (10 cm); 27 
rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR 
GAUGE. Use any size hook to 
obtain the gauge given.

Art. 159 available in 100% Cotton,

(Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Turn. 4th row: As 2nd row. 5th row: As 3rd row. 6th row: Ch 6. 1 tr in first dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Turn. 7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 tr in next tr. Turn. 8th row: Ch 6. 1 tr in first tr. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 9th to 12th rows: As 7th and 8th rows twice more. 13th row: Ch 3. Sl st in ch-6 sp of adjacent row. Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 dc in next tr. Turn. 14th row: Ch 6. 1 dc in first dc. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Turn. 15th row: Ch 3. Sl st in ch-6 sp of adjacent row. Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Turn. 16th row: Ch 6. 1 dc in first dc. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Turn. 17th row: Ch 3. Sl st in ch-6 sp of adjacent row. Ch 3. 1 tr in first dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Turn. 18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 tr in next tr. Turn. 19th row: Ch 6. 1 tr in first tr. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 20th to 23rd rows: As 18th and 19th rows twice more. 24th row: Ch 3. Sl st in ch-6 sp of adjacent row. Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in in next tr. Turn. 25th row: Ch 6. 1 dc in first dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Turn. With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. Puff st] in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 tr in each of last 3 sc. Fasten off. Turn. 6th row: Join B with sl st to first tr. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 tr. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Sl st in first ch-6 sp of Bruges Lace Strip. (1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Midnight™: 5 balls 1939 Whisper.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Wrap measures 68” at widest point x 35” at longest point.
gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 7 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 164.
Row 1: Work (dc, ch 2, dc) in 8th ch from hook, *ch 3, skip 4 ch, work (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, ch 2, skip 2 ch, dc in last ch.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 4 (counts as tr here and throughout), turn, skip next ch-2 space, *work 5 tr in next ch-2 space, skip next ch 3-space; repeat from * to last ch-2 space, skip ch-2 space, tr in last dc – 162 tr.
Row 3: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2), skip next 2 tr, (dc, ch 2,dc) in next tr, *ch 3, skip next 4 tr, work (dc, ch 2,dc) in next tr; repeat from * across to last 3 tr, ch 2, dc in top of beginning ch.
Rows 4-16: Repeat Rows 2-3 for 6 times, then Row 2 once. Fasten off.
Shape Center Back
Row 17 (Wrong Side): With wrong side facing, skip first 55 tr, join yarn in next tr, ch 5, skip next 2 tr, (dc, ch 2, d) in next tr, *ch 3, skip next 4 tr, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next tr; repeat from * 8 more times, ch 2, dc in next tr, leave remaining 55 tr unworked.
Row 18: Ch 4, turn, skip next ch-2 space, *work 5 tr in next ch-2 space, skip next ch 3-space; repeat from * to last ch-2 space, skip ch-2 space, tr in last dc – 52 tr.
Row 19: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2), skip next 2 tr, (dc, ch 2,dc) in next tr, *ch 3, skip next 4 tr, work (dc, ch 2,dc) in next tr; repeat from * across to last 3 tr, ch 2, dc in top of beginning ch.
Rows 20-34: Repeat Rows 18-19 for 7 times, then Row 18 once. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right side facing, join yarn in first st along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in each ch across. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 12 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

MOTIF (Make 1 each in Color 1, Color 2, Color 4 and Color 5):
Note: Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as 1 dc and ch 3. Ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 6. [Four groups of 3 dc, four ch-3 sps forming corners]. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 6. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 6. 
4th rnd: Sl st in first ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in corner ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 6. Rep last rnd until Motif measures approx 19½ (20½-21½)" [49.5 (52-54.5) cm] square. Fasten off.

Assembly (See Diagram on page 3). Sew 4 Motifs tog using a flat seam to form a square. Fold work in half with WS facing and seam at top. Place markers 8" [20.5 cm] down from fold at each side. Sew side seams from marker to bottom using flat seam.

Cuffs: With RS facing, join Color 3 with sl st to Armhole at side seam. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. Work 48 hdc evenly around entire armhole opening. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp in first hdc. *1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdcbp around last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdcfp. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp in first hdcfp. *1 hdcbp around next hdcbp. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * to last hdcbp. 1 hdcbp around last hdcbp. Join with sl st to first hdcfp. 
Rep 3rd rnd until work from beg measures approx 3" [7.5 cm].

Ribbing: With RS facing, join Color 3 with sl st to Front opening at side centre back seam. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. Work 234 (246-258) hdc evenly around entire Front opening. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first hdc. *1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdcbp around last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdcfp. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first hdcfp. *1 hdcbp around next hdcbp. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Rep from * to last hdcbp. 1 hdcbp around last hdcbp. Join with sl st to first hdcfp. 
Rep 3rd rnd until work from beg measures approx 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off.

28th row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. *Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. 1 dc in sp between each of next 4 dc. Rep from * 6 times more. Ch 3. Skip next ch 4. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3] 3 times. Skip next ch-4 sp. **1 dc in sp between each of next 4 dc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-4 sp. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Skip next ch-4 sp. Rep from ** 6 times more. 2 dc in 3rd ch of beg ch-7. Turn.
29th row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. Skip next (dc, ch-3 sp). *Ch 3. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Skip next cluster. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in sp between each of next 2 dc. Skip next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 6 times more. [(Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Skip next cluster. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp.] 3 times. **1 dc in sp between each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-3 sp. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Skip next cluster. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** 6 times more. Skip next dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
30th row:  Ch 3. Skip next (dc, ch-3 sp) *(Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in sp between next 2 dc. Rep from * 6 times more. **(Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from ** twice more. ***1 dc in sp between next 2 dc. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. [(Cluster. Ch 2) twice. Cluster] in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 2. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from *** 6 times more. 1 dc in last dc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Curly Q™”: 1 Ball each 7931 Granite A and 7970 Mexicali B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Neck Warmer measures 16” wide x 11” long, unbuttoned.
gauge: 7 tr = 4”; 3 rows = 4” using 2 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NECK WARMER
Holding 1 strand of A and B together throughout, ch 23.
Row 1: Tr in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across.
Rows 2 -12: Ch 3, (counts as a tr here and throughout), turn, tr in each st across – 20 sts.
Row 13: Ch 2, turn, dc in each tr across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Sew 1 button, 1” from one side edge on Row 13. Sew second button 2” from first button. Buttons will be pushed through sts of Row 1.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® O’Go® (5 oz/141 g; 228 yds/250 m) Gold/Soft Pink (40018) 5 O’Gos
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Beg Dtr5tog (worked over 5 sts) = Ch 5 (counts as dtr). [(Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops) 3 times] 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Beginning double treble 5 together made. Counts as 1 stitch.
Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times - Double treble made.
Mosaic Dc = Working in front of chain spaces, work 1 dc in next skipped sc 3 rows below
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 13 sts and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Mosaic pattern. 13 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Track Stitch pattern.
instructions:
Notes
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Start stitching!
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
• Carry color not in use loosely up side of work.
• Each skipped sc has ch-2 worked above it for 2 rows. This establishes the ‘gap’ where Mosaic Dc will later be worked.
• Mosaic Dc always replaces sc directly behind it on working row.
• WS of your work maintains alternating 2-row striped pattern because you are working in front of chain spaces each time you work Mosaic Dc - you are never working around chain-spaces. The chain-spaces sit behind Mosaic Dc.
With A, ch 101. (See diagram on page 3). 
1st row: (RS). With A, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last 2 ch. Sc2tog. Turn. 100 sc. 
2nd row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 7 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
4th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic Dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 
6th row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic Dc. *Ch 2. Skip next st. Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic Dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
8th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *(Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic Dc) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Mosaic Dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
10th row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st) twice. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Mosaic Dc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Mosaic Dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
12th row: With B, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: With A, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Mosaic Dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
14th row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
These 14 rows form Mosaic Pat.
Break B.
With A, proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: As 1st row. Turn.
4th row: Beg Dtr5tog. 1 dtr in each sc to last sc. 5 Dtr in last sc. Turn.
These 4 rows form Track St. 
Rep last 4 rows Track St 10 times more, ending last rep on a 3rd row. 
Beg on 2nd row, rep 2nd to 14th rows of Mosaic Pat, placing marker at either end of 7th row. Break A.
With B, rep 1st to 4th rows of Track St 11 times total, ending last rep on a 3rd row. 
Beg on 2nd row, rep 2nd to 14th rows of Mosaic Pat.
Fasten off.
Border
With RS facing and Track St section in A at left, join A with sl to edge of Shawl at marker.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly to next marker, working 3 sc in each corner. Join B. Do not break A but leave at WS of work. Work sc evenly around, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc, changing colors to match previous rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Wrap measures 17” x 70”.
gauge: 7 dc = 4”; 7 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
NOTE: Wrap is worked with 2 strands of yarn held together throughout.

WRAP
Holding 2 strands of yarn together, ch 122.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 5, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, *work 5 sc in ch-5 space, sc in next sc; repeat from * to end.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next 5 sc, *skip next sc, ch 1, dc in next 5 sc; repeat from * to last sc, dc in last sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, *ch 5, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last ch-1 space, ch 5, sc in last dc.
Rows 5-24: Repeat Rows 2-4, end with Row 3.
Row 25: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc and ch-1 space across.
Row 26: Ch 3, turn, *dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * to end.
Row 27: Ch 3, turn, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 4, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 dc, ch 2, dc in top of beginning ch.
Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, *work 5 dc in ch-4 space, sc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * to last ch-4 space, 5 dc in last ch-4 space, sc in last 2 dc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 Ball each 5705 Snapdragon A, 5830 Periwinkle B, 5510 Beach Glass C, 5520 Eucalyptus D and 5910 Lipstick E.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Sleeve Width: 14 (16, 21)”. Sleeve Length: 24”. Shrug Length From Shoulder: 7 (8, 10½)”.
gauge: 14 dc = 4”; 6 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Work in continuous rounds, placing a marker for beginning of round.

SHRUG
Left Bell Sleeve
With A, ch 51 (57, 63), slip st in first ch to join, taking care not to twist sts. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Dc in each ch around – 51 (57, 63) sts.
Round 2: Dc in each dc around.
Round 3: [Ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next 2 dc] around.
Rounds 4-12: [Ch 1, dc in next 2 dc] around.
Rounds 13-22: Change to B and repeat Round 4.
Rounds 23-32: Change to C and repeat Round 4.
Rounds 33-37: Change to D and repeat Round 4.
Shape Shoulder
Shoulder, Front and Back are worked back and forth in rows.
Row 1: [Dc in next 2 dc, ch 1] 16 (18, 20) times, dc in last 2 dc – 50 (56, 62) sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next dc, [ch 1, dc in next 2 dc] across.
Shape Back
Row 3: Turn, keeping in pattern st, work across 23 (26, 29) sts, leave remaining sts unworked for Left Front.
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, [ch 1, dc in next 2 dc] 7 (8, 9) times – 23 (26, 29) sts.
Rows 5-8 (10, 12): Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, [ch 1, dc in next 2 dc] 7 (8, 9) times.
Last Row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each dc and ch-1 space across – 23 (26, 29) hdc.
Fasten off.
Right Cap Sleeve
With E, ch 51 (57, 63), slip st in first ch to join, taking care not to twist sts. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Dc in each ch around – 51 (57, 63) dc.
Round 2: Dc in each dc around.
FINISHING
Holding Left Back and Right Back with right sides together, join E in first st and working through both layers, sc in each sc to join Left and Right Backs together.
Fasten off.
Lower Edging
Row 1: With right side facing and working across lower edge of joined Back, join A in side edge, ch 2, hdc 32 (42, 48) sts evenly spaced along lower edge of Back.
Rows 2-3: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each hdc – 33 (43, 49) hdc.
Fasten off.
Left Front
Row 3: Join D in next unworked dc on Row 3 of Left Bell Sleeve, ch 3, [working in each dc and ch-1 space, dc in next 5 sts, skip next st] 3 times, dc in each st to end of row, dc in each row of Lower Edging – 26 (29, 32) dc.
Rows 4-5 (7, 9): Ch 3, turn, dc in in each dc across.
Row 6 (8, 10): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc to last 4 dc, leave remaining sts unworked – 22 (25, 28) dc.
Last Row: Ch 3, turn, skip next dc, hdc in next 2 dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, hdc in next 2 dc] to end of row, ch 100 for Tie.
Fasten off.
Right Front
Row 2: Join E in next unworked dc on Row 2 of Right Sleeve, ch 3, [working in each dc and ch-1 space, dc in next 5 sts, skip next st] 3 times, dc in each st to end of row, dc in each row of Lower Edging – 26 (29, 32) dc.
Rows 3-4 (6, 8): Ch 3, turn, dc in in each dc across.
Row 5 (7, 9): Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc to last 4 dc, leave remaining sts unworked – 22 (25, 28) dc.
Last Row: Ch 3, turn, skip next dc, hdc in next 2 dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, hdc in next 2 dc] to end of row, ch 100 for Tie.
Fasten off.
Sew Shoulders together, leaving 8” in center of Back unsewn for Neck. Weave in ends.
Thread Tie through Last Row of Fronts to lace together.

materials: RED HEART® Fashion Soft™: 1 ball each 4650 Artichoke A, 4604 Navy B, and 9440 Grey Heather C
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Shawl measures 48” (122 cm) wide x 24” (61 cm) tall.
gauge: 14 sts and 6 rows dc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
With A, form an adjustable ring
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc, here and throughout), (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ring; turn – 6 dc; 1 ch-3 space. Pull tail to close center ring
Row 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in first st, ch 5, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 5, skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch-3 – 10 dc; 1 ch-3 space; 2 ch-5 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in first st, ch 5, (sc, ch 5) in each ch-5 space across to next ch-3 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 5, (sc, ch 5) in each ch-5 space across to last 3 dc, skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch-3 – 10 dc; 1 ch-3 space; 4 ch-5 spaces.
Rows 4–30: Repeat Row 3 – 10 dc; 1 ch-3 space; 58 ch-5 spaces at end of last row.
Fasten off A, join B.
Rows 31–34: With B, repeat Row 3 – 10 dc; 1 ch-3 space; 66 ch-5 spaces at end of last row. Fasten off B, join C.
Row 35: With C, repeat Row 3 – 10 dc; 1 ch-3 space; 68 ch-5 spaces at end of last row.
Row 36: Ch 3, 2 dc in first st, (sl st, ch 1, 3 sc, ch 1, sl st) in each ch-5 space across to next ch-3 space, (sl st, ch 1, 2 sc, picot, 2 sc, ch 1, sl st) in next ch-3 space, (sl st, ch 1, 3 sc, ch 1, sl st) in each ch-5 space across to last 3 dc, 3 dc in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Croquette™ (1.6 oz/45 g; 239 yds/219 m) 160 g
Size U.S. C/2 (2.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Shell = (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in indicated stitch
measurements: Approx 14½ x 52" [37 x 132 cm].
gauge: 2 pat repeats (30 sts) and 16 rows = 5" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as ddc throughout. Ch 394. Place marker on every 50th ch for easier counting. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Ch 7. Skip next 5 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 7. Skip next 5 ch.** Shell in next ch. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp.** Ch 3. Shell in top (ch-1 sp) of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. Ch 3. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *11 tr in next ch-5 sp.** Shell in top of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in first tr. (Ch 3. Skip next tr. 1 sc in next tr) 5 times. Ch 2.** Shell in top of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *(Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 5 times. Ch 3.** Shell in top of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Ch 4. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 3 times. Ch 4.** Shell in top of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Ch 5. Skip next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 5.** Shell in top of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Ch 7. Skip next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 7.** Shell in top of next shell. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 8th rows for pat 6 times more. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 7. Skip next (2 dc. Ch 5. sc). 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 7. Skip next (sc, ch-5, 2 dc).** 1 sc in next ch-2 sp (top of shell). Rep from *, ending last rep at **. 1 sc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc and each ch, skipping sc and dc. 1 sc in corner. Do not turn. 
Edging: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working across side of Shawl, work 2 sc around each dc down left side edge to corner (100 sc). 1 sc in corner. Work 1 sc in each of rem loop of foundation ch. 1 sc in corner. 2 sc around each dc up right side edge to corner. 1 sc in corner. Turn. 593 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. 1 hdc in top of last sc worked. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around to first sc of previous row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin Shawl to measurements and cover with damp cloth leaving cloth to dry.

abbreviations: *or ** or *** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** or *** as indicated
[  ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Shawl measures 18” wide x 56” long.
gauge: 2 repeats = 5½”; 8 rows = 5¼”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Shawl is worked in 2 sections from the center back to the front. 
SHAWL
First Side
Ch 57.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 3 ch, * ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 2 ch, dc in next 5 ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next 4 dc, * ch 4, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * across working last dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 3: Ch 6, skip first 2 dc, sc in next dc, * ch 3, 5 dc in ch-4 space, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts; ch 3, skip next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 4: Ch 7, skip first dc, skip sc, * dc in next 5 dc, ch 4; repeat from * to last st; dc in 3rd ch of ch-6; turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, 4 dc in first ch-4 space, * ch 3, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc, ch 3 **, 5 dc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * to last space, end at **; 4 dc in ch-7 space, dc in 3rd ch of ch-7; turn.
Rows 6-41: Repeat Rows 2-5. At end of Row 41, fasten off.
Second Side
Row 1 (Right Side): With right side facing, join yarn in end ch under last dc of Row 1; ch 3, dc in next 4 ch, * ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 2 ch, dc in next 5 ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Rows 2-41: Work same as for First Side except at end of Row 41, do NOT fasten off; turn to work border.
Border
Round 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, ** (sc, ch 3, sc) in first (corner) dc, skip next dc; 5 dc in next dc – shell made; * skip next 2 dc, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, shell in next dc; repeat from * across to next corner; skip next dc, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in ch-3 space (corner); work across side to center ch: [shell in next row end, skip next row, sc in next row end] 13 times, shell in next row end, sc in center ch; work across from center to end of side: shell in next row end, sc in next row end, [skip next row, shell in next row end, sc in next row end] 12 times, skip next row, shell in next row end; repeat from ** once more; join with a slip st in first sc; turn – 28 shells each long edge.
Round 2 (Right Side): Slip st to center dc of next shell; ch 1, sc in same dc; ** work across side: * shell in next sc, sc in center dc of next shell; repeat from * to next corner; ch 1, skip next 2 dc and next sc, 7 dc in corner ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in center dc of next shell; work across remaining sts of end: [ch 1, 7 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in center dc of next shell] 5 times, ch 1, 7 dc in next corner ch-3 space, ch 1, skip next sc and next 2 dc ***, sc in next dc; repeat from ** once more, end at ***; join to first sc; turn.
Round 3 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in each ch-1 space and in each sc around working 3 sc in center dc of each shell or 7-dc-group; join to first sc; turn.
Round 4 (Right Side): Slip st in next sc, * ch 3, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc, (slip st, ch 3, slip st) all in next (center) sc, [ch 3, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] twice; repeat from * a total of 27 times; work first corner pattern: (ch 3, slip st) all in same sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, (slip st, ch 3, slip st, ch 4, slip st, ch 3, slip st) all in next (corner) sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, (slip st, ch 3, slip st) all in next sc; work across end: ** ch 3, skip 2 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, (slip st, ch 3, slip st) all in next sc, [ch 3, skip 2 sc, slip st in next sc] twice; repeat from ** a total of 5 times; work 2nd corner: (ch 3, slip st) all in same sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, (slip st, ch 3, slip st, ch 4, slip st, ch 3, slip st) all in next (corner) sc; repeat from * once more; join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Designer Sport®: 3 balls 3101 Ivory
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 19” x 60” (48 x 152 cm).
gauge: 2 repeats of pattern = 6” (15 cm); 6 rows = 3½” (9 cm) in Pattern st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: Ch 2, skip first sc, *sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * around, placing [sc, ch 1] twice in each corner st, join with slip st to first sc. Repeat this round 3 more times. Final rnd: Ch 3, skip first sc, *sc in next ch-1 space, ch 3, skip 1 sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Pattern Stitch Row 1: [Dc, ch 3, dc] in 4th ch from hook, *ch 3, skip 3 ch, sc in next 3 ch, ch 3, skip 3 ch, [dc, ch 3, dc] in next ch, repeat from * across, turn. Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, *7 dc in ch-3 sp, ch 3, skip [dc, 3 ch, sc], sc in next sc, ch 3, skip [sc, 3 ch, dc], repeat from *, ending 7 dc in last ch 3 space, turn. Row 3: Ch 1, skip first dc, sc in next 6 dc, *ch 5, skip [3 ch, sc, 3 ch], sc in next 7 dc, repeat from *, turn. Row 4: Ch 6, skip first 2 sc, *sc in next 3 sc, ch 3, skip [2 sc, 2 ch], [dc, ch 3, dc] in next ch, ch 3, skip [2 ch, 2 sc] rep from * ending sc in next 3 sc, ch 3, skip 1 sc, dc in last st, turn. Row 5: Ch 6, skip [first dc, 3 ch, 1 sc], *sc in next sc, ch 3, skip [sc, 3 ch, dc], 7 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip [dc, 3 ch, sc], repeat from * ending ch 3, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn. Row 6: Ch 5, skip [first dc, 3 ch, sc, 3 ch], *sc in next 7 dc, ch 5, skip [3 ch, sc, 3 ch] repeat from * ending sc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn. Row 7: Ch 3, skip [first sc, 2 ch], * [dc, ch 3, dc] in next ch, ch 3, skip [2 ch, 2 sc], sc in next 3 sc, ch 3, skip [2 sc, 2 ch] repeat from *, ending [dc, ch 3, dc] in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn. Repeat rows 2-7 for pattern. SHAWL Ch 64. Begin Pattern st. Work even until piece measures 60” (152 cm) from beginning, ending with row 7 of Pattern st. Border Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1), *working evenly along narrow edge of shawl, work [dc, ch 1] across, placing 21 dcs along edge; working evenly along long edge of shawl, work [sc, ch 1] or [dc, ch 1] into edge as needed to create a straight edge; repeat from *. Do not turn.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 445 yds/407 m) Cinnamon Sugar (49013) 4 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 26" x 75" [66 x 190.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Texture Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To change colors, work to last loops on hook of first color then draw new color through rem loops.
• Carry color when not in use loosely up side of work.
• Work 2 rows from first Cake – considered Color 1, then work 2 rows from second Cake – considered Color 2, noting when joining a new cake, take care to match color change stripe in Cake to keep striping pattern consistent and to achieve shade effect shown, beg each cake with different shade.
• Leftover yarn can be used for fringe.
• Turning ch 2 does not count as st.

SHAWL
With Color 1, ch 94.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 92 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first dc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped ch from foundation row (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Join Color 2. Turn.
3rd row: With Color 2, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join Color 1. Turn.
5th and 6th rows: With Color 1, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join Color 2 at end of 6th row.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for Texture Pat until Shawl measures approx 75" [190.5 cm], ending on a 5th row of pat.
Next row: (WS). With Color 1, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 skipped dc 2 rows below (working around ch 2). Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of yarn 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands of contrast colors together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Shawl. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Satin™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 200 yds/182 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit bust measurement: XS/M 28-38" [71-96.5 cm], L/XL 40-46" [101.5-117 cm], 2/3 XL 48-52" [122-132 cm]. Finished bust: XS/M 39" [99 cm], L/XL 46" [117 cm], 2/3XL 52" [132 cm].
gauge: 14 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: 
• Body is worked in one piece from neck edge down to armholes. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
• Move markers in same manner as established in 3rd row.

BODY
Beg at neck edge, ch 46 (52-62).
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 3 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 (6-6) ch. 2 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 27 (31-41) ch. 2 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 5 (6-6) ch. 3 dc in last ch. Turn. 51 (57-67) dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (inc made). 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 (7-7) dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 29 (33-43) dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 (7-7) dc. 2 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn. 61 (67-77) dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (inc made). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc.*2 dc in next dc, placing marker on last dc worked. 2 dc in next dc, placing marker on first dc worked.* 1 dc in each of next 8 (9-9) dc. Rep from * to *. 1 dc in each of next 31 (35-45) dc. Rep from * to *. 1 dc in each of next 8 (9-9) dc. Rep from * to *. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 71 (77-87) dc.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (inc made). *1 dc in each dc to next 2 marked dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 marked dc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. (10 dc inc).
5th row: Ch 3. *1 dc in each dc to next 2 marked dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 marked dc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. (8 dc inc).
Rep last 2 rows 5 (6-7) times more. 179 (203-231) dc.
Next row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 25 (28-29) dc (Right Front). 2 dc in each of next 2 marked dc. 1 dc in each of next 32 (37-41) dc (Right Sleeve). 2 dc in each of next 2 marked dc. 1 dc in each of next 55 (63-81) dc (Back). 2 dc in each of next 2 marked dc. 1 dc in each of next 32 (37-41) dc (Left Sleeve). 2 dc in each of next 2 marked dc. 1 dc in each of next 26 (29-30) dc (Left Front). Turn. 187 (211-239) dc. Do not fasten off.
Divide for left Sleeve: With RS facing, join separate length of yarn with sl st into last marked st of left Back. Ch 5 (6-7). Join ch with sl st in first marked st before Left Sleeve (after Left Front). Fasten off.
Next rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in marked st before left sleeve. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 36 (41-45) dc of sleeve. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6-7) ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 41 (47-52) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Divide for right Sleeve: With RS facing, join separate length of yarn with sl st into last marked before Right Sleeve (after Right Front). Ch 5 (6-7). Join ch with sl st in first marked st of right Back. Fasten off. 
Next rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in marked st before right sleeve. Ch 1 (counts as dc). 1 sc in each of next 36 (41-45) dc of sleeve. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6-7) ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 41 (47-52) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Body: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 27 (30-31) dc (Left Front). 1 dc in each rem loop of next 5 (6-7) ch. 1 dc in each of next 59 (67-85) dc (Back). 1 dc in each rem loop of next 5 (6-7) ch. 1 dc in each of next 28 (31-32) dc (Right Front). Turn. 125 (141-163) dc. Place markers at each end of last row.
2nd row: Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog made. 1 dc in each dc to last 3 dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more. 111 (127-149) dc. Fasten off.

COLLAR AND EDGING: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at left front ‘side seam’. Ch 1. Work 63 (73-91) sc across back to right front ‘side seam, 16 (18-21) sc across straight edge of right front, 18 sc around curved edge of right front to marker, 35 (39-41) sc up right front edge, 29 (33-38) sc across back neck edge, 35 (39-41) sc down left front edge to marker, 18 sc around curved edge of left front and 17 (20-23) sc across straight edge of left front. Join with sl st to first sc. 231 (258-291) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 2 sc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) – V-st made in next sc.* Rep from * to * 25 (29-36) times more. (Skip next sc. V-st in next sc) 9 times. Rep from * to * 33 (37-40) times more. (Skip next sc. V-st in next sc) 9 times. Rep from * to * 4 (5-6) times more. Skip last 2 sc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
3rd rnd: Sl st across to ch-1 sp of next V-st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. * (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) – shell made in ch-1 sp of next V-st. 1 sc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Sl st across to ch-1 sp of next shell. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. V-st in next sc. Ch 3. 1 sc in ch-1 sp of next shell. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 sc in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting 3 dc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Sl st in next dc. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1). 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next dc, sc and next ch-2 sp. V-st in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-2 sp, sc and next dc. V-st in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting V-st at end of last rep. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
7th to 9th rnds: As 3rd to 5th rnds.
10th rnd: (inc rnd). Sl st in next dc. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1). 1 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Skip next dc and sc. V-st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. V-st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc and dc. V st in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting V-st at end of last rep. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
11th to 18th rnds: As 3rd to 6th rnds twice more.
19th rnd: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® It’s a Wrap™, 1 ball 9243 Western
abbreviations: () = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Wrap measures 16" (40.5 cm) long x 69" (175 cm) wide.
gauge: 17 rows in pattern stitch = 4” (10 cm). 20 dc on Row 3 of pattern = 4” (10 cm).
instructions:
Chain 442.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 8th ch from hook (counts as first ch-4 loop), *(ch 4, skip 3 chains, sc in next ch) 3 times**, ch 8, skip 6 chains, sc in next ch; repeat from * 22 times, ending last repeat at **; ch 4, skip 3 chains, dc in last ch; turn—71 ch-4 loops and 22 ch-8 loops.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc now and throughout), 5 dc in first ch-4 loop, *sc in next ch-4 loop, (ch 4, sc in next ch-4 loop) twice**, 10 dc in next ch-8 loop; repeat from * 22 times, ending last repeat at **; 6 dc in last ch-4 loop; turn.
