Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2togbl = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches in back loops only. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only of next stitch
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I and J). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I and J.
• When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.

Stripe Pat 
With I, work 2 rows. 
With A, work 4 rows. 
With B, work 4 rows. 
With C, work 4 rows. 
With D, work 4 rows. 
With A, work 2 rows. 
With I, work 2 rows. 
With A, work 2 rows. 
With E, work 4 rows. 
With G, work 4 rows. 
With H, work 4 rows. 
With I, work 2 rows. 
With F, work 2 rows. 
With C, work 4 rows. 
With F, work 2 rows. 
With D, work 4 rows. 
With F, work 2 rows. 
With B, work 4 rows. 
With F, work 2 rows.
With I, work 2 rows.
With H, work 4 rows.
With G, work 4 rows.
With E, work 4 rows.
With F, work 2 rows.
With I, work 2 rows.
With F, work 2 rows.
With D, work 4 rows.
With C, work 4 rows.
With B, work 4 rows.
With A, work 4 rows.
With I, work 2 rows. 
These 96 rows form Stripe Pat. 

SHAWL
With F, ch 119. Break F. With I, ch 1 to form 120th ch. Total of 120 ch. 
See diagram on page 3. 
Cont with I as follows: 
1st row:  (RS). With I, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 5 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. *Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 5 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc). Skip next 2 sc. 1 scbl in each of next 8 sc. 5 scbl in next sc. 1 scbl in each of next 8 sc. *Skip next 4 sc. 1 scbl in each of next 8 sc. 5 scbl in next sc. 1 scbl in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Skip next 2 sc. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. 
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row until all 104 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Fill Valleys Along Last Row:
With RS facing, join F with sl st through back loop of 4th st in 5-scbl cluster at first chevron peak (see diagram).
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Skip first ch where F was joined. 1 scbl in each of next 7 sc. Skip next 4 sc. 1 scbl in each of next 6 sc. Sc2togbl. Turn.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Skip first st. 1 scbl in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 4 sc. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sc. Sc2togbl. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Skip first st. 1 scbl in next sc. Skip next 4 sc. 1 scbl in next sc. Skip next sc. Ch 1. Sl st in first ch of 2nd row. Fasten off.** 
Rep for all 6 Valleys along last row. 
FIll Valleys Along First Row: With RS facing, join F with sl st through 2nd ch at first chevron peak (see diagram). 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Skip first ch where F was joined. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Fill Valleys Along Last Row. 
Rep for all 7 Valleys along first row.

pattern_name: WRAP IT UP TUNISIAN CROCHET SHAWL
materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m) Contrast A Citadel (62048) 4 balls
Size U.S. 8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ Tunisian crochet hook 10" [25.5 cm] long or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 56" [142 cm] wide x 22" [56 cm] deep.
gauge: 20 sts and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Tunisian Simple Stitch (Tss).
instructions:
Notes: 
• Work all rows with RS of work facing.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
First Wedge: With A and Tunisian hook, ch 256. 
Note: Work into horizontal bumps at back of foundation chain for 1st row. 
1st row: Forward pass: ( Right to left). Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in each rem ch to end of chain, leaving all loops on hook. 256 sts on hook. Do not turn.
Return pass: ( Left to right after working Forward pass of each row). Yoh and draw through last loop only (for edge st). *Yoh and draw through 2 loops. Rep from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn. 
**2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). *1Tss in next st. Rep from * to last 8 sts before marker. PM on last st. Leave rem sts unworked. Return pass. 
3rd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). *1Tps in next st. Rep from * to last 8 sts. PM on last st. Leave rem sts unworked. Return pass. 
Rep last 2 rows of Tss/Tps pat, working 8 sts less on every Forward pass row until there are 8 sts rem. 
Next row: Forward pass: ( Right to left). *1Tss (or Tps) in next st. Rep from * to end of row.** 256 sts. Remove markers. Return pass. 
Second Wedge: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 16 sts. Join B.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Wedge. 
Third Wedge: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 16 sts. Join C.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Wedge. 
Changing colors in the following sequence: A, B, C, work as follows:
***Next Wedge: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 16 sts. Join corresponding color.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Wedge. Join corresponding color.***
Changing colors as established, rep from *** to *** until all sts will be worked, ending with:   
“Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of rem 16 sts. " Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz; 149 m/163 yds) 2 balls each of:
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 24 x 70 ins [61 x 178 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Shawl is worked widthwise.
With A, ch 227.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 226 sc. Turn.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Join B. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are completed.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 hdc. *(Pulling long loop, 1 sc in next foundation ch two rows below – long sc made) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
5th row: With C, Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *Long sc in each of next 2 hdc two rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * ending with 1 sc in last hdc. Join A. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 hdc. *Long sc in each of next 2 hdc two rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
8th row: As 2nd row joining D at end of row. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 5th to 8th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 24 ins [61 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS facing join A with sl st to left corner of side edge. Work in sc across side edge of Shawl. Fasten off. Rep across other side.

materials: Caron® Skinny Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 795 yds/727 m) Baked Alaska (18008) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times - double treble crochet made.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 1 triangle = 1½" [4 cm].
instructions:
Ch 140. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch. Skip next 5 ch (from foundation chain). 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. (23 Triangles). Turn.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 6. *Working across opposite side of ch-6 from previous row, 1 sc in first ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch. Rep from * last ch-6. 1 sc in first ch. Leave rem ch unworked. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in first dtr. Ch 1. 1 sc in first dtr. *Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch. Skip next 5 sts. 1 sc in next dtr. Rep from * to end of row working last sc in top of beg ch-6 of previous row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th to 8th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows twice more.
9th row: Sl st in first dtr. Ch 13. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch. Skip next 5 ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice, working last sc in next dtr. *Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch. Skip next 5 sts. 1 sc in next dtr. Rep from * to end of row working last sc in top of beg ch-6 of previous row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 9th rows until 1 triangle rem.
Next row: (WS). Ch 6. 1 sc in first ch of ch-6 from previous row. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Work sc evenly around entire edge of Shawl, working into ch (not around ch) and having 3 sc in each corner “peak” and sc2tog in each “valley”. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Soft®: 2 balls 3729 Grape A
Red Heart® Boutique Sashay®: 2 balls 1960 Boogie B
Sewing thread, sewing needle, yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Size: 48” wide x 16” long [122 cm wide x 405⁄8 cm long]
gauge: (Shell, ch 2) = 1¾” (4½ cm); 3 Shells rows = 2” (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
This beautifully designed shawl is shaped to wrap your shoulders in stylish comfort. Crochet it to finish a dressy outfit or to add feminine allure to more casual attire.
Yarn Note: Stretch one end of B open for 10” (25.5 cm) and lay flat, with the edge with the metallic thread at the bottom. Work stitches into the top two mesh loop threads of the yarn, leaving the metallic edge loose to form Ruffle.
With wrong side of Shawl facing, join eighth mesh loop of B with slip st in end of row.
Row 9 (Wrong side): Ch 1, change to B, holding B in back of work, pull up a loop in 8th loop of mesh, work ruffle sc in first dc, [skip 1 dc, ruffle sc in next dc] across, ending with ruffle sc in last dc. Do not turn. Leaving a 4” (10 cm) end, fasten off—31 ruffle sc.
Row 10 (Wrong side): With wrong side facing, pick up A and slip st in first ruffle sc, (ch 4, 3 dc) in first ruffle sc, 2 dc in each of next 29 ruffle sc, 4 dc in last ruffle sc, turn—66 dc.
Row 11 (Right side): (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, skip 2 dc, ch 2, shell in next dc, [ch 2, skip 5 dc, shell in next dc] 10 times, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc, turn—11 shells, 6 dc.
Row 12: [(Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in next dc] (counts as first shell), ch 2, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2] 11 times, [3 dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc] (counts as last shell), turn—13 shells.
Row 13: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1] 12 times, shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc, turn—13 shells, 18 dc.
Row 14: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 1, V-st in ch-2 space, ch 1, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, V-st in next dc, ch 1] 12 times, shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, V-st in ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 dc in last dc, turn—13 shells, 14 V-sts, 6 dc.
Row 15: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in next dc, 3 dc in V-st, [dc in each of next 6 dc, 3 dc in V-St] 13 times, 3 dc in next dc, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in last dc, turn—132 dc. Do not fasten off.
Row 16 (Wrong side): Ch 1, change to B, holding B in back of work, pull up a loop in 8th loop of mesh, work ruffle sc in first dc, [skip 1 dc, ruffle sc in next dc] across, ending with ruffle sc in last dc. Do not turn. Leaving a 4” (10 cm) end, fasten off—67 ruffle sc.
Row 17 (Wrong side): With wrong side facing, pick up A and slip st in first ruffle sc, (ch 4, 3 dc) in first ruffle sc, 2 dc in each of next 65 ruffle sc, 4 dc in last ruffle sc, turn—138 dc.
Row 18 (Right side): (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, skip 2 dc, ch 2, shell in next dc, [ch 2, skip 5 dc, shell in next dc] 22 times, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc, turn—23 shells, 6 dc.
Row 19: [(Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in next dc] (counts as first shell), ch 2, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2] 23 times, [3 dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc] (counts as last shell), turn—25 shells.
Row 20: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1] 24 times, shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc, turn—25 shells, 30 dc.
Row 21: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 1, V-st in ch-2 space, ch 1, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, V-st in next dc, ch 1] 24 times, shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, V-st in ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 dc in last dc, turn—25 shells, 26 V-sts, 6 dc.
Row 22: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in next dc, 3 dc in V-st, [dc in each of next 6 dc, 3 dc in V-st] 25 times, 3 dc in next dc, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in last dc, turn—240 dc. Do not fasten off.
Row 23 (Wrong side): Ch 1, change to B, holding B in back of work, pull up a loop in 8th loop of mesh, work ruffle sc in first dc, [skip 1 dc, ruffle sc in next dc] across, ending with ruffle sc in last dc. Do not turn. Leaving a 4” (10 cm) end, fasten off—121 ruffle sc.
Row 24 (Wrong side): With wrong side facing, pick up A and slip st in first ruffle sc, (ch 4, 3 dc) in first ruffle sc, 2 dc in each of next 119 ruffle sc, 4 dc in last ruffle sc, turn—246 dc.
Row 25 (Right side): (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, skip 2 dc, ch 2, shell in next dc, [ch 2, skip 5 dc, shell in next dc] 40 times, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc, turn—41 shells, 6 dc.
Row 26: [(Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in next dc] (counts as first shell), ch 2, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2] 41 times, [3 dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in last dc] (counts as last shell), turn—43 shells.
Row 27: (Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2] 43 times, 3 dc in last dc, turn—43 shells, 6 dc.
Row 28: [(Ch 4, 2 dc) in first dc, ch 2, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in next dc] (counts as first shell), [shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2] 43 times, [3 dc in next dc, skip 1 dc, 3 dc in last dc] (counts as last shell), turn—45 shells.
Row 29: Ch 1, fasten off A, change to B, holding B in back of work, pull up a loop in 8th loop of mesh, ruffle sc in first dc, *ruffle sc in next dc, skip next dc, ruffle sc in ch-2 space, skip next dc; repeat from * across, ending with ruffle sc in last dc. Leaving a 4” (10 cm) end, fasten off.
EDGING
With right side facing, join A with slip st in end of last row, ch 1, work sc evenly across to center, sc in beginning ring, sc evenly across remaining row ends. Fasten off.
FINISHING
To finish the ends of B, fold mesh yarn over the sc edging and tack to WS with sewing needle and thread. Weave in all ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Black (9727) 3 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Picot shell = (3 dc. Ch 3. 1 sl st in 3rd ch from hook. 3 dc) in end of indicated row
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] wide x 54" [137 cm] long.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes
Wrap is worked in two halves, 
from center back to front edge. 
The first half is worked from 
center back to pointed front 
edge. The second half begins by 
working across the opposite side 
of the foundation ch of the first 
half, and is worked towards the 
other pointed front edge.
WRAP
First Half
Ch 84.
1st row: 1 dc in 5th ch from hook. 
Ch 3. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 
Ch 5. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next 
ch. *Ch 3. Skip next ch. Dc3tog. 
Ch 3. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 
Ch 5. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next 
ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Ch 3. 
Skip next ch. Dc2tog. PM in last 
ch to indicate where 2nd half of 
wrap will begin. Turn. 8 pat reps.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first 
dc2tog. Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 
5 dc in center ch of next ch‑5 sp. 
*Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next 
dc3tog. Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 
5 dc in center ch of next ch‑5 sp. 
Rep from * to last ch‑3 sp. Ch 5. 
Skip last ch‑3 sp. Skip next dc. 1 sc 
in top of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 6 (counts as tr, 
ch 2). 1 sc in first ch‑5 sp. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. Skip 
next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 5. 
Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
Ch 3. Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
Rep from * to last sc. Ch 2. 1 tr in 
last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc 
in first tr. Ch 5. Skip next 2 ch‑sps. 
1 sc in next dc3tog. *Ch 5. Skip 
next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in center ch of 
next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next 
ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next dc3tog. Rep 
from * to last 2 ch‑sps. Ch 5. Skip 
next ch sp. 3 dc in turning ch. 
Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. 1 dc 
in next dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in next 
ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 3. Skip next dc. 
Dc3tog. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 sc in 
next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next sc. 
1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. Rep from * 
to last 3 dc. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 
Dc2tog. Turn.
6th to 41st rows: Rep 2nd to 5th 
rows 9 times.
42nd and 43rd rows:  Rep 2nd 
and 3rd rows. PM in ch‑6 sp 
at beg of 43rd row to indicate 
where edging of straight side of 
shawl should begin.
Shape Point
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
2 dc in first tr. Ch 5. Skip next 
2 ch sps. 1 sc in next dc3tog. Ch 5. 
Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in center 
ch of next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 5. Skip 
next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next dc3tog. 
Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in 
center ch of next ch‑5 sp. Rep 
from * to last dc3tog. Ch 5. Skip 
next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in last dc3tog. 
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in first ch‑5 sp. 
*Ch 3. Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
Ch 5. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 
ch‑5 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 
Ch 3. Skip next dc. Dc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc2tog. 
Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in 
center ch of next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 5. 
Skip next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next 
dc3tog. Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 
5 dc in center ch of next ch‑5 sp. 
Rep from * to last dc3tog. Ch 5. Skip 
next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in last dc3tog. 
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in first ch‑5 sp. 
Ch 3. Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
*Ch 5. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 
ch‑5 sp. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 
Dc3tog. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 sc in 
next ch‑5 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 
Ch 2. 1 tr in last sc. Turn. 
5th to 24th rows:  Rep 1st to 4th 
rows 5 times.
25th row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
2 dc in first tr. Ch 5. Skip next 
2 ch sps, 1 sc in next dc3tog. Ch 5. 
Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in center 
ch of next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next 
ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in last dc3tog. Turn. 
Leave rem sts unworked.
26th row:  Ch 3. 1 sc in first 
ch‑5 sp. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 
Dc3tog. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 sc 
in next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next sc. 
1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. Ch 3. Skip 
next dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 
27th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc2tog. 
Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in 
center ch of next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip 
next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in last dc3tog. 
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
28th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in first ch‑5 sp. 
Ch 3. Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
Ch 2. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
Fasten off.
Second Half
With WS facing, working across 
opposite side of foundation ch, 
join yarn with sl st in marked ch.
1st row:  Ch 6. Skip next 
2 ch. 1 sc in next ch (at base of sc). 
Ch 3. Dc3tog over next 3 ch. Ch 3. 
1 sc in next ch. *Ch 5. Skip next 
5 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. Dc3tog. 
Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to 
last 3 ch. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 tr 
in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
2 dc in first tr. Ch 5. Skip next 
2 ch‑sps. 1 sc in next dc3tog. *Ch 5. 
Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in center 
ch of next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next 
ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next dc3tog. Rep 
from * to last 2 ch‑sps. Ch 5. Skip 
next ch‑sp. 3 dc in turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. 1 dc 
in next dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in next 
ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 3. Skip next dc. 
Dc3tog. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 sc in 
next ch‑5 sp. Ch 5. Skip next sc. 
1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. Rep from * 
to last 3 dc. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 
Dc2tog. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc2tog. 
Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 5 dc in 
center ch of next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 5. 
Skip next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next 
dc3tog. Ch 5. Skip next ch‑3 sp. 
5 dc in center ch of next ch‑5 sp. 
Rep from * to last ch‑3 sp. Ch 5. 
Skip last ch‑3 sp. Skip next dc. 1 sc 
in top of turning ch. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 6 (counts as tr, 
ch 2). 1 sc in first ch‑5 sp. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. Skip 
next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. *Ch 5. 
Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
Ch 3. Skip next dc. Dc3tog. Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 1 sc in next ch‑5 sp. 
Rep from * to last sc. Ch 2. 1 tr in 
last sc. Turn.
6th to 41st rows: Rep 2nd to 5th 
rows 9 times. 
PM in ch‑6 sp at beginning of 41st 
row to indicate where edging 
of straight side of shawl should 
begin.
Shape Point
Work same as shape point of first 
half. Do not  fasten off at end of 
last row.
Edging
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in first tr. Skip 
next dc3tog. Picot ‑shell in next 
ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next ch‑3 sp. Do not 
turn, working in the ch‑3 sps across 
diagonal edge of shawl, (picot‑shell 
in next ch‑3 sp. 1 sc in next ch‑3 sp)  
across diagonal edge. Working in 
ends of rows across long straight 
side of shawl and beginning in 
end of marked row,  (picot‑shell in 
end of next row. Skip next row. 
1 sc in end of next row. Skip next 
row) across straight side to point 
at other end of shawl. Rep from 
* once more to edge other point, 
diagonal edge, and long side of 
shawl. Join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Blossom Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Macaw (37006) 3 cakes
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 26" x 75" [66 x 190.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
SHAWL
Ch 96.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. *Ch 4. Skip next 4 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 94 sts (dc and ch).
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 4. Skip next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures approx 75" [190.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.
FLOWER  (make 64)
See diagram on page 2.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: (Ch 4. 3 tr. Ch 4. Sl st) 5 times in ring. Fasten off.
FRINGE
***1st row: (RS). *Ch 28. Join yarn with sl st to any ch-4 sp of Flower. Sl st in each of next 28 ch.** 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 14. Join with sl st to any ch-4 sp of Flower. Sl st in each of next 14 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 4. Join with sl st to any ch-4 sp of Flower. Sl st in each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc.
Rep from * to last dc. Rep from * to ** once. Fasten off.***
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first ch of foundation chain.
Work from *** to *** as given above.

materials: Caron® Cotton Angel Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc throughout.
• Ch 2 sps count as 2 sts throughout.
• When working Filet Chevron Pat, work sts into ch-2 sp not into chains.
Ch 78 (multiple of 18 ch + 6).
Foundation Row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 76 dc. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next d c) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 7 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 6 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts) 3 times. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 10 sts. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts) twice. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
7th row: As 3rd row.
8th row: As 2nd row.
9th row: As 1st row.
10th row: As 6th row.
11th row: As 5th row.
12th row: As 4th row.
These 12 rows form Filet Zigzag Pat. 
Cont in pat until Shawl measures approx 60" [152.5 cm], ending on a 6th row or 12th row of pat. 
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Do not turn. Do not fasten off. 
Edging: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. Work sc evenly around entire edge of Shawl, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® With Love™: 2 skeins in 1703 Candy Pink.
abbreviations: [] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Shawl is 19” x 51”.
gauge: In pattern, 2 pattern repeats & 12 rows = 5½”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 182 loosely.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, *ch 3, skip next 3 ch, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch, ch 3, skip next 3 ch ** sc in each of next 3 ch; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 2 ch; turn—18 ch-2 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, 5 dc in ch-2 space, ch 4, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across; turn—18 5-dc shells.
Row 3: Ch 7 (counts as tr, ch 3), skip next ch-4 space, *sc in each of next 5 dc**, ch 7, skip next 2 ch-4 spaces; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, ch 4, 1 tr in last sc; turn—17 ch-7 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first tr, *ch 3, skip next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, ch 3**, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-7 space; repeat from* across, ending last repeat at **, 2 dc in 4th ch of beginning ch-7; turn—17 ch-2 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 3, 2 dc in first dc, *ch 4, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 4, skip next ch-3 space**, 5 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 3 dc in top of beginning ch-3; turn—17 5-dc shells.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, *ch 7, skip next 2 ch-4 spaces**, sc in each of next 5 dc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 3 sts; turn—18 ch-7 spaces.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, *ch 3, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-7 space, ch 3, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 2 sc; turn—17 ch-2 spaces.
Rows 8-34: Repeat rows 2-7 (4 times), then repeat rows 2-4 (once).
Row 35: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, *ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 3**, 3 sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 2 sts.
Do not fasten off.
EDGING
Round 1: Working across short edge of shawl, ch 2 (counts as hdc), work 47 hdc evenly spaced across, work 3 hdc in corner st, working across bottom edge, *3 hdc in next 2 ch-3 spaces**, hdc in each of next 3 ch sts; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, work 3 hdc in corner st, work 48 hdc evenly spaced across short edge of shawl, work 3 hdc in corner st, ***3 hdc in next 2 ch-3 spaces**, hdc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from *** across, ending with 2 hdc in corner st; join with a slip st top of beginning ch-2—426 hdc.
Round 2: *Ch 3, picot, 3 dc in same st, skip next 2 hdc, sl st in next hdc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in base of first ch-3—142 picots. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block shawl.

materials: Red Heart® Croquette™ (1.6 oz/45 g; 239 yds/219 m) Tidepool (9869) 2 balls
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop) 7 times in indicated stitch, pulling long loops. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Sl st in same indicated stitch, pushing Bobble to RS of work.
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
Triple tr3tog = [(Yoh) 4 times. Draw up a loop in next dc. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch.
measurements: Approx 34" [86.5 cm] long from V-point
gauge: 26 dc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Center Motif (worked in rows).
Ch 54 (multiple of 3 ch + 9). See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 9th ch from hook (counts as dc, ch 2, dc). *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last dc and turning ch-8. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sl st in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc and turning ch-5. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 5. Skip next ch-3 sp, sl st, ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc and turning ch-5. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
5th row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sl st in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc and turning ch-5. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
6th to 13th rows: As 4th and 5th rows 4 times more.
14th row: As 4th row.
15th row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *5 dc in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
16th row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. *1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc and turning ch-5. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn. Do not fasten off . PM on 3rd ch of turning ch of last row.
Right Extension: Cont working along top of Center Motif as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. *1 dc in next dc. Picot. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc and turning ch-5. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
**2nd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip next ch-2 sp. *1 dc in next dc. Picot. Ch 1. Skip next ch 1 and picot. Rep from * to last dc and turning ch-5. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 32" [81 cm], ending on a WS row.
Cluster row: (RS). *Ch 7. Triple tr3tog over next 3 dc. Bobble in top of Triple tr3tog (last ch). Ch 7. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * to end of row.
Fasten off .**
Left extension: With RS facing join yarn with sl st to right corner of Center Motif at marked ch. Working across side of Center Motif, proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). Skip post of dc. *1 dc in top of next dc. Ch 2. Skip post of the same dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip post of the same dc. 1 dc in corner. Turn.
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Extension.
Outer edging: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to 3rd ch of turning ch-5 before Cluster row on Left extension. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc around post of next dc. *Picot. 3 sc around post of next dc.* Rep from * to * to Center Motif. **Picot. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from ** to ch-5 of V-point. (Picot. 3 sc) twice in ch-5 of V-point. Rep from * to * across side of Right Extension before Cluster row. Fasten off .

materials: Caron® Cotton Funnel Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 425 yds/389 m) Calm Skies (43027) 4 cakes
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times - 1 trfp made.
measurements: Approx 23" x 76" [58.5 x 193 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Shawl is worked in 3 Strips, then seamed together
• Each Strip is worked from the center out
• Ch-3 at beg of rows counts as dc

Center Strip (make 1)
See diagram on page 3.
**Ch 265 (multiple of 8 ch +1).
1st rnd: 9 dc in 5th ch from hook. Skip next 3 ch. *Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. Sl st in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, skip first 4 ch. 9 dc in next ch (this completes 1 Circle). Skip next 3 ch. *Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. Sl st in last ch. 33 Circles.

2nd rnd: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch-3). Skip first 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. *Ch 3. Skip next 4 dc. *1 dc in ch between 2 Circles. Ch 3. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 4 dc. Rep from * to last Circle. Ch 6. Sl st in first ch of foundation chain. Working across opposite side of Circles, ch 6. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. *1 dc in ch between 2 Circles. Ch 3. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last Circle. 1 dc in last ch of foundation chain. Turn.

Beg working in rows:
3rd row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next dc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last ch-6. 3 sc in ch-6 sp. 1 sc in 3rd ch of ch-6. 265 sts. Turn.
4th row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 trfp around each dc to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). Skip next 2 sts. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next st. Skip next 2 sts. Rep from * last st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). Skip first ch-1 sp. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Skip last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Fasten off.
Rotate work 180 degrees to beg working across opposite side of 2nd rnd. With WS facing, join yarn with sl st to 3rd ch of first ch-6.**
Rep 3rd to 9th rows. Fasten off.

Side Strips (make 2)
Work from ** to ** as given for Center Strip, then proceed as follows:
Rep 3rd and 4th rows. Fasten off.

FINISHING
With WS facing each other, align 9th row of first Side Strip with 9th row of Center Strip. Join yarn with sl st to first st through both thicknesses. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st across working through both loops of each st to create a ridged seam. Fasten off. Rep to join second Side Strip. 

Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 24" [61 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe at short edges of Shawl. Trim fringe evenly.

pattern_name: Dotted Daze Mosaic Crochet Blanket Wrap
materials: Caron® Colorama Haze™ (8 oz/227 g; 649 yds/593 m)
Contrast A Daydream (92001) 2 balls or 1220 yds/1115.5 m
Contrast B Blue Moon (92012) 2 balls or 755 yds/690.5 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 27¼" [69 cm] x 75" [190.5 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Wrap is worked lengthwise.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
WRAP  ( See diagram on page 3).
With A, ch 245. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 244 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 17 sc. *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 16 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sl st in back loop only of next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in front loops only each of next 17 sl sts. *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 16 sl sts. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sl st in front loop only of next sl st. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 17 sc 3 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 16 sc 3 rows below. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in front loop only of next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Join B. Turn.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * to last 19 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * ending with: Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
9th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * ending with 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
10th row: As 6th row.
11th row:  With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 4 sc. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 4 sl sts. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 4 sl sts. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
13th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 4 sc 3 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 4 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
14th row:  As 6th row.
15th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 6 sc. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 2 sl sts. *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 6 sl sts. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 2 sl sts. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
17th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 2 sc 3 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 6 sc 3 rows below. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 2 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
18th row: As 6th row.
19th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in back loop only of next sc. *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sl st in back loops only of each of next 16 sc. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sl st in back loop only of next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sl st in front loop only of next sl st. *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sl st in front loops only of each of next 16 sl sts. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sl st in front loop only of next sl st. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
21st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 dc in front loop only of next skipped sc 3 rows below. *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 1 dc in front loops only of each of next skipped 16 sc 3 rows below. Rep from * ending with: 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 1 dc in front loop only of next skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
22nd row: As 6th row.
23rd to 26th rows: As 15th to 18th rows.
27th to 30th rows: As 11th to 14th rows.
31st to 34th rows: As 7th to 10th rows.
35th to 98th rows: Rep 3rd to 34th rows twice more.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Big Donut™ O’Go™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 502 yds/459 m) Blue Moon (29005)
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Split ring or locking stitch markers.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
PM = Place marker on last stitch or in center of chain space worked
measurements: Approx 80” [203 cm] wide x 40” [101.5 cm] deep after blocking.
gauge: 11 dc and 6 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Work through each skein in the existing order, or create your own custom color play
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Separate colors by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A to E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A to E.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Ch 4 at beg of row counts as dc and ch-1.
• Ch 5 at beg of row counts as dc and ch-2.
• Ch 6 at beg of row counts as dc and ch-3.
Section One (see Chart I on page 6)
1st row: (WS). With A, ch 4. 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. PM. 3 hdc in last ch. Turn. 7 hdc.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 3(2 dc. PM. 1 dc) in marked st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 3 dc in last st. Turn. 13 dc.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 dc in first st. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. PM. 2 dc) in marked st. [Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next st] twice. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 10 dc.
4th row: Ch 1. 3 sc in first st. (1 sc in next ch sp. 1 sc in next st) 4 times. (1 sc. Ch 2. PM. 1sc) in marked ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next st. (1 sc in next ch sp. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in next ch sp. 3 sc in last st. Turn. 24 sc.
5th row: Ch 4. [(1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next st. Skip next 3 sts] twice. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next st. Skip next 2 sts. (1 dc. Ch 3. PM. 1 dc) in marked ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 sts. [(1 dc. materials: Caron® Simply Me™ (7 oz/200 g; 246 yds/225 m) Malachite (08001) or Midnight Blue (08009) 2 balls or 490 yds/445 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard for 3 tassels
abbreviations: Cluster = (Tr2tog. Ch 2. Tr2tog) in indicated space
Dtr = (Double treble crochet). (Yoh) 3 times. Insert hook in next stitch and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
Tr2tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 30" [76 cm] deep x 61" [155 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 11 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 10 at beg of rows counts as dtr and ch 4. 
• Move marker to new center ch-sp as you work each row. 
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
See diagram on page 3. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 10 (counts as dtr and ch 4). (Cluster. Ch 7. PM on ch-7 sp just made for center of Shawl. Cluster. Ch 4. 1 dtr) all in ring. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 10. Tr2tog in 2nd ch of next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Cluster in next cluster. Ch 4. Cluster in 4th ch of center ch-7 sp. Move marker to ch sp in cluster just made for center of Shawl. Ch 4. Cluster in next cluster. Ch 4. Tr2tog in 2nd ch of turning ch-10 sp. Ch 4. 1 dtr in 4th ch of same ch-10. Turn. 

3rd row: Ch 10. Cluster in top of next tr2tog. Ch 4. Cluster in next cluster. Ch 4. Cluster in top of first tr2tog of center cluster. Ch 7 for center. Cluster in top of second tr2tog of center cluster. Ch 4. Cluster in next cluster. Ch 4. Cluster in top of next tr2tog. Ch 4. 1 dtr in 4th ch of turning ch-10. Turn.

4th row: Ch 10. Tr2tog in 2nd ch of next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. *Cluster in next cluster. Ch 4.* Rep from * to * to center ch-7 sp. Cluster (center cluster) in 4th ch of center ch-7 sp. Ch 4. Rep from * to * to turning ch-10 sp. Tr2tog in 2nd ch of turning ch-10 sp. Ch 4. 1 dtr in 4th ch of same ch-10. Turn. 

5th row: Ch 10. Cluster in top of next Tr2tog. Ch 4. *Cluster in next cluster. Ch 4.* Rep from * to * to center cluster. Cluster in top of first tr2tog of center cluster. Ch 7. Cluster in top of second tr2tog of center cluster. Ch 4. Rep from * to * to last tr2tog. Cluster in top of next Tr2tog. Ch 4. 1 dtr in 4th ch of turning ch-10. Turn.

Rep 4th and 5th rows until Shawl along center line measures approx 30" [76 cm], ending on 4th row. 

EDGING
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first st. Skip next ch-sp. Sl st in top of next tr2tog. *Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Skip next ch-sp. Sl st in top of next tr2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.

Tassels: (make 3). Wrap yarn around 7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard 30 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end. Fasten securely. Attach Tassels at each point of Shawl.

materials: Red Heart® With Love™: 2 skeins 1814 True Blue.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Wrap measures 26” wide x 50” long.
gauge: two 7-dc shell groups and one ch-5 space = 5”; 8 rows = 5” in shell pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WRAP
First Section
Ch 84.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * ch 5, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to last 2 ch; ch 2, skip next ch, dc in last ch; turn.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first st, skip ch-2 space, * 7 dc in next ch-5 space, sc in next ch-5 space **, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * to last sc, end at **; ch 2, tr in last sc; turn – 7 shells across.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, * [ch 5, skip next 2 dc, sc in next d] twice **, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * to last sc, end at **; ch 2, tr in last sc; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 for shell pattern 19 more times, then repeat Row 2 once more. Fasten off.
Note: Additional pattern Rows 2 and 3 can be added here for longer length.
Second Section
With right side facing, beginning foundation at top, join yarn in first st; working into the ch-3 spaces across the edge, work Row 2 across. Complete same as for First Section. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Side Edging
With right side facing, join yarn in first st at long edge; ch 1, sc in same st, * ch 3, sc in next space working over the bars of the tr; repeat from * across, working last sc in last st – 40 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Rows of shells and pretty open stitches are combined for an all-season wrap to wear with everything from jeans to the prettiest party dress. Best of all, since you are crocheting with medium weight yarn it won’t take long until you can wear it.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 235 yds/215 m)
Contrast A & B Royal Blue/Soft Pink (40017) 3 O’Gos
Contrast C & D Strawberry/Soft Blue (40026) 3 O’Gos
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
measurements: Approx 58" [147.5 cm] wide x 33" [84 cm] deep.
gauge: 17 sts and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] in sc-ch 1 pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C and D). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C and D.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Move marker on center ch-2 sp as work progresses.

Beg at center back of Shawl, with D, ch 2. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sts (sc and ch).
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. With A, ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. PM on last ch-2 sp for center of Shawl. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sc at each side of center ch-2.
4th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* Rep from * to * to center ch-2 sp. (1 sc. With D, ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* Rep from * to * to center ch-2 sp. (1 sc. With A, ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. Break D.
Proceed as follows:
**1st to 3rd rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* Rep from * to * to center ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. (Break A. Join B) at end of last row.
4th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* Rep from * to * to 10 sc before center ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. With A, (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 1. (1 sc. With C, ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* Rep from * to * to center ch-2 sp. (1 sc. With A, ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 9 times. With B, ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th to 15th rows: As 4th and 5th rows 5 times more.

Rep 1st to 15th rows, substituting D for B and C.
Rep 1st to 15th rows, substituting B for C and C for B.
Rep 1st to 15th rows, substituting D for B and C.
Rep 1st to 15th rows once more.
**
Rep from ** to ** until Shawl measures approx 35" [88.5 cm] deep, ending with 3 rows of A.
Next row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Picot. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Picot. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* Rep from * to * to center ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Picot. Ch 2. 1 sc. Picot) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Picot. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® It's A Wrap™: 1 ball 9274 Romance
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 14½ x 65" (37 x 164 cm) including edging.
gauge: 5 repeats = 4½" (11.5 cm) in Body pattern after light blocking. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Beginning Edging
Ch 98.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end, turn – 97 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), dc in first sc, ch 2, skip 3 sc, dc in next sc, * ch 2, skip 3 sc, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc, ch 2, skip 3 sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * to last 4 sc, ch 2, skip 3 sc, 2 dc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), dc in first dc, ch 2, skip next dc, dc5tog over next 5 sts including ch sts, * ch 2, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 2, skip next dc, dc5tog over next 5 sts including ch sts, ch 2; repeat from * to last 2 sts, skip next dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * ch 5, sc in next ch space; repeat from * to end, ch 5, sc in last dc.
Fasten off.
Body
Turn piece upside down and hold with right side facing.
Join new yarn with slip st in top right corner, being ready to work across unused loops of foundation ch.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, ch 3, skip 4 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next st, * ch 3, skip 5 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next st; repeat from * to last 6 sts, ch 3, skip 4 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) twice in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last ch-3 space, ch 3, skip last ch-3 space, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and 3 ch), skip first ch-3 space, * [sc in next ch-3 sp, ch 3] twice, skip next ch-3 space, repeat from * to last sc, dc in last sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) twice in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to end, ch 3, sc in 3rd of beginning ch-6 of previous row, turn.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 only until piece measures 63½" (161 cm), ending after a Row 3.
Ending Edging
Next row (transition to edging, wrong side): Ch 1, 2 sc in first dc, 3 sc in each ch-3 space to end, 2 sc in 3rd of beginning ch-6 of previous row, turn – 97 sc.
Work Rows 2-4 of Beginning Edging.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends.
Lightly block to measurements.

materials: Caron® Colorama Bamboo™ (8 oz/227 g; 396 yds/363 m) Rainfall (82016) 5 balls or 1750 yds/1590 m
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4½" [11.5 cm] wide piece of cardboard for tassels.
measurements: Approx 28" x 70" [71 x 178 cm], excluding tassels.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Keep loops on RS of work.
Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 86 (multiple of 7 ch + 2).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. *Ch 10. Sl st into top of last dc made – loop made. 1 dc in each of next 7 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 84 dc and 11 loops.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 84 sc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc. *Ch 10. Sl st into top of last dc made – loop made. 1 dc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 84 dc and 11 loops.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 70" [178 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Chain loops: Beg at bottom right column of ch-10 loops, pick up loop from second row of loops. Pull through loop directly below it. Cont in this manner, pulling each loop through loop from previous row, as shown in picture. Last loop of each column will be left loose. Rep for each column.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 dc. *1 sc in next dc and through loop behind. 1 sc in next dc and through same loop previously worked. 1 sc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Loopy Tassels (make 22): Wind yarn around a piece of cardboard 4½" [11.5 cm] wide 30 times. Tie through loops securely at 1 end. Wrap yarn 3 times around Tassel 1" [2.5 cm] down from tied end. Fasten securely. Do not cut loops at bottom of tassel. Sew 1 Tassel along top and top and bottom of each loop column.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m) Azure (10523) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2(3-4-7)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch or space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 (3-4-7) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] wide x 68" [172.5 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes
• Wrap is worked horizontally (widthwise).
• Foundation ch is based on multiple of 12 ch + 3. 
• To adjust finished length of Wrap increase or decrease foundation ch with multiples of 12 ch (approx 2" [5 cm]).
Ch 159 loosely.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row:  (RS). Dc3tog over 4th ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. Ch 1. (1 tr in next ch. Ch 1) twice. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next ch. (Ch 1. 1 tr in next ch) twice. Ch 1. *Dc7tog over next 7 ch. Ch 1. (1 tr in next ch. Ch 1) twice. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next ch. (Ch 1. 1 tr in next ch) twice. Ch 1. Rep from * to last 4 ch. Dc4tog over last 4 ch. Turn. 13 pat repeats.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next tr. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. 1 dc in next tr. *Dc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps (skipping dc7tog in between). (1 dc in next tr. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. 1 dc in next tr. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Dc2tog over last ch-1 sp and last dc3tog. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 3. Skip first dc2tog. Dc3tog over next 3 dc. Ch 1. (1 tr in next dc. Ch 1) twice. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next dc. (Ch 1. 1 tr in next dc) twice. Ch 1. *Dc7tog over next 7 dc. Ch 1. (1 tr in next dc. Ch 1) twice. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next dc. (Ch 1. 1 tr in next dc) twice. Ch 1. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Dc4tog over last 4 dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 24" [61 cm]. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 14" [35 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly across sides (short ends) of Wrap. To make knotted fringe: Divide each fringe in half and tie strands into overhand knot to adjoining fringe approx 1" [2.5 cm] from edge of Wrap. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 5 balls 9803 Borealis
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 18” [45.5cm] wide x 52” [132cm] long
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Row 1 (Right Side): Work 155 Fsc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *ch 7, skip next 4 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 6 sts, ch 7, skip next 4 sc, sc next 2 sc – 22 Arches.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *7 sc in next ch-7 space, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last ch-7 space, 7 sc in last ch-7 space, sc in next 2 sc.
Row 4: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3), skip next 4 sc, sc in next 3 sc, *ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 4 sc, ch 3, skip next 3 sc, tr in last sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in tr, 3 sc in ch-3 space, sc in next 3 sc, *7 sc in ch-7 space, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last ch-3 space, 3 sc in ch-3 space, sc in 4th ch of ch-7.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sc, *ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 9 sc, ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in last 2 sc.
Repeat Rows 3-6 for 8 times, then Rows 3-5 once.
Edging Row 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *ch 4, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 3 sc sts; repeat from * across to last 9 sc, ch 4, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 2 sc.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Heart & Sole®: 7 balls 3900 Fuchsia
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 23” [58.5 cm] wide and 66” [167.5 cm] long.
gauge: 3 Croc-sts = 4” [10 cm]; 18 rows = 4¼” [11 cm] in Crocodile Stitch pattern.
instructions:
Crocodile Stitch Panels (make 2)
Notes: 
1. Wrong side rows are V-st rows and right side rows are Croc-st rows. 
2. The right side of the fabric (the side with the crocodile scales) shows the wrong side of the double crochet (dc) stitches that form the scales.
Ch 111.
Row 1 (wrong side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as dc, ch 1 – first V-st made), *ch 2, skip next 2 ch, V-st in next ch; repeat from * across—37 V-sts.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, turn, Croc-st over first V-st, *skip next V-st, Croc-st over next V-st; repeat from * across—19 Croc-sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, working into the previous V-st row, V-st in V-st at center of first Croc-st, *ch 2, V-st in next V-st, ch 2, V-st in V-st at center of next Croc-st; repeat from * across—37 V-sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, slip st in first V-st, Croc-st over next V-st, *skip next V-st, Croc-st over next V-st; repeat from * to last V-st, slip st in last V-st—18 Croc-sts.
Row 5: Ch 2 (counts as dc), turn, working into the previous V-st row, dc in same V-st as last slip st of previous row (first V-st made), *ch 2, V-st in V-st at center of next Croc-st, ch 2, V-st in next V-st; repeat from * across—37 V-sts.
Rows 6–29: Repeat Rows 2–5 six times.
Note: You should have 14 Croc-st rows. To check, count the Croc-st rows diagonally across the panel.
Fasten off first panel and set aside. Do not fasten off second panel.
Climbing Vine Lace Panel
Row 1 (Set-Up Row – right side): Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), turn, Cl in first V-st, dc in next V-st, ch 2, sc in next V-st, *ch 2, (dc, ch 3, Cl) in next V-st, dc in next V-st, ch 2, sc in next V-st; repeat from * to last V-st ch 2, dc in last V-st.
Row 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), turn, Cl in first dc, skip next sc, dc in next dc, *ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, Cl) in next dc, skip next sc, dc in next dc; repeat from * to turning ch-space, ch 2, sc in turning ch-space, ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch.
Repeat Row 2 until Climbing Vine Lace panel measures about 50” [127 cm], unstretched.
FINISHING
Wash and block long piece to measure about 23 x 59” [58.5 x 150 cm]. Wash and block separate Crocodile Stitch panel to about 23 x 7” [58.5 x 18 cm]. When pieces are dry, slip st separate Crocodile Stitch panel to short ending edge of Climbing Vine Lace pane.
Weave in ends and wet block to finished measurements.

Special Stitches
Note: Insert hook in front loop only of sc.
sc3togC1 (single crochet corner decrease 1) 
= Insert hook in next st, pull up a loop, skip 
next st, insert hook in next st, pull up a loop (3 
loops on hook), yo and pull through all 3 loops. 
Note “Next st” may be sc or ch.
sc3togC2 (single crochet corner decrease 2) 
= Insert hook in next sc, pull up a loop, insert 
hook from front to back and to front again 
around st 1 row below next st, pull up a long 
loop, skip the st in the current row behind 
the loop just made, insert hook in next sc of 
current row, pull up a loop (4 loops on hook), 
yo and pull through all 4 loops.
Notes
1. L-shaped shawl is made from 51 square
motifs worked in 10 joined sections.
2. Each square is worked off the preceding
square beginning with a foundation row.
Refer to diagram for placement.
3. Single crochet is worked in front loops only,
except where instructed otherwise.
4. Mitered corners are worked over 3 stitches
at center of each row.
5. Vary the color patterns by starting some
balls from the inside tail and some from the
outside.

Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 1 sc, sc3togC2, sc in

pattern_name: Wrapped in Waves Crochet Blanket Shawl
materials: Patons® Kroy Socks FX (1.75 oz/50 g; 166 yds/152 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = [Yoh twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times in indicated st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Cluster = *Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.* Skip next st. Rep from * to *.
Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through rem loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 55" [134.5 cm] square.
gauge: 22 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
Ch 291. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 3 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. *Cluster over next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 3 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Dc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first sc (half bobble made). Ch 2. Bobble into same sc as half bobble. Ch 4. Skip next 7 sc. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 4. Skip next 7 sc. (Bobble. Ch 2. Bobble. Ch 2. Bobble) all in next sc. Ch 4. Skip next 7 sc.1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 8 sc. Ch 4. (Bobble. Ch 2. [Yoh twice and draw up a loop in st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops twice.] 2 times. Yoh and draw through rem loops on hook. (half bobble made) all in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in top of first half bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in top of next Bobble. 3 dc in next ch-4 sp. Cluster over ch-4 sp, sc, ch-4 sp. 3 dc in ch-4 sp. *1 dc in top of next Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in top of next Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in top of next Bobble. 3 dc in next ch-4 sp. Cluster over ch-4 sp, sc, ch-4 sp. 3 dc in ch-4 sp. Rep from * to last Bobble. 1 dc in top of last Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 2 dc in top of Half Bobble. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 4. Skip next 7 sc. (Bobble. Ch 2. Bobble. Ch 2. Bobble) all in next sc. Ch 4. Skip next 7 sc.1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. 4 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 dc into top of next Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in top of next Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in top of next Bobble. *3 dc in next ch-4 sp. Cluster over ch-4 sp, sc, ch-4 sp. 3 dc in ch-4 sp. 1 dc in top of next Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in top of next Bobble. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in top of next Bobble. Rep from * to last ch-4 sp. 3 dc in next ch-4 sp. Dc2tog over ch-4 sp and last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 55" [139.5 cm], ending on a 5th row.
Fasten off.
Side edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly up side of Shawl. Fasten off. Rep for other side.
Tassels (make 4) Cut a piece of cardboard 3½" [9 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 50 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew 1 Tassel to each corner of Shawl.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 6 balls 9440 Light Grey Heather
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 76½" wide x 37½" long (194.5 x 95.5 cm)
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
Ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first sc and ch-1 space here and throughout), (sc, ch 1, sc, ch 2, sc, ch 1, 2 sc) in ring, turn—6 sc, 3 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 2: Ch 2, sc in first sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in last sc, sc in beginning ch-2 space, turn—8 sc, 5 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 3: Ch 2, sc in first sc, [ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space] 2 times, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, [ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space] 2 times, ch 1, sc in last sc, sc in beginning ch-2 space, turn—10 sc, 7 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 4: Ch 2, sc in first sc, [ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, [ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1, sc in last sc, sc in beginning ch-2 space, turn—12 sc, 9 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 5: Ch 3 (counts as first dc and ch-1 space here and throughout), dc in first sc, (ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space across to next ch-2 space, ch 1, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, (ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space across to last sc, ch 1, dc in last sc, dc in beginning ch-2, turn—14 dc, 11 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 6: Ch 2, sc in first dc, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space across to next ch-2 space, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space across to last dc, ch 1, sc in last dc, sc in beginning ch-3 space, turn—16 sc, 13 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 7: Ch 2, sc in first sc, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space across to next ch-2 space, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space across to last sc, ch 1, sc in last sc, sc in beginning ch-2 space, turn—18 sc, 15 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 8 and 9: Repeat Rows 5 and 6—22 sc, 19 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 10–12: Repeat Row 7—28 sc, 25 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 13–18: Repeat Rows 5–7 twice—40 sc, 37 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 19–23: Repeat Rows 8–12 once—50 sc, 47 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 24–78: Repeat Rows 13–23 five times—160 sc, 157 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 79–84: Repeat Rows 5–7 twice—172 sc, 169 ch-1 spaces, and 1 ch-2 space.
Row 85: Working in ends of rows, ch 1 (corner made), work 216 sc evenly spaced across top edge to beginning ch-2 space of last row, ch 1 (corner made), slip st in beginning ch-2. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends and block to finished measurements.
Fringe
For each fringe, cut 3 strands, each 10" (25.5 cm) long. Fold strands in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from right side through either corner. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in other corner and in every other ch-1 space across the long side edges of the shawl. Trim ends evenly.
