tr, [ch 1, dc in next st] 6 times, ch 3, skip next 
ch-3 space, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 
skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 3 
ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc 
in next tr, [ch 1, dc in next st] 6 times, ch 3, 
skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 3 ch-2 
spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in 
next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in 
next tr, [ch 1, dc in next st] 6 times, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 2 
ch-2 spaces, (Cl-V, ch 2, tr) in last ch-2 space, 
turn—32 clusters.
Row 35: Ch 5, Cl in first ch-2 space, Cl-V in 
each of next 3 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next 
ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-1 space, ch 3] 6 
times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in next ch-2 
space, ch 2, work pineapple-top, ch 2, Cl-V 
in same ch-2 space as last st of pineapple-
top, Cl-V in each of next 2 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, 
skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-1 space, 
ch 3] 6 times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in 
each of next 3 ch-2 spaces, ch 2, work pineapple-top, 
ch 2, Cl-V in same ch-2 space as last st of 
pineapple-top, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, 
[sc in next ch-1 spaced, ch 3] 6 times, skip 
next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 3 ch-2 
spaces, (Cl, ch 2, tr) in last ch-2 space, turn—34 clusters.
Row 36: Ch 5, Cl-V in each of first 3 ch-2 
spaces, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 5 
times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-inc in next 
ch-2 space, skip next ch-2 space, Cl-V in next 
ch-4 space, skip next ch-2 space, Cl-V in each of 
next 2 ch-2 spaces, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, 
ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 
space, ch 3] 5 times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-
inc in next ch-2 space, skip next ch-2 space, 
Cl-V in next ch-4 space, skip next ch-2 space, 
Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 
space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 5 times, 
skip next ch-3 space, Cl-inc in next ch-2 
space, Cl-V in each of next 2 ch-2 spaces, skip 
next ch-2 space, Cl-V in next ch-4 space, skip 
next ch-2 space, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, ch 
3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, 
ch 3] 5 times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-inc in 
next ch-2 space, Cl-V in each of next 2 ch-2 spaces, (Cl-V, ch 2, tr) in last ch-2 space, 
turn—50 clusters.
Row 37: Ch 5, Cl in first ch-2 space, Cl-V in 
each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next 
ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 4 
times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each 
of next 7 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 
space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 4 times, 
skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 5 
ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in 
next ch-3 space, ch 3] 4 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in each of next 7 ch-2 spaces, 
ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 
space, ch 3] 4 times, skip next ch-3 space, 
Cl-V in each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, (Cl, ch 2, 
tr) in last ch-2 space, turn—60 clusters.
Row 38: Ch 5, Cl-V in each of first 5 ch-2 
spaces, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 
3 times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-inc in next 
ch-2 space, Cl-V in each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, 
Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 
space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 3 times, 
skip next ch-3 space, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, 
Cl-V in each of next 3 ch-2 spaces, Cl-inc in 
next ch-2 space,  ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, 
[sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 3 times, skip next 
ch-3 space, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, Cl-V 
in each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, Cl-inc in next 
ch-2 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in 
next ch-3 space, ch 3] 3 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, Cl-V in each 
of next 4 ch-2 spaces, (Cl-V, ch 2, tr) in last 
ch-2 space, turn—70 clusters.
Row 39: Ch 5, Cl in first ch-2 space, Cl-V in 
each of next 7 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next 
ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 
twice, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each 
of next 9 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 
space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] twice, 
skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 7 
ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc 
in next ch-3 space, ch 3] twice, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in each of next 9 ch-2 spaces, 
ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 
space, ch 3] twice, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V 
in each of next 7 ch-2 spaces, (Cl, ch 2, tr) in 
last ch-2 space, turn—80 clusters.
Row 40: Ch 5, Cl-V in each of first 8 ch-2 
spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V 
in each of next 9 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next 
ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, Cl-V in each of next 7 ch-2 
spaces, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V 
in each of next 9 ch-2 spaces, ch 3, skip next 
ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space,  Cl-V in each of next 7 ch-2 
spaces, (Cl-V, ch 2, tr) in last ch-2 space, 
turn—82 clusters.
Row 41: Ch 5, Cl in first ch-2 space, Cl-V 
in each of next 8 ch-2 spaces, *ch 2, work 
pineapple-top, ch 2, Cl-V in same ch-2 space 
as last st of pineapple-top, Cl-V in each of next 
8 ch-2 spaces, ch 2, work pineapple-top, ch 2, 
Cl-V in same ch-2 space as last st of pineapple 
top, Cl-V in each of next 6 ch-2 spaces; repeat 
from * once more, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, (Cl, 
ch 2. tr) in last ch-2 space, turn—84 clusters.
Row 42: Ch 5, Cl-V in each of first 9 ch-2 
spaces, skip next ch-2 space, Cl-V in next 
ch-4 space, skip next ch-2 space, Cl-V in each 
of next 9 ch-2 spaces, skip next ch-2 space, 
Cl-V in next ch-4 space, skip next ch-2 space, 
Cl-V in each of next 7 ch-2 spaces, skip next 
ch-2 space, Cl-V in next ch-4 space, skip 
next ch-2 space, Cl-V  in each of next 9 ch-2 
spaces, skip next ch-2 space, Cl-V in next 
ch-4 space, skip next ch-2 space, Cl-V in each 
of next 8 ch-2 spaces,(Cl-V, ch 2, tr) in last 
ch-2 space, turn—94 clusters.
Row 43: Ch 5, turn, Cl in first ch-2 space, Cl-V 
in next 47 ch-2 spaces, (Cl, ch 2, tr) in last 
ch-2 space, do not turn—96 clusters.
Do not fasten off.
BORDER
Note: Border is worked in pineapple stitch 
pattern similar to pattern in body of shawl. 
The first 6 rows are worked all the way across 
the lower diagonal edges of the shawl. Then 
the individual pineapple points are completed 
separately, one at a time.
Row 1: Working down diagonal edge of shawl, 
work (slip st, beg-Cl, [ch 1, Cl] 3 times) around 
post of tr at end of row just completed, [(Cl, 
ch 1, Cl) in ch-space at end of next row, (Cl, 
ch 1, Cl) around post of tr at end of next row] 
20 times, (Cl, ch 1, Cl) in ch-space at end of 
next row, (Cl, [ch 1, Cl] 5 times) in ch-space 
at lower point of shawl; working up other 
diagonal edge of shawl, [(Cl, ch 1, Cl)  around 
post of tr at end of next row, (Cl, ch 1, Cl) in 
ch-space at end of next row] 20 times, (Cl, ch 
1, Cl) around post of tr at end of next row, (Cl, 
[ch 1, Cl] 3 times) in ch-space at end of last 
row, turn—93 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-1 
space (first Cl-V made), [ch 3, sc in next ch-1 
space, ch 3, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 3, sc 
in next ch-1 space, ch 3, Cl-V in next ch-1 
space] 23 times, turn—24 Cl-V.
Row 3: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, [ch 4, 3 dc in next dc, ch 4, Cl-V in 
next ch-2 space] 11 times, ch 4, 5 dc in next 
dc, [ch 4, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, ch 4, 3 dc 
in next dc] 11 times, ch 4, Cl-V in last ch-2 
space, turn—Twenty-two 3-dc groups and 
one 5-dc group. Note: The 5-dc groups and 
each 3-dc group serve as the beginning of a 
pineapple stitch pattern.
Row 4: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, [ch 3, (tr, edc) in next dc, 3 dc in next 
dc, (edc, tr) in next dc, ch 3, Cl-V in next ch-2 
space] 11 times, ch 3, (tr, edc) in next dc, dc in 
next dc, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, (edc, tr) in 
next dc, [ch 3, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, ch 3, (tr, 
edc) in next dc, 3 dc in next dc, (edc, tr) in next 
dc] 11 times, ch 3, Cl-V in last ch-2 space, turn.
Row 5: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, *ch 3, dc in next tr, [ch 1, dc in next st] 
6 times, ch 3, Cl-V in next ch-2 space; repeat 
from * 10 more times, ch 3, dc in next tr, [ch 1, 
dc in next st] 8 times, **ch 3, Cl-V in next ch-2 
space, ch 3, dc in next tr, [ch 1, dc in next st] 
6 times; repeat from ** 10 more times, ch 3, 
Cl-V in last ch-2 space, turn.
Row 6: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, *ch 3, [sc in next ch-1 space, ch 3] 6 
times, Cl-inc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 
10 more times, ch 3, [sc in next ch-1 space, ch 
3] 8 times, **Cl-inc in next ch-2 space, ch 3, [sc
in next ch-1 space, ch 3] 6 times; repeat from
** 10 more times, Cl-V in last ch-2 space, turn.
Pineapple Points
Point 1
Row 7: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3] 5 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, turn; leave 
remaining sts unworked.
Row 8: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3] 4 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, turn.
Row 9: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3] 3 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, turn.
Row 10: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3] twice, skip next ch-3 space, 
Cl-V in next ch-2 space, turn.
Row 11: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in 
next ch-2 space, turn.
Row 12: (Slip st, beg-Cl) in first ch-2 space, 
ch 2, work pineapple-top (omitting the ch-4 
and slip st), ch 2, Cl in same ch-2 space as 
last st of pineapple-top, turn.
Row 13: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 2; yarn 
over, insert hook in same (first) ch-2 space 
and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 
2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook), 
[yarn over, insert hook in last ch-2 space and 
pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 
2 loops on hook] twice, yarn over and draw 
through all 4 loops on hook. Fasten off.
Points 2–11 
Row 7: Join yarn with slip st in first unworked 
ch-2 space of Row 6 following previous point, 
(beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in same ch-2 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 
5 times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in next ch-2 
space, turn; leave remaining sts unworked.
Rows 8–13: Work same as Rows 8–13 of 
Point 1.Fasten off.
Point 12 (at lower point of shawl) 
Row 7: Join yarn with slip st in first unworked 
ch-2 space of Row 6 following previous point, 
(beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in same ch-2 space, ch 3, skip 
next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 
7 times, skip next ch-3 space, Cl-V in next ch-2 
space, turn; leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 8: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3] 6 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, turn.
Row 9: (Slip st, beg-Cl, ch 2, Cl) in first ch-2 
space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3] 5 times, skip next ch-3 
space, Cl-V in next ch-2 space, turn.
Rows 10–15: Work same as Rows 8–13 of 
Point 1.Fasten off.
Points 13–23 
Work same as Point 2, beginning each point in 
the next unworked ch-2 space of Row 6.
EDGING
Round 1: Begin working across side edge of 
pineapple at beginning of top long edge of 
shawl, join yarn with slip st in ch-2 space at 
the end of Row 7 of top pineapple (this is the 
ch-2 space into which one or more clusters 
were worked at the beginning or end of Row 
7), ch 3, dc over the post of the dc at the end 
of the same row, [ch 1, dc in ch-2 space at 
the end of the next row, ch 1, dc  over the post 
of dc at the end of the same row] 6 times; 
working across top edge of main section of 
shawl, [ch 1, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, dc 
in next space between clusters] 48 times, 
ch 1, dc in next ch-2 space; working across 
side edge of pineapple, [ch 1, dc over post at 
end of the next row, ch 1, dc in ch-2 space at 
the end of the same row] 7 times, [ch 3, sc 
in ch-2 space at the end of the next row] 5 
times, ch 3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in tip of pineapple, 
[ch 3, sc in ch-2 space at end of next row] 
7 times, *sc in next ch-2 space of Row 6 of 
border, ch 3; working up next pineapple point, 
[ch 3, sc in ch-2 space at end of next row] 6 
times, ch 3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in tip of pineapple, 
[ch 3, sc in ch-2 space at end of next row] 7 
times; repeat from * 9 more times, sc in next 
ch-2 space of Row 6 of border, ch 3; working 
up pineapple point at lower center, [ch 3, sc 
in ch-2 space at end of next row] 8 times, ch 
3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in tip of pineapple, [ch 3, sc in 
ch-2 space at end of next row] 9 times,**sc 
in next ch-2 space of Row 6 of border, ch 3; 
working up next pineapple point, [ch 3, sc in 
ch-2 space at end of next row] 6 times, ch 3, 
(sc, ch 5, sc) in tip of pineapple, [ch 3, sc in 
ch-2 space at end of next row] 7 times; repeat 
from ** 9 more times, sc in next ch-2 space 
of Row 6 of border, ch 3; working up next 
pineapple point, [ch 3, sc in ch-2 space at end 
of next row] 6 times, ch 3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in tip 
of pineapple, [ch 3, sc in ch-2 space at end of 
next row] 5 times, ch 3; join with slip st in 2nd 
ch of beginning ch-3.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 1, 2 sc) in first ch-1 
space, 2 sc in each ch-1 space across to first 
ch-3 space (on side of pineapple), *(sc, ch 
3, sc) in each of next 6 ch-3 spaces, (sc, [ch 
3, sc] 3 times) in next ch-5 space (at tip of 
pineapple), (sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 6 ch-3 
spaces, sc in next 2 ch-3 spaces; repeat from 
* 10 more times, (sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next
8 ch-3 spaces, (sc, [ch 3, sc] 3 times) in next
ch-5 space (at tip of center lower pineapple),
(sc, ch 3, sc) in each of next 8 ch-3 spaces, sc
in next 2 ch-3 spaces, **(sc, ch 3, sc) in each
of next 6 ch-3 space, (sc, [ch 3, sc] 3 times)
in next ch-5 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in each of
next 6 ch-3 spaces, sc in next 2 ch-3 spaces;
repeat from ** 9 more times, (sc, ch 3, sc)
in each of next 6 ch-3 spaces, (sc, [ch 3, sc]
3 times) in next ch-5 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in
each of next 6 ch-3 spaces; join with slip st in
first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block as desired.

materials: Bernat® SatinTM (3.5 oz/100 g; 200 yds/182 m) Flamingo (04423) 5 balls
Size U.S. I/ 9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 57" [144.5 cm] wide x 31" [78.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 7 sps and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 201.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 5th ch from hook (counts as 1 dc and ch -1 sp). *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * across. 99 sps. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4. Miss first ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. *(Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next ch -1 sp. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – cluster made. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in first dc. Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Sl st in next dc. Ch 4. Miss next ch -1 sp. 1 dc in next dc – beg dec made. *Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp or cluster. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem sp unworked.
4th row: Beg dec. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. *Cluster in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Rep from * to last 5 ch-1 sps. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Turn. Leave rem sp unworked. Rep last 2 rows until there are 5 ch-1 sps.
Next row: Beg dec. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
Next row: Beg dec. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Outer Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at top left corner and work 1 rnd sc evenly down side edge, around point, up other side edge and across foundation row of Shawl. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Brushed (5 oz/141 g; 253 yds/231 m)
Contrast A Mink (5031)  2 balls or 475 yds/430 m
Contrast B Soft Mink (5030)   3 balls or  620 yds/560 m
Contrast C Dusty Pink (5071) 3 balls or  545 yds/495 m
Contrast D Clay (5092) 3 balls or  630 yds/570 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 30 x 80" [76 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 3 pat reps and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Stripe Pat
A – 9 rows. 
(B – 2 rows. A – 2 rows) 3 times. 
B – 8 rows. 
(C – 2 rows. B – 2 rows) 3 times. 
C – 8 rows. 
(D – 2 rows. C – 2 rows) 3 times. 
D – 24 rows. 
(C – 2 rows. D – 2 rows) 3 times. 
C – 8 rows. 
(B – 2 rows. C – 2 rows) 3 times. 
B – 8 rows. 
(A – 2 rows. B – 2 rows) 3 times. 
A – 10 rows.
These 147 rows form Stripe Pat.
SHAWL
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
• Shawl is reversible, there is no 
RS or WS. 
With A, ch 96 (multiple of 4 ch).
See diagram on page 2. 
Foundation row: 3 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Skip next 3 ch. (1 sc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch. Rep from * to last 4 ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 23 groups of 3-dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 3 dc in first sc. *Skip next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 dc and turning ch-3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 sc in top of ch-3. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3. 3 dc in first sc. *Skip next 3 dc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 dc and turning ch-3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 sc in top of ch-3. Turn. 
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd and 3rd rows until all 147 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. 
Fasten off. 
Fringe: With RS facing, join A with sl st to first sc at top of Shawl. 
*Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last sc. 
Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to first ch at foundation row of Shawl. 
*Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp on foundation row. Rep from * to last turning ch-3. Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. Sl st in corner ch. 
Fasten off.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 48” at widest point x 25” at longest point.
gauge: 12 mesh spaces = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in mesh pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
Ch 293.
Row 1: Dc in 5th ch from hook (first mesh space made), *ch 1, skip 1 ch, dc in next ch (mesh space made); repeat from * – 145 mesh spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, slip st in first dc, ch-1 space and next dc (1 mesh space decreased at beginning of row), ch 4, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc (first mesh space made), *ch 1, skip ch-1 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to last mesh space, do not work last mesh space (1 mesh space decreased at end of row).
Row 3-6: Repeat Row 2. Mark center mesh space on last row – 135 mesh spaces.
Row 7: Work as for Row 2 to marked center mesh space, following Chart, work Blocks in mesh spaces, continue to work as established to end of row.
Rows 8-73: Continue to follow Chart, decreasing 1 mesh space at beginning and end of every row.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Fringe: Cut 2 lengths of yarn, each 24”. Holding both lengths together, fold in half then in half again. Pull folded end through last mesh space of Row 73. Slip ends through folded loop and pull to tighten. Continue to make a Fringe in every other mesh space along each edge of Shawl.
Trim ends.
RED HEART® 'LusterSheen®', Art. E721 available in 4 oz (113 g), 335 yd (306 m) balls.

materials: Caron® Blossom Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481yds/440m) Macaw (37006) 2 cakes or 740 yds/670 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 26" x 75" [66 x 190.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 4 at beg of rows counts as tr.
• Move marker onto new center ch-sp as you work each row.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc. Ch 5. 3 dc) in ring. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Shell in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. PM on center ch-2 sp. Shell in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Cluster in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in top (ch-1 sp) of next shell. Ch 5. [(1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) in next center ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in top (ch-sp) of next shell. Ch 5. Cluster in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Shell in next ch-3 sp. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp.* (Shell. Ch 2. Shell) in next center ch-5 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Shell in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
5th row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Cluster in next ch-3 sp. *Ch 5. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 5. (Cluster. Ch 5. Cluster) in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 5.* (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Cluster in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
6th row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Shell in next ch-3 sp. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Shell in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp.* (Shell. Ch 2. Shell) in next center ch-5 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Shell in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
7th row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Cluster in next ch-3 sp. *Ch 5. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 5. (Cluster. Ch 5. Cluster) in next ch-5 sp.* Rep from * to * to last shell before center ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 5. (1 dc. Ch 5. 1 dc) in next center ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * to last shell. Ch 5. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 5. Cluster in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
8th row: Ch 4. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Shell in next ch-3 sp. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Shell in next ch-5 sp.* Rep from * to * to last 2 ch-5 sps before center ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp.* (Shell. Ch 2. Shell) in next center ch-5 sp. Rep from * to * to last 2 ch-5 sps. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Shell in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in last ch 4. Turn.
Rep 7th and 8th rows until Shawl along center line measures approx 35" [89 cm], ending on 8th row.
Edging: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 2 dc. *[(1 tr. Ch 1) 8 times. 1 tr] in top of next shell. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 1.* Rep from * to * to last shell before center ch-2 sp. [(1 tr. Ch 1) 8 times. 1 tr] in top of next shell. Ch 1. [(1 tr. Ch 1) 5 times. 1 tr] in center ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to * to last shell. [(1 tr. Ch 1) 8 times. 1 tr] in top of last shell. Skip next 2 dc. Sl st to top of ch 4. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sl st. Ch 2. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Rep from * to end of row. 1 sc in top of last tr. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Norse™  (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds/193 m)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 smaller buttons 1" [2.5 cm] diameter for sides.
2 larger buttons 1½" [4 cm] diameter for front.
gauge: 10 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]  in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Garment is worked in one piece.
Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Beg at lower edge of Back, ch 101 (110 -122 ). See diagram on page 3.
1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc and sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures 25 ( 30 -34 )" [63.5 ( 76 -86.5 ) cm], ending on a WS row. PM at each end of last row for shoulders.
Shape neck and Right Side:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. [(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp] 14 times. Skip next dc and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row:  Ch 3 (does not count as st). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc and sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc and sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 25 ( 30 -34 )" [63.5 ( 76 -86.5 ) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Left Side:  With RS facing skip next 2 ch-1 sps. Join yarn with sl st to next ch-1 sp.
1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc and sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 ch-1 sps. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last ch-1 sp. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. Skip first dc. 1 sc in next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc and sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc and sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 25 ( 30 -34 )" [63.5 (76-86.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Buttonhole front and neck edging: Ch 17 (19 -21 ).
1st row:  (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 (17 -19 ) hdc.
2nd row:  Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar created below next st in previous row which creates ridge (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram which shows WS of work), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures from bottom to beg of neck shaping along left front edge and sew in position as you work. Mark position of 2 buttons 8 (10 -12 )" [20.5 (25.5 -30.5 ) cm] and 14 (16 -18 )" [35.5 (40.5 -45.5 ) cm] up from bottom of edging.
Cont as before around neck edge and down right front edge to bottom, working buttonholes to correspond to button markers as follows:
1st row:  (RS). Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar created below next st in previous row which creates ridge, 1 hdc in each of next 7 ( 8 -9 ) sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar created below next st in previous row which creates ridge, 1 hdc in each st to next ch-2 sp. 2 hdc in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Try on Wrap and sew 2 smaller buttons through all thicknesses to secure sides. Sew 2 larger buttons to correspond to buttonholes. Fold back shawl collar (see photo).

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (141 g/5 oz; 236 yds/215 m) Parrot Stripe (4968) 3 balls or 700 yds/637 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] deep, excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Move marker up each row to center ch-2 sp.
Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 4 dc in 4th ch from hook (turning ch 3 counts as dc). Turn. 5 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first dc. 1 hdc in next dc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next dc. PM on center ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next dc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. Ch 1. (1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th to 7th rows: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. Ch 1. *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc.* Rep from * to * to last hdc before center ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 5th to 8th rows until Shawl from beg ch measures approx 30" [76 cm], ending on 7th row. Do not fasten off.
Fringe Row: *Ch 10. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 8 ch. Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Ch 10. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 8 ch. Sl st in last hdc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 3 skeins of 319 Cherry Red
OR RED HEART® Super Saver® Jumbo: 2 skeins of 319 Cherry
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Shawl measures 17” (43 cm) x 60” (152.5 cm). One Size Fits All.
gauge: 12 sts and 8 rows = 4”
instructions:
SHAWL
Ch 40.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—39 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), skip first 2 sc, *dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc; rep from * across to last sc, dc in last sc, turn—19 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 4, skip next ch-1 space, *3-dc cluster in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to turning ch, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn—18 clusters.
Row 5: Ch 4, skip next ch-1 space, *dc in next cluster, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space; rep from * across, to turning ch, dc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn—19 ch-1 spaces.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next dc; repeat from * across, ending with last sc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn—39 sc.
Rows 7–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat Rows 3–8 until piece measures 56” (142 cm) from beginning. Fasten off.
Ruffled Border
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in top right-hand corner with a slip st, ch 1, 3 sc in same st, *working across long edge of wrap, work 1 sc in each row-end sc and 2 sc in each row-end dc or ch-3 space to next corner, 3 sc in next corner*, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, 3 sc in next corner; repeat from * to * once, sc (10 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

materials: Red Heart® Roll With It Sparkle™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 561 yds/513 m) Krystal (9801) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
Shell = (3 tr. Ch 1. 3 tr) in indicated stitch
measurements: Approx 56" [142 cm] wide x 35" [89 cm] deep.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (WS). Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 tr) in ring. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). Shell in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next dc. PM on just made ddc for center of shawl. Ch 2. Shell in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). 1 dc in first ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in top (ch-1 sp) of next shell. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in center dc. Move marker on just made ch-3 sp for center of shawl. Ch 3. 1 sc in top (ch-1 sp) of next shell. Ch 3. 1 dc in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
4th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). Shell in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp.* Ch 1. (Shell. Ch 2. 1 dc. Ch 2. Shell) in center ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 1. Shell in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
5th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). 1 dc in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3.** (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to ** once more.* (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in center dc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 dc in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
6th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). Shell in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp.** Ch 1. Shell in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to ** once more.* Ch 1. (Shell. Ch 2. 1 dc. Ch 2. Shell) in next center ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 1. Shell in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
7th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). 1 dc in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next ch-5 sp.* Rep from * to * to center group of (Shell, ch 2, dc, ch 2, Shell). Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) in center dc. Rep from * to * to last Shell. Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next shell. Ch 3. 1 dc in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
8th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). Shell in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Shell in next ch-3 sp.* Rep from * to * to 2 ch-3 sps before center ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (Shell. Ch 2. 1 dc. Ch 2. Shell) in center ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * to last 2 ch-3 sps and ch 7. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Shell in last ch-7 sp. Ch 3. 1 tr in 4th ch of same ch 7. Turn.
Rep 7th and 8th rows until Shawl along center line measures approx 35" [89 cm], ending on 7th row.
Edging
1st row: (RS). Ch 6. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook (counts as dc and picot). *4 dc in next ch-3 sp. Picot.* Rep from * to * to center ch-3 sp. (4 dc. Picot) twice in center ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * to last ch-7. 4 dc Picot in last ch 7. 1 dc in 4th ch of same ch 7. Fasten off.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz; 288 m/315 yds)
In size US I-9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge. Yarn needle.
Simply Soft Paints (113 g/4. oz; 190 m/208 yds)
abbreviations: V-st = V-stitch - (dc, ch1, dc) in indicated stitch or space.
measurements: Shawl measures approximately 68"/172.5cm wide x 38"/96.5cm long.
gauge: In pattern rows, first 7 rows = 10"/25.5 cm measured from side to side; first 7 rows = 5"/12.5 cm measured from center to point.
instructions: Picot: (Sc, ch 3, sc) in indicated stitch or space. SHAWL Row 1 (RS): With A, chain 4 (beginning ch counts as first dc); work 8 dc in 4th ch from hook, turn—9 dc. Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc (increase made), (dc, ch 2, dc) in next dc (V-st made), skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next dc (corner made), ch 2, dc in next dc, skip next dc, V-st in next dc, 2 dc in last dc (increase made), turn—12 dc, 4 ch-2 spaces, and 1 corner ch-3 space. Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first dc, sc in next dc, skip next dc, 3 sc in each ch-2 space to corner ch-3 space, 5 sc in corner ch-3 space (corner made), 3 sc in each ch-2 space to last 3 dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc, 2 sc in last dc, turn—23 sc. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in each sc to center sc of corner 5-sc group, 5 dc in center sc of corner 5-sc group (corner made), dc in each sc to last sc, 2 dc in last sc, turn—29 dc. Row 5: Ch 3, dc in first dc, *V-st in next dc, skip next 2 dc; repeat from * to center 3 dc of corner 5-dc group, skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next dc (corner made), ch 2, dc in next dc, **skip next 2 dc, V-st in next dc; repeat from ** to last dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn—24 dc, 10 ch-2 spaces, and 1 corner ch-3 space. Repeat Rows 3–5 thirteen more times. Do not fasten off. Edging Round: Repeat Row 3 once more; do not turn at end of row; working in ends of rows along top edge, sc in corner, sc evenly spaced across to next corner, sc in corner; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. FINISHING Lower Border Row 1: With RS facing, join B with sc in first sc of edging round (first sc of last Row 3 worked); *sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * to corner, sc in 2nd sc of corner 5-sc group, ch 5, skip center sc of corner 5-sc group, **sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next 2 sc; repeat from ** to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn. Row 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), *sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5; repeat from * to corner, (sc, ch 5, sc) in corner ch-5 space, ch 5, **sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5; repeat from ** across to last ch-5 space, sc in last ch-5 space, ch 3, dc in last sc, turn. Row 3: Ch 3, 4 dc in first ch-3 space, sc in next ch-5 space, *9 dc in next ch-5 space, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * to corner, 11 dc in corner ch-5 space, sc in next ch-5 space, **9 dc in next ch-5 space, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from ** across to last ch-3 space, 5 dc in last ch-3 space. Row 4: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 1), tr in first dc, ch 1, tr in next dc, *skip next 7 sts (i.e. next 3 dc, next sc, and next 3 dc), tr in next dc, ch 1, (tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next dc, ch 1, tr in next dc; repeat from * to corner, skip next 7 sts, tr in next dc (4th dc of corner), ch 1, (tr, ch 1, tr) in next dc, ch 1, (tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next dc, ch 1, (tr, ch 1, tr) in next dc, ch 1, tr in next dc, **skip next 7 sts (i.e. next 3 dc, next sc, and next 3 dc), tr in next dc, ch 1, (tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next dc, ch 1, tr in next dc; repeat from ** across to last 9 sts, skip next 7 sts, tr in next dc, ch 1, (tr, ch 1, tr) in last dc, turn. Row 5: Picot in first 4 ch-1 spaces, *picot in next tr, picot in next 4 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * to corner, picot in next 6 ch-1 spaces, picot in next tr, picot in next 6 ch-1 spaces, **picot in next tr, picot in next 4 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * across. Fasten off. Using yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Tweeds™ (5 oz/141 g; 240 yds/219 m) Gray Heather Tweeds (23002) 9 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch, inserting hook from back to front to back. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch, inserting hook from front to back to front. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] wide x 62" [157.5 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Pocket Linings (make 2)
Ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 33 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm], ending on a WS row.

Final (set-up) row:  (RS).  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *(1 dcfp around post of next sc 2 rows below) twice. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Fasten off.

SHAWL (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 73. See diagram on page 3.
Set Up Pat: 1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 71 dc.

2nd row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. *(1 dcfp around post of next dc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 4 dc. (1 dcfp around post of next dc) twice. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.

3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp across. Turn.

Proceed in pat as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) twice. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Working in front of row, 1 tr in next skipped sc 2 rows below. Skip next st (behind tr). 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Working in front of row, 1 tr in same skipped sc 2 rows below as last tr. Skip next sc (behind tr). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * last 4 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) twice. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.

2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp across. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 9" [18 cm], ending on a RS row. 

Place Pocket Lining: Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 19 sts. Work 1 sc in each of 33 sts from Pocket Lining. Skip next 33 sts of Shawl. 1 sc in each of last 19 sts of Shawl. Turn. 71 sc.

Cont in pat until work from beg measures 31" [79 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Join Shawl Pieces: With RS facing each other, align final rows of Shawl Pieces (center back). With WS facing, join yarn with sl st and work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses to join. Fasten off.

Front Neck Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st at lower corner of Right Front and work 189 sc evenly up Right Front and down Left Front. (Note: St number must be an odd number). Turn.

2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

3rd row:  Ch 2. 1 dcfp around post of first st. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

4th row:  Ch 2. 1 dcbp around post of first st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dcbp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

5th to 8th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows twice more.

Fasten off.

Pocket Edging: 1st row:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st in first skipped sc of Pocket edge on Shawl. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 32 sc. Turn. 33 sc.

2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around post of first st. *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

4th row:  Ch 2. 1 dcbp around post of first st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dcbp around post of next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

Fasten off. Sew sides of Pocket Edging in position to Shawl. Sew sides of Pocket Lining in position on WS noting that lower edge of Pocket Lining is approx 2" [5 cm] above lower edge of Shawl.

Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 14" [35.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into fringe in every other st across both ends of Shawl. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® Ombre™: 1 skein 3968 Purple
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 74" wide x 24" long at center (188 cm x 61 cm).
gauge: Row 5 = 4" (10 cm); Rows 1–5 = 3½" (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL Increase Section
Ch 5.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 tr in 5th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first tr), turn—3 tr.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), tr in first tr, tr in next tr, 2 tr in last tr, turn—5 tr.
Row 3: Beg V-st in first tr, ch 3, sk next tr, sc in next tr, ch 3, V-st in space between last 2 tr, turn—1 sc and 2 V-sts.
Row 4: Beg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 V-sts and 1 lg V-st.
Row 5: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in lg V-st, ch 3, ddc in last tr of same lg V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc, 1 dc, and 2 V-sts.
Row 6: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in dc, ch 3, lg V-st in sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Row 7: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Row 8: Beg V-st, ch 3, dc in first tr of lg V-st, ch 3, sc in same lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc, 1 dc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Row 9: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in sc, ch 3, sc in dc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Row 10: Beg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in first sc, ch 3, sc in lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in last sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st—1 sc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 11: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in first lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, dc in last tr of same lg V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 1 dc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Row 12: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in dc, ch 3, lg V-st in first sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in last sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 13: Beg V-st, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 14: Beg V-st, ch 3, dc in first tr of next lg V-st, *ch 3, sc in same lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 1 dc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 15: Beg V-st, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to dc, ch 3, sc in dc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—3 sc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 16: Beg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in first sc, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st—2 sc, 2 V-sts, and 3 lg V-sts.
Row 17: Beg V-st, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * to last lg V-st, ch 3, sc in last lg V-st, ch 3, dc in last tr of same lg V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—3 sc, 1 dc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 18: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in dc, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—3 sc, 2 V-sts, and 3 lg V-sts.
Rows 19-54: Repeat Rows 13–18 six times—9 sc, 2 V-sts, and 9 lg V-sts. Place marker at beginning of last row. 
Decrease Section
Row 55 (right side): Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in first lg V-st, *ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st; repeat from * across to last sc, ch 3, dc in last sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—9 sc, 1 dc, 2 V-sts, and 8 lg V-sts. 
Row 56: Beg V-st, ch 3, skip dc, lg V-st in next sc, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—8 sc, 2 V-sts, and 9 lg V-sts.
Row 57: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in first lg V-st, *ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—9 sc, 2 V-sts, and 8 lg V-sts. 
Row 58: Beg V-st, ch 3, dc in first sc, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—8 sc, 2 V-sts, and 8 lg V-sts.
Rows 59 and 60: Beg V-st, *ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn. 
Rows 61–96: Repeat Rows 55–60 six times—1 sc and 2 V-sts. 
Row 97: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in first lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, dc in last sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st. 
Row 98: Beg V-st, ch 3, skip dc, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc, 2 V-sts, and 2 lg V-sts.
Row 99: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in first lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 sc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Row 100: Beg V-st, ch 3, dc in first sc, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in last sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc, 2 V-sts, and 1 lg V-st.
Rows 101 and 102: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in next lg V-st, ch 3, lg V-st in next sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn.
Row 103: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in lg V-st, ch 3, dc in sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc and 2 V-sts.
Row 104: Beg V-st, ch 3, skip dc, lg V-st in sc, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 V-sts and 1 lg V-st.
Row 105: Beg V-st, ch 3, sc in lg V-st, ch 3, V-st in last V-st, turn—1 sc and 2 V-sts.
Row 106: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and next row), tr in last dc of first V-st, tr in sc, tr in first dc of last V-st, tr in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—5 tr.
Row 107: Ch 4, [tr2tog] twice, working last “leg” of last tr2tog in top of beginning ch, turn—3 tr.
Row 108: Ch 1, skip first tr, sc3tog, working last “leg” in top of beginning ch, turn—1 sc. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Round 1 (right side): (Slip st, ch 1, hdc) in sc; working in ends of rows, edging V-st in each row around, working 2 edging V-sts in marked row and 1 edging st in opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1; join with slip st in first slip st. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING Weave in ends. Block piece to finished measurements, if desired.

materials: Caron® Skinny Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 795 yds/727 m) Baked Alaska (18008) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg or row does not count as hdc. Ch 189 loosely (multiple of 10 ch + 9). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 10th ch from hook (counts as tr and ch 3). 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. *Ch 6. Skip next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 tr in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first tr. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 4. Rep from * ending with 1 hdc in 5th ch of turning ch 9. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4.* Rep from * to * 16 times more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp.** 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4.* Rep from * to * 16 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 6. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp.** 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc.* Rep from * to * 16 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 4. Skip next hdc.** 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc.* Rep from * to * 16 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Skip next hdc.** 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.* Rep from * to * 16 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). *1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp.** Ch 6. Skip next hdc.* Rep from * to * 16 times more, then from * to ** once. Ch 3. 1 tr in last hdc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first tr. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 4. Rep from * ending with 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch 7. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 10th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm], ending on a 9th row of pat. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ O’Go (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215) Peacock (7155) 2 O’Gos
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] deep, excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Move marker up each row to center ch-2 sp.
Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 4 dc in 4th ch from hook (turning ch 3 counts as dc). Turn. 5 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first dc. 1 hdc in next dc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next dc. PM on center ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next dc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. Ch 1. (1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
5th to 7th rows: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. Ch 1. *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc.* Rep from * to * to last hdc before center ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 5th to 8th rows until Shawl from beg ch measures approx 30" [76 cm], ending on 7th row. Do not fasten off.
Fringe Row: *Ch 10. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 8 ch. Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Ch 10. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 8 ch. Sl st in last hdc.
Fasten off.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8 mm [US L-11]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc;
gauge: 8½ dc = 4" (10 cm) with 2 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES
1. Ruana is worked in two separate panels that are then joined together lengthwise, but only halfway.
2. Yarn is held doubled throughout.
3. This is an oversized garment. For the best fit, stretch arms out to either side so that elbows are at shoulder height. Measure from elbow to elbow to determine width, then follow instructions with the finished measurement that best matches.
4. Beginning ch-2 and ch-3 do not count as stitches.
5. When changing colors, assure at least 10" (25.5 cm) of yarn tail is left; weave ends into tassels at the end.

RUANA
Right Panel
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 112 (117, 122).
Row 1 (wrong side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn. – 110 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, tr in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: With B, repeat row 3.
Row 5: With C, ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, tr in each st across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across, turn.
Next 4 rows: With B, repeat Row 3, then with D, repeat Rows 5-7.
Next 0 (4, 4) Rows: With B, repeat Row 3, then with A, repeat Rows 5-7.
Next 0 (0, 4) Rows: With B, repeat Row 3, then with A, repeat Rows 5-7.
Next 4 Rows: With B, repeat Row 3, then with D, repeat Rows 5-7.
Next 4 Rows: With B, repeat Row 3, then with C, repeat Rows 5-7.
Next 4 Rows: With B, repeat Row 3, then with A, repeat Rows 5-7.
Fasten off.

Left Panel
Work same as right panel but do not fasten off.
Final Row: With B, Ch 2, hdc in each of first 55 (57, 60) sts.
Do not fasten off.

FINISHING
Assembly
Hold panels with right sides facing together and wrong sides facing out. Assure that final row sts of both panels are aligned evenly with each other. With B, slip st the panels together from center of row outward to the edge. Fasten off.

Tassels
Attach a tassel at edge of each tr row as follows:
Cut 20 lengths of yarn in color matching the row, 8" (20.5 cm) each, and fold in half. Using crochet hook, pull the folded edge up through the tr at edge of row. Pull ends through folded loop and pull tight to secure. Weave yarn ends into tassels to conceal. Trim tassels evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 3 balls of each 5360 Suede A and 5327 Mai Tai B
abbreviations: A, B = colors A and B
( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Project measures 68” [173 cm] in width, 17” [43 cm] in length.
gauge: 11 hdc = 4.25" (11 cm); 12 rows = 4.25” (11 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PATTERN
With A, 18 Fdc. Turn.
Row 1 (WS): Ch 3, 3 hdc in first dc, hdc in each dc across to last, 3 hdc in last dc. Change color to B. Turn- 22 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 3, 3 hdc in first hdc, hdc in each hdc across to last hdc, 3 hdc in last hdc. Turn. – 26 hdc
Row 3: Repeat Row 2. Change Color to A. – 30 hdc.
Rows 4 - 5: Repeat Row 2. Change Color to B – 38 hdc.
Rows 6 – 37: Repeat Rows 2 - 5 – 166 hdc. 
EDGING
Row 1: With B, ch 1, 3 sc in first hdc, sc in each hdc across to last, 3 sc in last hdc. Turn. – 170 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each sc across. Turn.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), *2 dc-cl in next dc, sc in next dc, ch 4, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc, 2 dc-cl in next dc, ch 4, 2 dc-cl in next dc, sc in next dc, ch 4, skip 2 dc, sc in next dc, 2 dc-cl in next ddc, ch 2; repeat from * across to tch, ch 1, dc in top of tch. Turn. – 56 dc-cl.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *ch 4, sc in next ch-4 space, [ch 1, dc] 6 times in next ch-4 space (shell made), ch 1, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 4**, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across ending at **, sc in top of tch. Turn. – 14 shells.
Row 5: Ch 4, 2 dc-cl in first sc, *sc in next ch-4 space, (ch 2, 2 dc-cl) in next 6 dc, ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space**, (2 dc-cl, ch 2, 2 dc-cl) in next sc; repeat from * across ending at **, (2 dc-cl, ch 1, dc) in last sc. Turn. – 112 dc-cl.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *2 dc in next ch -2 space, 3 dc in next 5 ch-2 spaces, 2 dc in next ch-2 space**, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across ending at **, sc in top of tch. Turn.- 266 dc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *(sc, ch 4, 2 dc-cl) in next dc, [skip 2 dc, (sc, ch 4, 2 dc-cl) in next dc] 5 times, skip 2 dc, sc in next dc**, skip next sc; repeat from * across ending at **, sc in last sc. Fasten off. – 84 dc-cl.
FINISHING 
Weave in all loose ends. Soak project in cool bath, wrap in towels and gently roll out water. Lay project out to finished size and pin in place to dry.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 3 balls each 4614 Black A and 3729 Grape C
RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable®: 3 balls 3940 Echo B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.25 mm [US D-3]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Ruana measures 36” wide x 60” long (91.5 x 152.5 cm).
gauge: 8 pattern repeats = 4” (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of 1 chain and 1 single crochet); 13 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
RUANA
Panel (make 2)
With A, ch 241.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, sc in last ch; change to B, turn—121 sc and 119 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, sc in last sc; change to C, turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2; change to A at end of row.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2; change to B at end of row.
Rows 5–73: Repeat last 3 rows 23 times. Do not change to B at end of Row 73.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Place a stitch marker at center of top edge of each panel. With A, sew last rows together from first stitch to marked stitch to form back seam; leave remaining stitches unsewn.
Edging Row: With right side of joined panels facing (back of piece) and working in ends of rows, join C with sc in last row, reverse sc in each row across. Fasten off. Repeat Edging Row in ends of rows of short front edge of each panel. Weave in ends.

Galactic Shawl
Breathtaking design is combined with easy 
to crochet fine yarn. This shawl is a beautiful 
way to accessorize for a special event or an 
evening out.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-2 space, beg-Cl in 
same ch-2 space, [ch 5, Cl in next ch-2 space] 
19 times, ch 5; join with slip st in top of of 
beg-Cl—20 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in first 3 ch, ch 1, sc in same 
ch-5 space, [ch 7, sc in next ch-5 space 
19 times, ch 3, tr (counts as ch 4 here and 
throughout) in first sc—20 ch-7 sps. Fasten off. 
Round 5: With right side facing, join B with 
sc in any ch-7 space, [ch 8, sc in next ch-7 
space] 19 times, ch 4, tr in first sc—20 ch-8 
spaces. Fasten off. 
Large Motif #2
Work same as large motif #1 through Round 
4—20 ch-7 spaces.
Round 5 (connecting round here and 
throughout): With right side facing, join B with 
sc in any ch-7 space, ch 4, slip st in any ch-8 
space of previously made large motif, ch 4, sc 
in next ch-7 space, [ch 4, slip st in next ch-8 
space of previously made large motif, ch 4, sc 
in next ch-7 space] 3 times, [ch 8, sc in next 
ch-7 space] 15 times, ch 4, tr in first sc—20 
ch-8 spaces. Fasten off.
Large Motif #3
Work same as large motif #1 through Round 
4—20 ch-7 spaces.
Round 5 (connecting round here and 
throughout): With right side facing, join B 
with sc in any ch-7 space, ch 4, working in a 
clockwise direction, skip first 6 ch-8 spaces 
from last join of previously made motifs, slip st 
in next ch-8 space of previously made motif, 
ch 4, sc in next ch-7 space, [ch 4, slip st in 
next ch-8 space of previously made large 
motif, ch 4, sc in next ch-7 space] 3 times, [ch 
8, sc in next ch-7 space] 15 times, ch 4, tr in 
first sc—20 ch-8 spaces. Fasten off.
Shawl measures 18” wide x 54” long  
(45.5 x 137 cm)
Special Stitches
beg-Cl (beginning cluster) = Ch 4 (counts as 
first tr), tr in indicated space.
Cl (cluster) = [Yo] twice, insert hook in 
indicated space, yo and draw up a loop, [yo 
and pull through 2 loops] twice; [yo] twice, 
insert hook in same space, yo and draw up a 
loop, [yo and pull through 2 loops] twice; yo 
and pull through all 3 loops on hook.
Special Technique
join with sc = Place a slip knot on hook, insert 
hook in indicated space, yarn over and draw 
up a loop, yarn over and draw through both 
loops on hook.
Notes
1. Shawl is made from ¬¬27 large motifs,
arranged into 9 rows of 3 motifs each, and
16 small motifs joined in spaces between
large motifs.
2. Each motif is worked in joined rounds with
right side facing at all times.
3. Motifs are joined to neighboring motifs
using a “join-as-you-go” technique as the
last round is worked.

from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join

Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as first tr, ch 2), tr in 
next dc, [ch 2, tr in next dc] 18 times, ch 2; 
join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch—20 
ch-2 spaces.
