spaces. Fasten off.
Large Motif #6
Work same as large motif #5.
Rows 3–9 (large motifs #7–27)
Repeat Row 2 (large motifs #4–#6) seven 
times.
Small Motifs (make 16)
Note: Each small motif will be joined to 12 
spaces: 4 unworked ch-8 spaces and 8 
spaces created from the joins between the 
large motifs.
With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook 
(beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip 
st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: [Ch 3, sc in next dc] 11 times, dc in 
last sc (counts as last ch 3)—12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in last ch-3 space (made 
from dc), [ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space] 11 
times, ch 2, dc in last sc (with last ch 2, 
counts as ch 5)—12 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4 (connecting round): Ch 1, sc in last 
ch-5 space, ch 3, slip st in unworked ch-8 
space of large motif, *ch 3, sc in next ch-5 
space, [ch 3, slip st in next joining space 
between 2 large motifs] twice, ch 3, sc in 
next ch-5 space, ch 3**, slip st in unworked 
ch-8 space of next large motif; repeat from * 
around ending last repeat at **; join with slip 
st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Lightly block to open motifs.

materials: Bernat® Satin Sparkle™ (2.8 oz/80 g; 160 yds/146 m) Amethyst (53307) 6 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 61" [155 cm] wide x 31" [78.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at point, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in 5th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 2. 1 dc in same ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4. Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster. Ch 2. 1 dc) in turning ch sp. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster. Ch 2. 1 dc) in turning ch sp. Turn. 3 clusters.
4th row: Ch 4. Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster. Ch 2. 1 dc) in turning ch sp. Turn.
Rep last row until there are 61 clusters in row. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m) Sunset Dreams (57011) 2 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Move marker to every center ch-2 sp.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. Ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn. 5 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first dc. 1 hdc in next dc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next dc. PM on ch-2 sp for center. 1 hdc in next dc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first hdc. Ch 1. (1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 dc in last hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each st to last ch 3. 2 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first dc. 1 hdcfp around each dc to center ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. 1 hdcfp around each dc to last dc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first hdc. Ch 1. *1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next st. * Rep from * to * to last dc before ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to * last 2 hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 dc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 5th to 8th rows until Shawl from beg ch measures approx 30" [76 cm], ending on 6th row. Fasten off.
Tassels: (make 3). Cut a piece of cardboard 6" [15 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 20 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew Tassels to each point of Shawl.

materials: Patons® Grace (50 g /1.75 oz; 125 m /136 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
abbreviations: hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop from front to back around post of next st. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 23 ins [58.5 cm] wide x 64 ins [162.5 cm] long.
gauge: 17 sc and 18 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 136 loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 133 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). H dcfp around each dc across to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, (ch 4. 4 tr) in first st (counts as 5 tr). *(1 tr in next st. Miss next st) 8 times. 1 tr in next st.** (5 tr in next st) twice. Rep from * to last 18 sts, then rep from * to ** once. 5 tr in last st. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). H dcfp around each tr across to last tr. 1 hdc in last tr. Join C. Turn.
5th row: With C, (ch 3. 4 dc) in first st (counts as 5 dc). *(1 dc in next st. Miss next st) 8 times. 1 dc in next st.** (5 dc in next st) twice. Rep from * to last 18 sts, then rep from * to ** once. 5 dc in last st. Turn.
6th row: As 2nd row, ending with join A. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in each st across. Fasten off. Do not turn.
8th row: (RS). Join C with sl st to top of ch 4. (Ch 3. 4 dc) in same sp as sl st (counts as 5 dc). *(1 dc in next st. Miss next st) 8 times. 1 dc in next st.** (5 dc in next st) twice. Rep from * to last 18 sts, then rep from * to ** once. 5 dc in last st. Turn.
9th row: As 2nd row.
10th and 11th rows: With B, as 3rd and 4th rows, ending last row with join A. Turn.
12th and 13th rows: With A, as 5th and 6th rows, ending last row with join C. Turn.
14th row: With C, as 7th row. Do not Turn.
15th row: (RS). Join A with sl st to top of ch 4. (Ch 3. 4 dc) in same sp as sl st (counts as 5 dc). *(1 dc in next st. Miss next st) 8 times. 1 dc in next st.** (5 dc in next st) twice. Rep from * to last 18 sts, then rep from * to ** once. 5 dc in last st. Turn.
16th row: As 2nd row.
Rep 3rd to 16th rows for pat until Wrap measures approx 64 ins [162.5 cm] long, ending on a 16th row. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 28" [71 cm] deep.
gauge: 20 sc and 22 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at Neck edge, ch 12. (See diagram on page 3).
1st row: 1 dc in 9th ch from hook. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. (1 dc. Ch 4. 1 tr) in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 8 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. 8 dc in next ch-9 sp. 1 dc in 5th ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) 8 times. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) 8 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2) 8 times. Skip next dc and ch-1 sp. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 2) twice. Skip next ch-1 sp and dc. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2) 7 times. 1 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 4. Turn.
5th row: Ch 10 (counts as tr and ch 6). Skip first ch-1 sp. (1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp) 4 times. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc.
6th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 8 dc in first ch-6 sp. (1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6) twice. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. 8 dc in next ch-6 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. 8 dc in next ch-6 sp. (1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6) twice. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. 8 dc in last ch-6 sp. 1 dc in 4th ch of ch 10. Turn.
7th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) 7 times. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) 8 times. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) 8 times. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) 8 times. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
8th row:  Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). (1 dcfp around next dc. Ch 2) 7 times. 1 dcfp around next dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 1. (1 dcfp around next dc. Ch 2) 8 times. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. 1 dcfp around next dc) 8 times. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 1. (1 dcfp around next dc. Ch 2) 8 times. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 4. Turn.
9th row: Ch 10 (count as tr and ch 6). Skip first ch-2 sp. (1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp) 3 times. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next: (Ch 1. 1 hdc. Ch 1). 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp) 3 times. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp) 4 times. Ch 6. Skip next: (Ch 1. 1 hdc. Ch 1). (1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp) 3 times. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. 1 tr in 3rd ch of ch 5. Turn.
10th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 8 dc in first ch-6 sp. *[(1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6) twice. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. 8 dc in next ch-6 sp]. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. **[8 dc in next ch-6 sp. (1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6) twice. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp]. Rep from ** once more. 8 dc in last ch-6 sp. 1 dc in 4th ch of ch 10. Turn.
11th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *[(1 dc in next dc. Ch 1) 7 times.** 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp]. Ch 1. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * to last dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
12th row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). *[(1 dcfp around next dc. Ch 2) 7 times. 1 dcfp around next dc.** Ch 1. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 1]. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. (Ch 2. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Ch 2. Rep from * to last dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 4. Turn.
13th row: Ch 10 (counts as tr and ch 6). Skip first ch-2 sp. *[(1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp) 3 times. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next: (Ch 1. 1 hdc. Ch 1). Rep from * once more]. (1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp) 3 times. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2 (center). 1 dc in next dc. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to **. 1 tr in 3rd ch of ch 5. Turn.
Rep rows 10 to 13 for pat, noting rep in [ ] will be repeated 1 more time in subsequent rows, until Shawl measures approx 60" [152.5 cm] across top straight edge, ending on a 12th row of pat. Fasten off.
Pin Shawl to measurements. Cover with damp cloth and leave to dry or steam lightly with iron or steamer held approx 6" [15 cm] away from surface of work.

materials: Patons® Lincoln Fog™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds/174 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels.
measurements: Approx 15½" x 69" [39.5 x 175.5 cm], excluding tassels
gauge: 11.5 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
Stripe Pat
With A, work 1 rnd.
With B, work 1 rnd.
With C, work 1 rnd.
These 3 rnds form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 147. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to last ch. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in last ch. Working along opposite side of foundation ch, 1 dc in each ch to last ch with dc worked into it. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc. Ch 2) all in last ch. Break A. Join with B. 300 dc.

2nd rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each dc to corner ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Break B. Join with C.
3rd rnd: With C, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each dc to corner ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dc in each dc to beg ch-3. Break C. Join with A.
First 3 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until Wrap measures approx 70" [178 cm] down longest edge, ending with rnd of A.
Fasten off.
Tassels (make 4 A)
Wrap A around a 7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard 40 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½"s [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach 1 tassel to each corner of Wrap.

materials: Caron® Skinny Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 795 yds/727 m) Blueberry Pudding (18003) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 22 x 64” [56 x 162.5 cm].
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Shawl is worked in 2 Halves, then sewn tog.
FIRST HALF
See diagram on page 2.
First Side: Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp – block made. Turn.
3rd row: Beg block. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until side edge measures approx 11” [28 cm], ending on a WS row (even number of blocks). Fasten oﬀ.
Second Side: Work as given for First Side. Do not fasten oﬀ.
Join sides: 1st row: (RS). Work across Second Side as follows: Beg block. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to last block. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp of last block. Skip first 3 dc of first block of First Side. Sl st to next ch-3 sp of first block of First Side. Ch 3. Place marker in last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last block. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Turn.
2nd row: Beg block. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to marker on ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next marked ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Place marker to last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last block. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 32” [81.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Proceed as follows:
Next row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to marker on ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next marked ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3. Ch 3. Place marker to last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last 2 blocks. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Turn.
Next row: Sl st in first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. Make block. Rep from * to marker on ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next marked ch-3 sp. Skip next 3 dc. Sl st to next ch-3. Ch 3. Place marker to last ch. **3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from ** to last 2 blocks. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Turn.
Rep last row until 2 blocks rem. 
Next row: Sl st in first 3 dc and next ch-3 sp. Sl st to next ch-3 sp. Fasten oﬀ.
SECOND HALF
Work as given for First Half. Following diagram, sew both Halves tog.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished size, lightly blocked 35.5cm [14”] x 140cm [55”]
instructions:
Row 9: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, 3 tr in next dc, *skip next dc, ch 2, skip next tr, dc in next 3 tr, skip next tr, ch 2, skip next dc, fan in next dc; repeat from * across to last 3 tr, ch 2, dc in next 3 tr, ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn.
Row 10: Ch 3, tr in each ch-2 space, dc, and tr across to beginning ch-3 space, tr in space, tr in top of ch-3 space; turn —  161 tr.
Row 11: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 3-11 one time then repeat Rows 3-7 one more time.
Row 26: Ch 1, dc in first st, ch 3, slip st in first ch – picot made, *dc in next 3 sts, picot; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st.
Fasten off. 
Repeat Row 26 in unused loops of beginning ch on other long side, turn piece 90 degrees to work along short side.
Side Edging
Row 1: Ch 3, work 50 tr spaced evenly along short edge; turn—51 tr.
Row 2: Ch 3, 2 tr in first st, *skip 4 tr, 5 tr in next tr; repeat from * to last 5 sts, skip 4 tr, 3 tr last tr; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, 2 tr in same st, *skip 4 tr, (3 tr, picot, 2 tr) all in next tr; repeat from * across to last 5 sts, skip 4 tr, 3 tr in top of beginning ch-3. 
Fasten off.
With Right Side facing, turn work and repeat Side Edging Rows 1-3 on other short side.
WRAP
Ch 164.
Row 1: Tr in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn — 161 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first tr), tr in each st across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 4), skip first 4 sts, *dc in next st, ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) all in next st, ch 3, dc in next st, ch 4, skip next 3 sts, tr in next st, **ch 4, skip next 3 sts; repeat from * across, end at **; turn.
Row 4: Ch 7 (counts as dc and ch 4), dc in next ch-5 space, *ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, dc in 4th ch of ch-4, ch 3, (dc, ch 5, dc) all in next tr, ch 3, dc in first ch of ch-4, ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * across to last ch-3 space, ch 4, tr in 3rd ch of ch-7; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, dc in first tr, ch 4, dc in next dc, *ch 4, skip next ch-4 and ch-3 spaces, dc in next ch-5 space, ch 4, skip next ch-3 and ch-4 spaces, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to ch-7 space, ch 4, dc in 3rd ch of ch-7; turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, *4 tr in next ch-4 space, tr in next dc; repeat from * across; turn — 161 tr.
Row 7: Repeat Row 2.
Row 8: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 2), skip first 3 sts, 3 tr in next st, ch 2, skip next 3 sts, *dc in next 3 sts, ch 2, skip next 3 sts, 5 tr in next tr – fan made, ch 2, skip 3 tr; repeat from * to last 4 sts, dc in last 4 sts; turn.

materials: RED HEART® “Light & Lofty®”: 1 Skein each 9312 Onyx A, 9316 Puff B and 9965 Zebra Stripe C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Wrap measures 16 1/2” x 77”.
gauge: 8 sts = 5.5”; 5 rows = 5.5” in dc pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FIRST STRIP: With A, ch 10.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn = 8 sts.
Rows 2-68: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc between first 2 dc, [dc between next 2 dc] 5 times, dc between next dc and beginning ch; turn – 8 sts.
Fasten off. Place a marker around the post of the last dc worked.
2ND STRIP: Work same as First Strip with B, marking the last dc as before EXCEPT odd number rows are right side.
MIDDLE SECTION-Row 1: Working across long edge, with right side of First strip facing, join C around post of marked dc, * ch 5, skip next row end, sc around post of next row end; repeat from * to last row; ch 5, sc around last row end; turn.
Rows 2-4: Ch 5, sc in first ch-5 space, * ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from* across; turn.
Joining Row-Row 5: Ch 2, sc around post of marked dc of 2nd Strip, ch 2, sc in first ch-5 space, * ch 2, skip next row end on 2nd Strip, sc around post of next row end, ch 2, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * across; ch 2, sc around last row end of 2nd Strip. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Big Donut™ O’Go™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 502 yds/459 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size fits all. Approx 38" [96.5 cm] wide x 75¾" [192.5 cm] long.
gauge: 15½ sts and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Moss St Pat (includes sc and ch-1 sps).
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D and E.

SHAWL
Using separated O’Go sections: 
*With E, ch 21. With B, ch 21. Rep from * twice more. With E, ch 22. 148 ch. See Stitch Diagram on page 3.
Proceed as follows, using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3:
Set-up row: (RS). Beg at Right Front edge, using separated O’Go sections of E and B: With Color 1, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 10 times. *With Color 2, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 10 times. With Color 1, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 10 times. Rep from * to end of chain. 147 sts (sc and ch-1 sps). Turn.
Proceed in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (WS). With Color 1, ch 1. *With Color 1, 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. 1 sc in next sc.** With Color 2, 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row, ending last rep at **. Turn.
2nd row: With Color 1, ch 1. *With Color 1, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc.** With Color 2, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row, ending last rep at **. Turn.
3rd to 8th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows, 3 times more.
9th row: As 1st row.
10th row: With Color 3, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
11th to 20th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows, 5 times more.
Cont in Moss St Pat as follows, using A as Color 1, C as Color 2 and E as Color 3:
21st to 30th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows, 5 times more.
31st row: With Color 3, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
32nd row: As 2nd row.
33rd row: As 1st row.
34th to 41st rows: As 32nd and 33rd rows, 4 times more.
42nd row: As 2nd row, with D as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
These 42 rows form Moss St Pat.
Using D as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 1st to 20th rows of Moss St Pat.
Using A as Color 1, C as Color 2 and E as Color 3, work 21st to 41st rows of Moss St Pat.
Using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 42nd row of Moss St Pat, then 1st to 11th rows.
***Keeping cont of Moss St Pat, divide for Shoulder, Armhole and Body as follows:
Right shoulder: 1st row: (RS). Pat across 28 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat for 2 rows more.
Body: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 45 sts for armhole. Join Color 2 with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Pat to end of row. Turn. 
Cont even in pat for 2 rows more.
Next row: (Joining row - WS). Pat across 74 sts across Body. With Color 2, ch 10 for armhole. With Color 1, ch 21 for armhole. With Color 2, ch 14 for armhole. Pat to end of row across shoulder sts. Turn.
Next row: Pat across 28 sts. With Color 2, (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 7 times. With Color 1, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 10 times. With Color 2, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next ch. Pat to end of row. Turn.***
Using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 17th to 20th rows of Moss St Pat.
Using A as Color 1, C as Color 2 and E as Color 3, work 21st to 41st rows of Moss St Pat.
Using D as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 42nd row of Moss St Pat, then 1st to 41st rows.
****Using A as Color 1, C as Color 2 and E as Color 3, work 42nd row of Moss St Pat, then 1st to 20th rows.****
Using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 21st to 25th rows of Moss St Pat.
Left shoulder: Rep from *** to ***, using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3.
Using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 31st to 41st rows of Moss St Pat.
Rep from **** to ****.
Using D as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 21st to 41st rows of Moss St Pat.
Rep from **** to ****.
Using E as Color 1, B as Color 2 and C as Color 3, work 21st to 41st rows of Moss St Pat. Fasten off.
Vertical Surface Sl St Lines:
With RS facing, join C with sl st to center sc of first Color 1 section at foundation row of Shawl. Keeping yarn at back (WS) of work, sl st into each ch-1 sp in alternate rows above to create a straight vertical line of surface sl sts up to opposite edge of Shawl. Take care to sl st loosely to avoid pulling in work as you stitch. Fasten off.
With D, rep Vertical Sl St Line beg in center of each Color 2 section at foundation row (3 vertical lines in B total), joining D as needed to cont on Back and other side of armhole.
With C, rep Vertical Sl St Line beg in center of each Color 1 section at foundation row (4 vertical lines in C total), joining C as needed to cont on Back and other side of armhole.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Tabby (68002) 9 O’Gos
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 40" [101.5 cm] wide x 34" [86.5 cm] long from shoulder.
gauge: 12 sts and 11½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in Sc/Ch-1 Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!

CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY

SIDE (make 2 pieces alike)
Beg at lower back edge, with 1st O’Go, ch 31. With 2nd O’Go, ch 32. 63 ch total.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 15 times. With 1st O’Go, (1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch) 15 times. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 62 sts.
2nd row: With 1st O’Go, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 14 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With 2nd O’Go, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 14 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: With 2nd O’Go, ch 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 14 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With 1st O’Go, 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 14 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Sc/Ch-1 Pat until work from beg measures 34" [86.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape Back Neck: Next row: (RS). Pat across 55 sts. Sc2tog (neck edge). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. PM at side edge of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Cont in pat over 55 sts until work from marker measures same length as Back, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Join Ruana Pieces (back seam): With WS facing both Halves facing tog, join any color with sl st and work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses to join (sc row will appear on RS). Fasten off.
PM 11" [28 cm] down from shoulders for armholes.
Join sides: With WS both pieces facing, join any color with sl st at marker. Work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses between marker to lower edge to join (sc row will appear on RS). Fasten off.
Rep for other seam.
NOTE: When working edging along lower edges of Back and Fronts, do not work sc into every st as gauge for plain sc differs from gauge for Body Pat.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join any color with sl st in lower left Back edge. Work in sc evenly around entire edge of Ruana, having 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (198 g/7 oz; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Aran (0313) 2 balls or 725 yds/660 m
Red Heart® Super Saver Stripes® (141 g/5 oz; 236 yds/215 m)
Contrast B Retro Stripe (4971) 3 balls or 725 yds/660 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 64" [162.5 cm] wide x 32" [81.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 13 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Stripe Pat
With A as Color 1 and B as Color 2, work 3 rows. 
With B as Color 1 and A as Colour 2, work 3 rows. 
These 6 rows form Stripe Pat.
SHAWL (See Diagram on page 2)
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st row: With Color 1, ch 3. 2 dc in ring. Ch 1. Join Color 2. Ch 1. 3 dc in ring. Turn. 
2nd row: With Color 2, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. Join Color 1. With Color 1, ch 1. 3 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn. 
3rd row: With Color 1, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to center ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. Join Color 2. With Color 2, ch 1. 3 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to beg ch. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn. 
4th row: With Color 2, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to center ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. Join Color 1. With Color 1, ch 1. 3 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to beg ch. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn. 
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until all 48 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. 
Fasten off.

materials: Crème de la Creme™: 6 (7, 8) balls 255 Tearose
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 12 dc = 4” [10 cm]; 4 rows = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet using smaller hook. 1 row dc and 1 row tr = 1¾” 4.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: LEFT BACK Starting at left side, ch 15. Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 14 sc. Row 2 (right side): Ch 3 (counts a dc here and throughout), skip first 2 sc, *V-st in next sc, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * twice, V-st in next sc, skip next sc, dc in last sc; turn – 4 V-sts. Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), (dc, ch 2) in each of next 3 ch-1 spaces, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in top of turning chain; turn. For Size Large Only Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2-3 once. For All Sizes Shape Armhole Row 1: Ch 3, skip next ch-1 space, V-st in each of next 4 dc, dc in 3rd ch of turning chain; ch 28 (31, 34); turn. Row 2: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 26 (29, 32) ch sts, sc in each st and each ch-1 space across, ending with sc in 3rd ch of turning chain; turn – 41 (44, 47) sc. Row 3: Ch 3, skip first 2 sts, *V-st in next st, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, V-st in next st, skip next st, dc in last st; turn – 13 (14, 15) V-sts. Row 4: Ch 4, (dc, ch 2) in each ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in top of turning chain; turn – 12 (13, 14) ch-2 spaces. Rows 5-8: Repeat Rows 3-4 twice. Shape Neck Row 9: Ch 3, skip first 2 sts, *V-st in next dc, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * 8 (9, 10) more times, dc in next dc, leave remaining sts unworked for Neck; turn – 9 (10, 11) V-sts. Row 10: Ch 4, (dc, ch 2) in each ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in top of turning chain; turn – 8 (9, 10) ch-2 spaces. Rows 11-13 (15, 17): Repeat Rows 9-10 for 1 (2, 3) times, then repeat Row 9 once. Fasten off. Designed by Ann Regis RIGHT BACK Work same as Left Back through Row 3 (3, 5). Shape Armhole Row 1: Ch 3, skip next ch-1 space, V-st in each of next 4 dc, dc in 3rd ch of turning chain, turn. Drop loop from hook. Join a separate strand of yarn in top of first st in Row 1 of Armhole Shaping, ch 27 (30, 33). Fasten off strand. Row 2: Pick up dropped loop at end of Row 1 of Armhole Shaping, ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each st and ch-1 space across, sc in each ch of added ch; turn – 41 (44, 47) sc. Rows 3-8: Work same as Rows 3-8 of Left Back. Fasten off. Shape Neck Row 9: With right side facing, skip first 5 ch-2 spaces, join yarn in next dc, ch 3, *V-st in next dc, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * 8 (9, 10) more times, dc in last sc; turn – 9 (10, 11) V-sts. Rows 10-13 (15, 17): Work same as Rows 10-13 (15, 17) of Left Back. Fasten off. RIGHT FRONT Work same as Left Back through Row 1 of Armhole Shaping. Row 2: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 26 (29, 32) ch, hdc in each st and each ch-1 space across, end with sc in 3rd ch of turning chain; turn – 27 (30, 33) sc and 14 hdc. Row 3: Ch 3, skip first 2 sts, *V-st in next st, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, V-st in next st, skip next st, dc in last st; turn – 13 (14, 15) V-sts. Row 4: Ch 4, (dc, ch 2) in each of next 8 (9, 10) ch-1 spaces, (tr, ch 2) in each ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, tr in last ch-1 space, ch 1, tr in top of turning chain; turn – 12 (13, 14) ch-2 spaces, 9 (10, 11) dc and 6 tr. Rows 5-8: Repeat Rows 3-4 twice. Row 9: Ch 3, skip first 2 sts, *V-st in next dc, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * 4 (5, 6) more times, dc in next dc, leave remaining sts unworked for Neck; turn – 5 (6, 7) V-sts. Row 10: Ch 4, (dc, ch 2) in each ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in top of turning chain; turn – 4 (5, 6) ch-2 spaces. Row 11: Repeat Row 9. Fasten off Small. For Sizes Medium and Large Only Rows 12-13: Repeat Rows 10-11 once. Fasten off. LEFT FRONT Work same as Right Back through Row 1 of Armhole Shaping. Drop loop from hook. Join a separate strand of yarn in top of first st in Row 1 of Armhole Shaping, ch 27 (30, 33). Fasten off strand. Row 2: Pick up dropped loop at end of Row 1 of Armhole Shaping, ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st and each ch-1 space across to added ch, sc in each ch across; turn – 27 (30, 33) sc and 14 hdc. Row 3: Ch 3, skip first 2 sts, *V-st in next st, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, V-st in next st, skip next st, dc in last st; turn – 13 (14, 15) V-sts. Row 4: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 1 here and throughout), (tr, ch 2) in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, (dc, ch 2) in each of ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in top of turning chain; turn – 12 (13, 14) ch-2 spaces, 9 (10, 11) dc and 6 tr. Rows 5-8: Repeat Rows 3-4 twice. Fasten off. Row 9: With right side facing, skip first 7 ch-2 spaces, join yarn in next dc, ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, *V-st in next st, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * 4 (5, 6) more times, dc in 4th ch of turning chain; turn – 5 (6, 7) V-sts. Row 10: Ch 4, (dc, ch 2) in each ch-1 space across to last ch-1 space, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in top of turning chain; turn – 4 (5, 6) ch-2 spaces. Row 11: Repeat Row 9 of Right Front. Fasten off Small. Sizes Medium and Large Only Rows 12-13: Repeat Rows 10-11 once. Fasten off. With right sides facing, whipstitch center back seam. Whipstitch Fronts to Back at sides and shoulders. SKIRT Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn on bottom edge of Back at center seam, ch 1, work 35 (39, 43) sc evenly spaced across to side seam, work 35 (39, 43) sc evenly spaced across to bottom edge of Right Front, starting in bottom left-hand corner of Left Front, work 35 (39, 43) sc evenly spaced across bottom edge of Left Front to side seam, work 35 (39, 43) sc evenly spaced across to center back seam; join with slip st in first sc; turn – 140 (156, 172) sc. Round 2: Ch 4, skip first 2 sts, *dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4 turning ch; turn – 70 (78, 86) ch-1 spaces. Round 3: Ch 3, dc in each dc and ch-1 space around, join with slip st in top of turning chain; turn. Round 4: Ch 4, dc in same st (counts as V-st), ch 1, skip next 3 sts, *V-st in next st, ch 1, skip next 3 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4, turn – 35 (39, 43) V-sts. Round 5: Ch 3, dc in each st and ch-1 space around, join with slip st in top of turning chain, turn – 140 (156, 172) dc. Rounds 6-9: Repeat Rounds 4-5 twice. Round 10: Ch 5, tr in same st (counts as Tr-V-st here and throughout), ch 1, skip next 3 sts, *Tr-V-st in next st, ch 1, skip next 3 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5; turn – 35 (39, 43) Tr-V-sts. Round 11: Ch 2, hdc in each st and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in top of turning chain; turn. Rounds 12-17: Repeat Rounds 10-11 for 3 times. Round 18: Ch 4, skip first 2 sts, *dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4; turn. Round 19: Ch 2, hdc in each st and ch-1 space around to last ch-1 space, work 2 (1, 3) hdc in last ch-1 space; join with slip st in top of turning chain; turn – 141 (156, 174) hdc. Round 20: Ch 5, tr in same st, skip next 2 sts, *Tr-V-st in next st, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5; turn – 47 (52, 58) Tr-V-sts. For Size Small Only Round 21: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 5, tr in same space, Tr-V-st in each of next 2 ch-1 spaces, *(tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next ch-1 space, Tr-V-st in each of next 3 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * 10 times, join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5; turn – 58 ch-1 spaces. For Size Medium Only Round 21: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 5, tr in same space, Tr-V-st in each of next 2 ch-1 spaces, *(tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next ch-1 space, Tr-V-st in each of next 3 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * 11 times, (tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next ch-1 space, join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5; turn – 65 ch-1 spaces For Size Large Only Round 21: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 5, tr in same space, Tr-V-st in each of next 2 ch-1 spaces, *(tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next ch-1 space, Tr-V-st in each of next 3 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * 12 times, (tr, ch 1, tr, ch 1, tr) in next ch-1 space, Tr-V-st in each of next 2 ch-1 spaces, join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5; turn – 72 ch-1 spaces. For All Sizes Round 22: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 5, tr in same space, [Tr-V-st] in each ch-1 space around, join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5; turn – 58 (65, 72) Tr-V-sts. Round 23: Ch 3, dc in each st and ch-1 space around, increasing 2 (1, 0) dc evenly spaced around, join with slip st in top of turning ch; turn – 176 (196, 216) dc. Round 24: Ch 4, skip first 2 sts, *dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4; turn – 88 (98, 108) ch-1 spaces. Round 25: Ch 3, dc in each st and ch-1 space around, join with slip st in top of turning chain; turn – 176 (196, 216) dc. Round 26: Repeat Round 24. For Sizes Medium and Large Only Repeat Rounds 25-26 for 1 (2) more times. RUFFLE Change to larger hook. Rounds 1-3: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 5, tr in same space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, *Tr-V-st in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5 – 44 (49, 54) Tr-V-sts. Round 4: Ch 4, skip first st, (dc, ch 1) in each st and ch-1 space around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 176 (196, 216) ch-1 spaces. Fasten off. FINISHING Drawstring With smaller hook, make a ch approximately 84 (90, 96)” [213 (228, 243) cm] long. Fasten off. Tie an overhand knot at each end of drawstring. Beginning at center back, weave one end of drawstring through eyelet round (Round 2) on either side of body to center front, then crisscross ends and weave through eyelets along front of each bodice. Tighten or loosen drawstring to adjust fit as desired. Tie drawstring in a bow at top of Front. Armhole Trim (optional) Round 1: For a tighter armhole, using smaller hook, join yarn at bottom of one armhole, ch 2, hdc evenly around armhole; join with slip st in top of turning chain. Fasten off. Repeat Armhole Trim around other armhole. Weave in ends.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6 oz; 288 m/315 yds)
Size H-8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx. 14 ins [35.5 cm] wide x 64 ins [162.5 cm] long
gauge: In pattern stitch, 16 sts = 4"/10 cm.
instructions:
SHAWL
First Half
Chain 66.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 4, sk next 3 ch, (sc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch, sk next 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), (sc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp, sc in next ch-4 sp, *ch 4, (sc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp, sc in next ch-4 sp; repeat from * across to last sc, ch 2, dc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *ch 4, (sc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp, sc in next ch-4 sp; repeat from * across, turn.
Rep Rows 2 and 3 until piece measures about 30"/76 cm from beginning; end with Row 3.
Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, *sc in next ch-3 sp, tr in next ch-4 sp, [ch 1, tr in same ch-4 sp] 4 times; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, *ch 3, sl st in sc just made (picot made), *[sc in next ch-1 sp, sc in next tr, picot] 4 times, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * across to last 2 sts; leave last 2 sts unworked. Fasten off.
Second Half
Row 1: With WS facing, working along opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with slip st in first ch (at base of first sc), *ch 4, sk next 3 ch, (sc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch (at base of first (sc, ch 3, 2 dc), sk next 3 ch, sc in next ch (at base of next sc); repeat from * across, turn.
Work Rows 2 and 3 of first half until piece measures same as first half; end with Row 3.
Edging
Work as for Edging of first half.
Finishing
Side Edging
Join yarn with slip st in corner, to work along long edge of shawl.
Row 1: Work sc evenly spaced along long edge. Fasten off.
Repeat along opposite long edge.
Using yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Changes™: 1 ball each 9855 Aquamarine A, 9403 Granite B and 9675 Jade C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Shawl measures 51” wide x 15” long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 dc = 4”; 5 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 106.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across – 104 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next dc, [Cluster in next dc, ch 5, skip next 4 dc] 20 times, dc in last 2 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, [5 dc in ch-5 space, dc in Cluster] 20 times, dc in last 2 dc – 124 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, [Cluster, ch 5, skip next 5 dc] 20 times, dc in last 2 dc.
Fasten off.
Row 5: Turn and join B in first dc, ch 3, dc in next dc, [5 dc in ch-5 space, dc in Cluster] 20 times, dc in last 2 dc.
Row 6: Repeat Row 4
Row 7: Repeat Row 3.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4
Fasten off.
Rows 9-12: With C, repeat Rows 5-8.
Fasten off.
Rows 13-14: With A, repeat Rows 5-6.
Fasten off.
Rows 15-16: With B, repeat Rows 5-6.
Fasten off.
Rows 17-18: With C, repeat Rows 5-6.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 dc, [5 sc in ch-5 space, sc in next st] 20 times, sc in last 2 dc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Fringe
Holding 1 strand of A, B and C together, cut 38 lengths of all 3 strands, each 30” long, for Fringe.
Holding 1 length of A, B and C together, fold length in half. Pull folded loop along first row edge. Pull ends through folded loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to add Fringe in each row edge on each side edge of Shawl.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Unforgettable™: 4 balls 3945 Parrot.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl measures 18” x 72” (18” x 54)”.
gauge: GAUGE: Motif = 6” wide. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook needed to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SHAWL
First Strip 
Main Motif 1
Make an Adjustable Loop.
Round 1: Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), V-st in each sc around; join with a slip st in first dc—8 V-sts
Round 3: Slip st in ch-2 space of first V-st, ch 2 (counts as dch here and throughout), (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, ch 1, *2-ch shell in next ch 2 space, ch 1; repeat from around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—eight 2-ch shells.
Round 4: Slip st in ch-2 space of first V-st, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same space, ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, *3-ch shell in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—eight 3-ch shells.
Round 5: Slip st in ch-2 space of first V-st, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same space, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2, *3-ch shell in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—eight 3-ch shells.
Fasten off leaving a tail long enough for weaving.
Main Motif 2 (joining on one side)  
Work same as Main Motif 1 through Round 4. 
Round 5: Slip st in ch-2 space of first V-st, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same space, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2, *3-ch shell in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2; repeat from * 4 times, [2 dc in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 1, slip st in ch-3 space of previous motif, ch 1, 2 dc in same ch-3 space on current motif, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2] twice, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off.
Main Motifs 3-12 (3-9)
Make and join 10 (7) more Main Motifs, joining to opposite side of previous Motif, same as Main Motif 2.
Second Strip
Motif 13 (10)
Work same as Main Motif 2, joining to 2 ch-3 spaces on side of Motif 1.
Motifs 14-24 (11-18) (joining on two sides) 
Work same as Main Motif 1 through Round 4.
Round 5: Slip st in ch-2 space of first V-st, ch 2, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same space, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2, *3-ch shell in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2; repeat from * twice, [2 dc in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 1, slip st in ch-3 space of previous motif, ch 1, 2 dc in same ch-3 space on current motif, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2] twice, [2 dc in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 1, slip st in ch-3 space of adjacent motif on previous strip, ch 1, 2 dc in same ch-3 space on current motif, ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2] twice, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off.
Third Strip
Motifs 26-36 (19-27)
Work same as Second Strip, joining each motif to previous motif and to motifs on Second Strip. 
Fill In Motifs (make and join 22 [16] in openings between 4 motifs)
Make a Magic Ring/Adjustable Loop.
Round 1: Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), slip st in sc between 2 shells on any Main Motif, ch 3, dc in same sc on current motif, *dc in next sc, ch 3, slip st in junction between 2 Main Motifs, ch 3, dc in same dc**, dc in next sc, ch 3, slip st in next sc between 2 Main Motifs, ch 3, dc in same dc on current motif; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first dc.
Edging Motifs (make and join 26 [20] in spaces between Main Motifs on sides of shawl)
Make a Magic Ring/Adjustable Loop.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—5 sc.
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), slip st in ch-3 space of first shell to the right of junction on any Main Motif on side edge, ch 3, dc in same sc on current motif, *dc in next sc, ch 3, slip st in next sc on Main Motif, ch 3, dc in same sc on current motif*, dc in next sc, ch 3, slip st in junction between 2 Main Motifs, ch 3, dc in same dc on current motif; repeat from * to * once, dc in next sc, ch 3, slip st in ch-3 space of next shell, ch 3, dc in same sc on current motif. Fasten off.
FRINGE
Cut 14” lengths of yarn and using 8 lengths for each fringe, attach 22 fringes evenly spaced across each short edge of shawl.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 706 Perfect Pink A
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay Fringe™: 1 ball 1969 Flirty B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl (before Fringe) measures 44” (112 cm) wide x 21.5” (54.5 cm) long
gauge: 3 shells and 3 sc in pattern = 5.5” (14 cm); 8 rows alternating shells and spaces in pattern =3.75” (9.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
With A, ch 4.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Skip 3 ch (counts as dc), 2 dc in 4th ch from hook; turn—3 dc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Beg V-st in first dc, ch 1, V-st in top of ch-3; turn—2 V-sts, 1 ch-1 space.
Row 3: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, beg V-st in same V-st, ch 1, V-st in next ch-1 space, ch 1, V-st in last V-st; turn—3 V-sts, 2 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, beg V-st in same V-st, ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space, shell in next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 3, V-st in last V-st; turn—2 V-sts, 2 ch-3 spaces, 2 sc, 1 shell.
Row 5: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, beg V-st in same V-st, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in 2nd dc of shell, ch 3, sc in 4th dc of shell, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, V-st in last V-st; turn—2 V-sts, 5 ch-3 spaces, 4 sc.
Row 6: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, beg V-st in same V-st, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, V-st in last V-st; turn—2 V-sts, 2 ch-3 spaces, 3 sc, 2 shells.
Row 7: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, beg V-st in same V-st, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in 2nd dc of shell, ch 3, sc in 4th dc of shell; repeat from * in remaining shells across, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, V-st in last V-st; turn—2 V-sts, 7 ch-3 spaces, 6 sc.
Row 8: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, beg V-st in same V-st, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *shell in next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * in remaining ch-3 spaces across, ch 3, V-st in last V-st; turn—2 V-sts, 2 ch-3 spaces, 4 sc, 3 shells.
Rows 9-44: Repeat Rows 7 and 8 (18 times)—2 V-sts, 2 ch-3 spaces, 22 sc, 21 shells.
Row 45: Repeat Row 7—2 V-sts, 45 ch-3 spaces, 44 sc.
Row 46: Ch 2, slip st in first V-st, *ch 3, [yarn over, insert hook in same space, draw up a loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook,** slip st in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across to last ch-3 space, then from * to ** once; slip st in last V-st—46 groups of sts. Fasten off.

FRINGE
Note: Open up the Sashay Fringe B to smooth it out, and work into the top edge without the fringe. Start 4” (10 cm) from the end, and work into every other loop on the top edge.
Hold B and Wrap with Right sides together. Starting at corner of Wrap, Insert hook under outside leg of V-st and through first loop of B, draw loop up of B to join; working evenly along first side of Wrap, *insert hook under next V-st on Wrap and pull up another loop of B and make a slip st; repeat from * across to bottom point of Wrap; in same manner, work into space under side of ch-3; rotate Wrap, work into space under side of dc; continue working evenly along second side of Wrap from * across to other corner of Wrap. Do not fasten off.
FINISHING
Trim B, leaving a 4” (10 cm) end, and use sewing needle and thread to sew the last loop of B to the Wrap to secure it. Fold under the end of B and tack it to the Wrong side to finish the end; repeat for other end. Weave in all yarn ends.

materials: Sugar Bush® Dawson™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 165 yds/150 m) Teal Trails (1314) 10 balls
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
measurements: One size fits all
gauge: 12 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat
instructions:
Note: Garment is worked in one piece from lower Back edge to lower Front edges.
Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.

Beg at lower back edge, ch 95. See diagram on page 5.
1st row: (RS). Work 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 94 sc. 
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. *1 dcfp around each of next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of the next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last 7 hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Turn. 
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last 7 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc between last st worked and next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Hdc2tog. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc between last st worked and next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc between last st worked and next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc on each of last 2 sts. Turn. 
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. 1 dcbp around next sp. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 
10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of last 2 sts. Turn. 
11th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. (Hdc2tog) twice. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. (Hdc2tog) twice. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
12th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 10 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc last st. Turn.
13th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next 2 sts. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 10 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc next hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 
14th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 posts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts.
15th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of 2 skipped sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
16th row: As 14th row. 
17th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dcfp around next st. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc between last st worked and next st. *1 dcfp around next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc between last st worked and next st. Rep from * to last 11 sts. 1 dcfp in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
18th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 10 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc last st. Turn.
19th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc first st. 1 dcfp in next st. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts. * 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 10 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tg. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in last st. Turn.
20th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 sts. 1 dcbp in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of the next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
21st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc first st. 2 hdc next st. 1 dcfp in next st. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc next st. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc next st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. 1 dcbp in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 2 hdc in next st. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
24th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 
25th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around skipped st. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of skipped 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around next st. 1 trfp around each of skipped 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 
26th row: As 24th row. 
Rep 7th to 26th rows once more, then 7th to 24th rows once. Do not fasten off.

Place st marker at center of Back on 47th st. 
Right Front: 1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around skipped st. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. * Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around 2 skipped sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * once more. Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around 2nd skipped st (leave first skipped st unworked). 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 46 sts.
Proceed over 46 sts as follows:
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 
Rep 7th to 26th rows as given for Back twice more, then 7th to 24th rows once. 
Band: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row twice more. Fasten off at end of last row. 
Left Front: 1st row: Join yarn with sl st to next rem st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around 2nd skipped st (leave first skipped st unworked). 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of skipped 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around next st. 1 trfp around each of skipped 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 46 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
Rep 7th to 26th rows as given for Back twice more, then 7th to 24th rows once. 
Band: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row twice more. Fasten off at end of last row. 
FINISHING 
Outer Sides edging: With RS facing join yarn with sl st to back bottom corner. 
1st row: Ch 1. Work in sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row twice more. Fasten off at end of last row. 
Inner edging: With RS facing join yarn with sl st to left front bottom. 
1st row: Ch 1. Work in sc along inner edging of Ruana. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 235 yds/215 m) Times Square (19006) 4 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] deep, excluding tassels.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. 
• Move marker each row to center ch-2 sp. 
SHAWL  
Ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn. 5 dc. 
2nd row: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 2 hdc in first dc. 1 hdc in next dc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next dc. PM on ch-2 sp for center. 1 hdc in next dc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn.  
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first hdc. Ch 1. (1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next hdc) twice. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 dc in last hdc. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each st to last ch 3. 2 dc in top of ch 3. Turn. 
6th row:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first dc. 1 hdcfp around each dc to center ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in ch-2 sp. 1 hdcfp around each dc to last dc. 2 hdc in last dc. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each st to center ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each st to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first hdc. Ch 1. *1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next st*. Rep from * to * to last dc before ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to * last 2 hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. 2 dc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 5th to 8th rows until Shawl from beg ch measures approx 30" [76 cm], ending on 6th row.  
Fasten off.
Tassel: (make 3). Cut a piece of cardboard 6" [15 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 20 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew Tassels to each point of Shawl.

materials: Red Heart® Hello Gorgeous™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 57" [145 cm] wide across top edge x 26" [66 cm] long.
gauge: 14 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in pat.
instructions:
SHAWL
With larger hook, ch 118 loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 59 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Skip first sc. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first ch and next sc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked. 58 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, as 3rd row. 57 sc.
6th to 109 rows: As 2nd to 5th rows. 5 sc at end of last row.
110th to 113th rows: Working in front loops only, as 2nd to 5th rows. 3 sc at end of last row.
114th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
115th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 2 sts.
116th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. 1 st.

Edging: 1st row: With smaller hook, ch 2. Sl st in next sc. Ch 3. Working in 2 loops in ends of rows, skip first row. Sl st in next row. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next row. Ch 1. Skip next row. Sl st in next row. Rep from * to last row. Ch 1. Sl st in last row. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. Sl st) in opposite side of first foundation ch. 39 sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Crochet Caught in a Haze Ruana
materials: Caron® Colorama Haze™ (8 oz/227 g; 649 yds/593 m) Fairy Gold (92004) 3 balls or 1849 yds/1690 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: One size fits all.
gauge: 14 single crochet (sc) and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Shawl is worked in 2 Panels from bottom front edge to bottom back edge and seamed together (tog) in Finishing.
PANELS  (make 2 alike)
Chain (ch) 70.
1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc and 34 ch-1 spaces (sps).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 stitches (sts). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until Panel measures 62" [157.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With last rows aligned and RS facing, sew Panels tog along center line to half-way (31" [78.5 cm]) mark as shown in diagram, making sure to hide seam.

materials: Red Heart® Roll With It Sparkle™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 561 yds/513 m) Pixie (9710)  3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 30" x 80" [76 x 203 cm]
gauge: 14 hdc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.
Ch 283 (multiple of 5 ch + 3). See diagram on page 2.
1st row:  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 281 hdc.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Ch 5. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. Ch 5. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *5 hdc in next ch-5 sp. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 6 (counts as tr, ch 2). Skip first hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. *Ch 5. Skip next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Ch 2. 1 tr in last hdc. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first tr. 2 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *5 hdc in next ch-5 sp. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 2 hdc in last ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in 4th ch of turning ch-6. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Ch 5. Skip next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. Ch 5. Skip next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 29½" [75 cm], ending on 6th row.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
